Reviews.Title: “LanieL”
Reviews.Author: Elaine L
Reviews.Content: I just spent three days at the Seaport Hotel on Seaport Blvd in Boston for a Sales Conference. This hotel just moved to the top of my list of best hotels (Mt. Washington Hotel, Bretton Woods, NH, The Hotel Viking, Newport, RI - Cliff House, Ogunquit, ME a few of my favorites). The Seaport Hotel is beautiful and very clean, the staff is wonderful and the food incredible. As an Event Planner the Seaport Staff made my job so pleasant. The hotel is so well located - easy to get to, great views of the harbor and Boston. Looking forward to going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ladies Weekend Ever”
Reviews.Author: Carrie V
Reviews.Content: My young daughter and I stayed at this hotel for a Ladies Weekend trip. I cannot rave enough about how well we were treated there. Staff was exceptional. Rates were reasonable. Premises were beautiful. Location was right where we wanted to be, but if needed a shuttle was available. Rooms were gorgeous and well-appointed. Lots of amenities. The trip was so successful that my daughter cried when she had to say good-bye to the staff. She told them that they had treated her like a queen.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: My husand, friends and I stayed at the Seaport Hotel in Boston for a night to enjoy the city as well as the boat show. We had such a wonderful time! The hotel was walking distance to the boat show as well as excellent restaurants in the area. Mr. Wood made our time so special in the Tamo Bar. He was friendly and very welcoming. The food was so delicious at the Tamo Bar and our breakfast was unbelievable. We definitely plan to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Seaport area is up and coming plus close to North End w Great Gym”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeChef
Reviews.Content: It is our third visit and we have seen many improvements. We came in for the flower show and the last time for wine show. This place is right across the street from the seaport convention center. Great new bar area, nice lobby where you can order something to eat or drink. Great room (get the harbor view). Our only complaint was that the seating area is facing away from the water (sofa back against harbor view). I have allergies so we got a pet free room with hypo allergenic pillows. What the hotel fails to market as an amazing feature is their gym. It is probably the best hotel gym we have seen. Not overwhelming with great design and amenities. We would stay here next time just because of the gym. Very clean with nice staff. Can't really ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Coco M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to walk into Boston, within walking distance is the Freedom Trail (you will pass Paul Reveres house), Quincy Market, Ferry stops, and many great restaurants. The hotel is very nice, and the staff is very friendly. Look in your closet if you need an umbrella, and leave your shoes out at night to be shined.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Brad M
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler who spends a lot of time in Boston. I've stayed in a number of hotels in Boston, and this is one of the best. The rooms are very nice; large and nicely equipped. I stayed in a suite, which was fantastic--very large, spacious actually with 2 rooms plus a bath and a half. The rest of the facilities are equally excellent. The location is good being right next to the water with only a 15-20 minute walk to the north end and downtown. However, as good as the facilities are, the outstanding thing about this hotel is the staff. Simply incredible. Very polite and responsive. And they have a no tip policy... they are serious about it too. I tried to tip a couple of staff and was politely declined. The staff is truly what makes this one of the best hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: jskim
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms and friendly staff made it a very nice family vacation. It was conveniently located near the Children's Museum and a public transportation. We requested and received two adjoining rooms because of the size of our party. Our five small children were thrilled to receive a free toy upon check in. They all loved the breakfast buffet and pool. Most of the guests were clearly business people, but the staff were friendly, made sure that we were welcome, and even remembered our group after our first visit to Aura, the hotel restaurant. We stayed for a few days and to ride the hotel charter bus to the aquarium, rode a water taxi which stopped at the hotel, and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Some of the furniture looked a bit worn and could have used updating, but the bathrooms were nicely updated, linens were plentiful and plush. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: sherryva
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for business & the little details made this a great stay! The hotel was very convenient to the airport - just a few minutes drive away. You can take a water taxi, but it was a bit chili for that. I had a king size, very comfy bed. They had a pillow menu, so you could order the type of pillow that's perfect for you. It was the little details that were an added bonus for me. Like the hand soap was in a full size glass pump bottle. The soap in the shower was a full size bar. The shampoo & conditioner was attached to a dispenser on the wall. They also had Keurig coffee maker with coffees, and teas. It had a small fridge. They had really big windows with a view of the dock. The only downside (for me) is that it's a bit pricey, but I guess you do pay for all of the details. They had a couple of places to eat on the property, along with a bar. They left a voicemail for me that if I'd flown in, they'd even print my boarding pass if I let them know at the front desk. Before I woke up, the copies of the boarding pass was slid under the door during the night. They called a cab for us. They have complimentary internet also. With every interaction with the staff, every single person was friendly and helpful. A GREAT stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: dandkm88
Reviews.Content: The seaport is a great option when visiting downtown Boston, especially the financial district. Great location situated near many downtown buildings as well as great access to some terrific restaurants within a few blocks and the North End only a couple of miles away. Over the last few years this neighborhood has completely changed and is now clean and safe. The Hotel has a nice lobby, very friendly service, and is very clean. The rooms are a little on the small side, but very modern and comfortable. I had a great view of the harbor from my room and I understand the other side of the hotel has great cityscape views as well. Double windows keep all rooms very very quiet. Self park garage had an elevator that opens directly to the lobby - vary convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional - Especially the People”
Reviews.Author: SunnyHill352
Reviews.Content: Stay here every year for the golf show. From Amir at the front door, to Taneha at the front desk, to Joey who handled my luggage, to Elizabeth at Aura, you feel like they care about your stay. They make you feel like "family" and are always looking to see if they can help you out and make your stay nicer. The fact that I took note of these people names should say enough!!!!! The rooms are nice and comfortable. The location is amazing with lots of restaurants and entertainment within walking distance. Thank you Seaport Hotel. I will definitely stay again next year!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Campton, New Hampshire, United States
Reviews.Title: “A+++”
Reviews.Author: Charlie W
Reviews.Content: The Seaport in Boston will certainly be on the Top of my list of places to Stay while in Boston. Room are spacious and very comfortable (Beds are fantastic!!) The TAMO restaurant and Bar have a very friendly and relaxed atmosphere while maintaining an elegance you see in most 5 Star Restaurants in Boston. Elizabeth in TAMO was the BEST, her friendly demeanor and attention to detail was amazing. Thank you to everyone at the Hotel, I will certainly be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good - not amazing - but very good!”
Reviews.Author: PDCE-85
Reviews.Content: Here at the Seaport on business. Had a very late check in and my sense was that they were oversold. They found a room for me, but had to move me at 9:00 am the next morning. But they DID send a porter to move my luggage, and as noted elsewhere, all employees were quite consistent about their "service included" policy! Very nice, indeed! As is the free internet - something you rarely find in an upscale, city hotel. My room was very nicely appointed. I somehow missed the pillow menu, though there was a nice selection on the bed, which also was very comfortable. My second room had a view of the World Trade Center and the harbor - a bit industrial at best, but worth requesting, I think. My business was at the World Trade Center, and the hotel is essentially connected (just across the street). Very convenient. It is also very close to the Silver Line which means you can get to South Station or Logan Airport very easily. Would be ridiculous to take a taxi to the airport when the Silver Line is right there. Why not five stars? Just not quite the five star ambiance. Would somehow expect something a bit more grandiose when you walk in the door. (Stopped by the nearby Renaissance to visit the Starbucks - VERY sleek lobby with a real artistic flair - Seaport doesn't have that.) And I'm simply not a fan of the Keurig coffee systems. Seems like a bad deal in terms of plastic waste, and I never quite get enough coffee! But... that all said, I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Would much prefer it, in fact, over a typical Westin or Marriott! Hope to go back to Boston with my wife to play. Would look at the Seaport first for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay at the Seaport”
Reviews.Author: tootsieandem
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Seaport for an overnight for our anniversary. The suite had a beautifull view of the harbor. We had a great dinner within walking distance and enjoyed cocktails by the fire back at the hotel. We were so surprised to find champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in our room when we got back. There were a variety of healthy food choices for breakfast. The manager was very attentive and friendly and really made us feel welcomed. We always stay at the Seaport but this time was especially fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great service & experience for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: bri0831
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from a Friday night through Sunday afternoon in February. I got a super deal on a room through Hotwire, at $102 per night (which I thought was great.) We had 2 double beds for 2 adults & 2 teens which was plenty. Great view of the harbor and World Trade Center Boston building across the street. We walked just over 1 mile to the New England Aquarium & Legal Seafood Restaurant. The concierge was excellent & saved us tons of time from waiting in line at the aquarium by purchasing a pass before leaving the hotel. Hotel was indeed family friendly as there were lots of families there (many with kids much younger than ours) Clean & serene! Would stay again. The self parking is great, it gets you unlimited in & out access from the underground parking garage for the duration of your stay. Can't say enough great things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Seaport!”
Reviews.Author: Celeste07
Reviews.Content: Recently I had to go to Boston on a business trip. My work in tourism marketing has me attending or participating in events to promote my region. The show was at the Seaport World Trade Center in Boston harbor and I booked a special rate room at the Seaport Boston Hotel. My 12 year old daughter came with me. Check in was smooth and easy. We had quite a few bags and I can usually handle that myself but a porter brought the stuff up. Service is included in the price, so thereâ€™s no tipping expected which was kind of nice. The room wasnâ€™t huge, but I didnâ€™t expect huge. What I did expect was clean, modern and nice and I got it. It had a Keurig coffee machine with a couple of choices of their Kcups, including tea. The bad thing that I discovered the next morning was that there was only one little packet of powdered creamer and sugar, barely enough for one cup, and not really a good one at that. I like my coffee light and sweet and despite the cool little machine, the coffee sucked. I would recommend that if you like coffee in your room in the morning and donâ€™t want to go out to get that first cup, you bring some cream with you somehow. My room did not have a refridgerator. Some nice touches included the two very plush terry robes, a special black towel in the bathroom to wash off makeup and the shampoo and conditioner wall dispensers in the shower. If youâ€™ve ever tried to stretch one tiny bottle of shampoo over two or three people, youâ€™ll recognize that this is a wonderful thing. I usually pack my own shampoo and conditioner for this very reason. It was plentifully dispensed. Beds were very comfortable, with nice cotton sheets and duvet and an extra blanket. They actually have a â€œpillow libraryâ€� according to their website where you can go an select the type of pillow you prefer. I didnâ€™t see it mentioned anywhere in the room, though, or anywhere in the hotel for that matter, only on the website. The view from our room wasnâ€™t very nice. Being that we were right across from the harbor, I would have loved a nice water view, lights twinkling on the horizon and all that. I do understand the fact that a building has four sides and only one can face the water and there are only so many of those rooms available. Add to that the fact that I got a discounted room because of my affiliation with the show and well, I suppose I should be happy we could at least SEE the water. We did get a 9th floor room, though, which was pretty cool. A couple more notes on the room; perhaps Iâ€™m used to staying at hotels that are more family oriented but two things would have been great: a small refrigerator and dare I say, a microwave. I know thatâ€™s pushing it. Our bottled water got warm and our dinner doggy bags got cold. Something I really appreciated was the flat screen TV with easy to clean remote (have you read about how disgusting hotel room remotes are?) and the free wifi with no password/login was great. Something that wasnâ€™t so hot was that our room was near the ice machine and the housekeeping station, also near the elevators, so it was noisy, people coming and going all night and early in the morning. I suppose SOMEONE has to have the room near all that, but it would have been better had it not been me. As a woman travelling with a child, those voices and bumps in the night have a way of disrupting sleep. I had read reviews about the indoor pool being really small and it was. It was obviously catering to the guests that come for business and want a workout swim along with their use of the gym. The night we went, however, we pretty much had the pool to ourselves, and swam for quite a while. I noticed that the hotel was promoting a school vacation special â€“ pool, play, breakfast, etc â€“ and while I applaud their outreach to this market, I think any parents coming here thinking they could unleash the kids on the pool for the afternoon would be disappointed, or rather, the kids would be. Iâ€™ve got to say this, though: the ladies locker room was FABULOUS! Ok, I only went in to use the bathroom and didnâ€™t take full advantage of it all, but really . . . nice finished wood lockers and cubes for stashing your stuff, wall dispensers for lotion â€“ a really nice touch that I wish all locker rooms would provide â€“ hair dryers, plenty of counter space and mirrors (magnified ones, even!) and large roomy showers. One more note about the gym at the Seaport Bostonâ€™s gym; at the entrance, they have a large glass container with lemon water. I thought this was a nice treat. I would have appreciated it more had I actually used the gym for a good workout but nonetheless had a couple of cups worth while sitting by the pool. The next morning, given my no cream experience of the day before, I did something Iâ€™ve never done, ordered room service. Just a small pot of coffee with cream and sugar. It arrived early, around 7:30 and was the perfect amount for me. Two little pitchers of cream, nice cups, all was good. The room service order form said it was $6.25, which I figured was better than two grande lattes at the cafÃ©, but when I got the bill upon check out, it totaled over $11 after the gratuity, room taxes and other crap was added. Lesson learned: perhaps it wasnâ€™t better than two grande lattes. Easier, but not cheaper. A couple more things; check out is at noon and I had to work at the show until 1pm so I asked the front desk if I could possibly have a late check out and was given until 1:30, a courtesy that I appreciated. It just eased my mind and allowed me to avoid some morning hassle of checking out, loading up the car, finding something for my daughter to do while I was at the show, etc. When I left the show and came back to the hotel, I had a very heavy box of brochures that I was taking with me. The concierge offered to keep them at his station so that I didnâ€™t have to carry them up to the room and then down with my luggage and kid in tow. Just a little thing, but certainly labor saving and appreciated. Overall my experience at the Seaport Boston Hotel was a good one, and Iâ€™d be happy to recommend the place to others and will plan on staying there for next yearâ€™s show. http://celestecota.blogspot.com/ www.celestecota.com

Reviews.Title: “One night getaway for local family”
Reviews.Author: Celerychow
Reviews.Content: We live just 15 miles from Boston but took the school vacation week as a chance to spend one night in the city with my husband and 7 year old son. The hotel's indoor pool was the big lure for us. The pool is not very large though (15 x 40?) and sectioned off for three swimming lanes. For most of the families swimming it's a bit cramped and likely intrusive to those hotel guests who choose to swim laps. We also came across a couple of globs of hair in the pool, eww. The depth is 4.2' all around so no wading for little ones just one set of stairs in to the water. The rest of the spa and workout area looked great and was busy with hotel guests on the various workout machines. We had lunch across the street at Jerry Remy's a relatively new sports-type bar. On a Saturday afternoon, there was a 15 minute wait for a table; the place was hopping. The food was sports-food type with burgers and wraps. A wee bit loud with TVs everywhere and music but it is what it is. The views were great with lots of windows overlooking the water. The Seaport area is a bit removed from the rest of the city. It's walkable to the downtown on a nice day but we opted for a $9 cab ride to the North End for dinner and desert. No problem getting a cab in either direction. Hotel breakfast was excellent and the service was attentive and friendly throughout the hotel. Overall, we would stay here again for an overnight visit but between the hotel rate, taxes, meals, and parking (and additional $32/day) it really adds up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Thaiany
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Boston, but our first time at the Seaport Hotel. We loved our experience and would definitely return. It's about a 20-25 min walk to Quincy Market and close to subway stations. The pillow menu is awesome! Breakfast was good, but a bit pricey ($20 per person for the buffet). Parking is expensive, but probably average for anything in Boston. Overall, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Boston Harbor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Atomique
Reviews.Content: I had to come to Boston for a convention and a few meetings so I stayed at the hotel connected to the convention center. The Seaport is a very nice hotel. It was really convenient to the convention center. Not really much going on in that area at night. Nice lobby. Great staff. Decent bar/restaurant and a good little coffee shop. We had a catered meeting/event upstairs and the meeting room was great, the staff was great and the food was fantastic. Workout room was good. My hotel room was kinda small, had a view of the museum down the street, nice bathroom with good amenities. Big clean comfy bed. Free paper and good speed wifi. Very nice hotel. Service was top notch and it was the perfect place to stay for the convention.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: marisu1217
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but it made me want to come back for more. We had one of the PURE rooms (allergy-free), overlooking the harbor. What a gorgeous view! The staff were very pleasant. Ordered room service that evening as the restaurant is closed on Mondays. Such wonderful food! Real gourmet fare, everything we had. And the next day we had the breakfast buffet -- delicious! The perfectly poached (veggie) Eggs Benedict (they also had the traditional version) and the delicious yogurt sundae, pancakes, home fries, two fruit compotes, lots of other choices -- it was worth the price. Fitness center and pool looked great, but time was short so we couldn't use them. Overall a great location, very comfortable room, luxurious bed linens, and superb service and food! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for good weather”
Reviews.Author: AHB58
Reviews.Content: Got a good AAA rate and enjoyed a weekend stay on the waterfront. Rooms are nice and a decent size. Loved the pillow menu. The restaurant was very good, but pricey. The parking was expensive but I guess that is par for the course in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Had agreat time!”
Reviews.Author: plusbabs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a very nice Saturday day trip which involved a black tie event hosted by my company. The facilities were excellent and the food served was very good with exceptional service provided by the hotel staff. I would recommend the Seaport for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: VT_business_traveler
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but the hotel was very nice; atmosphere, style, cleanliness, service. Little hard to find. GPS didn't "get" it. Catered event was well done. Food was very good. Only qualm was the fan noise in the bedroom. We could have shut it off but it was middle of Feb so it would have been cold. A foam pillow would have been nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Stress free event hosting!”
Reviews.Author: Joanmayo
Reviews.Content: Just want to Thank Leah Malin for putting together a great event for our company last week. Nothing was a problem and every detail taken care off. The event was a huge success and Leah a pleasure to work with. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “First stay at the Seaport and was very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: kaye0712
Reviews.Content: Well, I came in for the World Travel Expo the weekend of Feb 10-12th. We stayed right across the street at the Seaport Hotel. I have to say I was impressed with the hotel. It was very clean. The hotel had shampoo and conditioner dispensers in the bathroom with pretty good quality shampoo and conditioner. I stayed in a double queen room on the 16th floor with a awesome view of the skyline and port. I liked it alot. I didn't pay for the room so I can't say anything about the price of the room. I was with a group of other travel agents. I will say that the prices of alcoholic beverages in the bar downstairs was crazy. 10.00 for a mimosa is nuts! We walked across the street to Dunkin Donuts for breakfast most of the time.. The shower was nice.. much like a waterfall .. It was soft and didn't have a whole lot of pressure but it was enough to do the job. The tub was quite large. My one complaint- the beds are too hard! They had a nice down comforter on the bed..but it was like sleeping on a rock lol.. The front desk was quick and responsive to requests for toothbrush/toothpaste as I ran out and forgot mine.. They also supplied us with extra coffee and creamers upon request.. Over all I enjoyed my stay and will most definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Once again, the Seaport delivered!”
Reviews.Author: Joe F
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Seaport in as many years, and I continue to be impressed with the property. It is a well manicured, comfortable hotel with fantastic service and attention to detail. I was warmly welcomed by Devin at the reception desk, given great dinner ideas by Betty at the Concierge desk and was guided through the tempting and delicious menu in Tamo, along with dead-on wine pairings by Dana the bartender. Thank you for making my stay so enjoyable! I am looking for an excuse to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable!”
Reviews.Content: Great property, just a short walk to the waterfront. This area of Boston has been nicely updated. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was perfect and the amenities were special - nice fluffy robes! Would definitely stay here again. The only downside was the exorbitant overnight parking fee, which should be steeply discounted for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: cacrane
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, views of the waterfront and great restraurants in walking distance. Nice rooms, all the hotel employees went out of their way to help. The concierge, Issian, was so helpful with maps and dinner reservations. We walk all over Boston from this locations. It was refreshing to be near the waterfront. We would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home ;)”
Reviews.Author: Davidbaeza
Reviews.Content: I stay at Seaport at least one week a month. Every time I arrive they are very gractious and welcoming. The location is excellent. Very close to the marina, downtown and airport. The food is very good. I regularly order their clam chowder and lobster roll sandwich. Be sure to visit Mario. He works in their restauran called Aura. He makes the best Latte i've ever had. Another mark of a great hotel is turnover. Every time I come back I am welcomed by the same smiling faces. They have fantastic and free wifi. There is nothing I hate more then getting charged $15 per day for wifi. In the evening I sit in the lounge with my laptop and have dinner, and the wifi excellent. The gym is one of the best i've to inside of a hotel. Indoor pool, plenty of cardio machines and free weights. The rooms are very clean and spacious, with great views of the ocean and the city. Whether traveling for business or pleasure, I highly recommend this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; not sure it's worth the money”
Reviews.Author: sjauchterlonie
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here for a nights stay for his birthday. It was nice, concierge gave us a free app voucher for the hotel's restaurant upon check in. We took advantage of that and grabbed a beer and a glass of wine with the app. Bartenders were more than accommodating. Room was nice, but nothing special. You're typical hotel room. It was clean, bathroom very clean as well. The bed was probably one of the most comfortable we've ever slept in. Nice hotel, lovely view and location. Not exactly in the heart of Boston but a ten min can ride to wherever you'd need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Seaport Boston nice hotel- showing wear”
Reviews.Author: marksvacation
Reviews.Content: About the 5th time we have stayed for business. There are a few other hotels locally like the Westin and Boston harbor Hotel. When we have tried driving in and tried to get our car in their parking lots, they have told us that there is parking and when we arrived there was no place for our car! Very frustrating. On all visits to the Seaport we have been able to park. Accommodations are expensive here but the restaurants in the hotel and the rooms have been good, not excellent but good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DrCo
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Seaport Hotel every year for the past 5 years and have been very satisfied. The proximity to the Boston Convention Center makes it an ideal place to stay for tradeshows and meetings. The hotel is very classy and well maintained. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The bar in the lobby is very lively at night, but in a pleasant way. There are many excellent restaurants within walking distance, so I cannot comment on the restaurants at the Seaport. What sets this hotel apart from many others in the area is the outstanding customer service. The bellman, Amir, greeted me with a very polite "welcome back" as he opened my car door. He was kind enough to reunite me with a jacket I had left behind in the lobby while checking in. He also offered to store all of my bags in my car at checkout as I had a full day of meetings to attend. The service didn't end there. Every single staff member I met with was very pleasant and accommodating. There is no tipping at the Seaport so these folks are not over the top with service just to earn a tip. Very refreshing. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShopperDJ
Reviews.Content: The staff is superior! Especially considering they don't allow tipping! No really! No tipping! So they were not being nice for tips. They really are nice! Hotel has some incredible views of the water. The hotel is so clean! If your mtg at the new convention center this is perfect. Del Frisco and legal seafoods are right down the street! Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: KO75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over in January for the AFC playoff game. It was a very beautiful hotel. The view of the harbour was beautiful. There was a Morton's right across the street and we had dinner there. Everyone was very friendly and prompt. If we go back to Boston we would definitely stay here in the future. (one note: this is in Boston...so it was an 1.5 hr drive to Gillett Stadium)

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: KimBux
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport for two nights - January 19 and January 20. Check in was quick and the staff was polite and helpful. My room was amazing - very comfortable! I love the little extras like the plush robes and the umbrella. The ONLY complaint I had was that the service in the bar on the night of the 20th was SLOW. We sat at a table in the bar for about 10 minutes before anyone looked at us. Other than that, everything else was perfect. I would definitely recommend the Seaport to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “In Boston for the Wine Expo”
Reviews.Author: capecodollie
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Seaport Hotel was a good one. We've stayed in several Boston hotels over the years and would put this one near the top in quality and value. Our only complaint, and it's a minor one, was a slight odor in the room. We didn't complain about it because it was so slight, in fact my wife didn't notice until I brought it to her attention. Our interaction with the staff was all positive. The bar staff was especially professional and we found them very friendly and outgoing on what was a very busy Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Harbour View in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: The Seaport Boston Hotel is a great hotel right on the water and near the convention center. It provides easy access to events at the convention center as well as quick access to the North End and Logan Airport. It is a very busy hotel if there is a show in town, so be sure to bring some patience with you. Lines are long, but staff are friendly and helpful. A short walk to Morton's Steakhouse makes for a great dining experience. Rooms are small but well appointed with comfortable beds, plus linens and toiletries by Gilchrist. Also a pretty good value for a prime Boston location.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: anitajd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight, as his company had it's annual party at the hotel. For a Boston hotel, I found the price to be very reasonable. The hotel was very pretty (still decorated for the holidays), clean, and our room was a very nice size, clean, well appointed. The bed was comfortable. Robes were included (love that!). And that's all the nice things I can say. Upon check in, the desk person was very pleasant and cheery, but she sounded very robotic in telling us about the hotel amenities. One thing that really makes me "like" a hotel I stay at, is the friendliness of the staff. I didn't find the staff friendly at all. The servers and bartenders at the party never smiled. One waitress was snippy with the people seated at the table when she brought out the wrong food. She "insisted" there were 3 salmons at the table, when no one ordered salmon. The look she gave us was that someone must have changed their mind and wanted the filet mignon. The following morning, hubby and I decided to try the brunch that the desk person at check-in raved about. Hubby *loves* going out for breakfast. The hostess didn't smile or welcome us. She asked us if we'd have the buffet or regular breakfast. We asked how much was the brunch buffet? Her response, "Um, I don't know---low 20's." She seated us, and our waiter wasn't very friendly either. And 2 waiters started to have an argument near our table. Although the food at the buffet looked nice, we opted to order just the omelettes (since it wasn't clear if omelettes were part of the buffet price). The breakfast was bland and tastless. The chef decided to make it healthy---no salt, no seasoning. The hotel has a "no tip" policy, but 18% is automatically added to the bill. Hubby hypothesized that the staff isn't motivated to be helpful and friendly since they won't get an extra tip. But this review isn't of the food--it's of the hotel. So, it has it's good points, and it's not-so-good points.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaVale12
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel in a very nice area. Good restaurants around the corner. Very friendly staff from front desk to restaurant and bar. The breakfast was excellent.. We stayed in a very good suite. Very clean and spacious. The kids loved the tvs on the bathroom mirrors! We had a very pleasant stay and would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Did not honor late arrival reservation”
Reviews.Author: JaninaBoston
Reviews.Content: Made late arrival reservation a month before with confirmation number. Arrived at night, after a long European flight to find they didn't have any rooms available. Don't take the chance of reserving here. They are known for over- booking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 3skippingtown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while at a conference and sight seeing in Boston. The hotel is nice and clean. I got a suite, which was small for a suite and not well lit, but the room was clean and had a refrigerator, nice views, and comfortable bed. The fold out couch was average. There is a restaurant / bar and coffee bar in th hotel lobby which were sufficient. The hotel is walking distance to other nice hotels. There is a very convenient subway stop in the hotel. Parking is expensive, but it is anywhere in the city. The hotel was fine, but a little expensive in my opinion. Also, there was a fire in the basement the night I was there and we were evacuated at 3 am in the cold of November. We were not compensated for that at all, just a "sorry." I guess that's okay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: seafoodben
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night for a short getaway. # Pros: - Very pet-friendly, allowed us to bring our dog, no extra fees. BIG PLUS for us. - Excellent and extensive gym, uptodate equipment. - Close to some good places to eat, 7-11 across the street, ICA right there, subway (blue line) couple of blocks down, very walkable to downtown Boston/Chinatown/South Station (~15 minutes). - Service was great, no complaints. - Room was very clean. # Cons: - Swimming pool is a 3 lane lap pool, small. - Parking is expensive (tip- if it's Sunday or a holiday, just park a few blocks down near the ICA at a meter, it's free). - Food in the 1st floor is very expensive. - Room was a bit expensive for what I thought we got (~ >$150 online), probably not worth the full price, but comparable to what is around the area. Overall, had a pleasant stay. This area is still developing, but it's a fun place now. I liked the location a little better than the Westin. Would stay here again, particularly because it is pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, not downtown”
Reviews.Author: bnkowalik
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a long weekend for a family outing the hotel accommodations were perfect without exception. The only draw back was the longish walk back down the port area to downtown. We were un-familiar with the transit system so just stayed on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you need to be in that area of Boston”
Reviews.Author: summerbeachmom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, and the room was clean, nice and comfortable. The location has a few restaurants near it but not much else, but I think there are trolley stops nearby if you want to buy a ticket for the sightseeing trolley and get around town.

Reviews.Title: “New modern hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: mljstravel
Reviews.Content: New clean modern hotel with very attentive staff. We were upgraded to a suite when travelling with our baby so we had a little more space. Free internet in the room too. Being close to the convention centre is its selling point for business. But it is a shame the area has nothing else to offer yet for family or visitors. It is a bit of a hike into town, especially in cold weather, and there are limited eating options in the area yet. Probably will change over the years. Otherwise, a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great staff, boring location”
Reviews.Author: Britontherails
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. I was travelling alone for business and I found the staff to be really helpful... consistently. The free wifi and no-tipping policy was great esp. as the extortionate wifi and ridiculous tip culture are things that consistently annoy me about hotels in the States. I paid a tiny bit more for a room with a view and it was great. Brilliant view and a nice seating area, even though the room itself was quite small. Room service was quick, and decent, and not too expensive. There are a few nice restaurants nearby, but the hotel's a bit out of the way, although it is convenient for the airport. The concierge was great, she even put me in the hotel car to a meeting free of charge... hugely appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bigtime7779
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was very nice and is a good value for Boston. I stayed here for a friendâ€™s wedding in a Deluxe King bed room. The entire hotel is very clean and the lobby was very big with many chairs and couches to relax on. The room was also very clean and was pretty spacious with 2 chairs, a small table and a very long desk. The lights must have been the modern CFL bulbs because they always took a little while to turn on. The bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable. The bathroom and shower were average, but the water pressure from the shower was very weak. The TV was a flat screen, but was pretty small, probably about 27â€�. The room had a nice iLive iPod alarm clock dock, an iron, ironing board, hair dryer and very good coffee maker. The only trash can I could find in the room was in the bathroom and it was very small. There wasnâ€™t a door tag for maid service, but instead they had an electronic button you could push for either â€œMake Up Roomâ€� or â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� which was the first time I had ever seen one of those. The service throughout the hotel was pretty good and they allowed us to use the conference room for a pre-wedding poker game, so that was incredibly nice of them. The hotel location is very good since itâ€™s right near South Station and Logan airport. The harbor is just outside the building and itâ€™s a short walk to some great local bars, including Whiskey Priest, Atlantic Beer Garden and Jerry Remyâ€™s. As nice as this hotel is, there were a few things I didnâ€™t like about it. It was hard to find the actual hotel and underground parking garage upon entering the area. The self-parking fee of $32/night and $42/night for valet is outrageous. I know itâ€™s Boston, but that was about 25% of the room cost! Itâ€™s also confusing trying to park under the correct building with the East and West underground parking garages, as they werenâ€™t clearly marked with what building was above them. Getting into the hotel was also hard because there were two handicapped power-operated doors on each side that were awkward to get through and just a turning door in the middle that was very hard to push. The doormen never seemed to provide much help. There are 4 elevators in the building, yet it still took forever for them to come around. And the worst part about this hotel is that every time I bought a beer at the bar, they included the tip in the cost. It doesnâ€™t get more presumptuous than that. I always tip well for good service, but I canâ€™t stand being told what I should tip or that the tipâ€™s already included in the cost. Iâ€™ll tip what I want to tip based on the quality of service I receive. Other than that, the restaurant/bar itself was pretty fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - does everything right!”
Reviews.Author: Dave C
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spotlessly clean, food was good, staff were friendly... no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Tradeshow Trip”
Reviews.Author: Dots039
Reviews.Content: Attended a tradeshow and stayed here. It was wonderful being so close to the venue so I did not have to drive in Boston. The hotel was fablous. Loved the recycling and the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Best Lodging on Boston Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Lesliefreda
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Seaport Boston Hotel many times and it is always astounding how excellent the room, service, restaurants, on-site spa/swimming/exercise and nearby walking paths, restaurants and sight-seeing opportunities. The staff at the Seaport are what makes it so great!!! Whether checking-in, dining, enjoying your immaculately clean room, or consulting the concierge, you are always treated like Royalty. I've stayed for business and for family vacation, and it is always a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GMTito
Reviews.Content: Spending a long weekend in Boston we stayed at Seaport and we did a great decision, spacious and very well equiped rooms, excellent Gym and pool, excellent Thanksgiving dinner, and the best is the staff, great attitude and so friendly with everyone, from the doorman, reception, housekkeping, and restaurant, all great. Well done we will be back. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Management doesn't care about security”
Reviews.Author: balhui
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very pretty, and we enjoyed the fact that it is truly a no gratuities accepted facility. However, after staying at the hotel, we discovered that we had become the victims of identity theft, and we were able to trace the transactions back to the hotel based on our pattern of usage and the credit card information that was stolen. When we alerted the hotel, however, we were given a total runaround and treated as if the issue was solely our problem. We advise avoiding this hotel because they don't care about this important security issue. If you do stay there, check your credit card statement carefully--they also charged us for water we didn't drink and placed a $50 hold on our card that eventually was removed, but it was still an odd charge in today's electronic market.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Patriots Game”
Reviews.Author: SaskatchewanTravelle
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went down to Boston for the MNF game featuring the Patriots and Chiefs. We stayed at the Seaport because of its proximity to South Station. This hotel was extremely clean, well kept, and in a safe location. The staff was extremely helpful when asked questions about the area, and there were always cabs waiting outside. We did not pay for the harbour view room, but still had a harbour view, so don't waste the extra money. The beds were also extremely comfortable, and there is a fridge and safe in the room. This hotel is only a ten minute walk from South Station, where you can catch the Patriots Train on gameday. I strongly recommend this train as a way of getting to the stadium. There is a 7-11 convenience store and Dunkin Donuts right next to the hotel, and just down the street there is a pub called the Whiskey Priest (excellent food) and a Sports Bar called the Atlantic Beer Garden (tons of high-def tvs, and cheap beer). The Barking Crab (best seafood in Boston) is also a short walk from this hotel. Overall, I strongly recommend this hotel because of its convenience to South Station, excellent service, cleanliness, and the amenities around it. If you are going to catch a Pats game, or are just visiting Boston, this hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “mandatory 18% gratuity for a breakfast BUFFET!!”
Reviews.Author: GoldenRetriever60795
Reviews.Content: I have never seen this before. No matter the size of your party, you are hit with a mandatory 18% gratuity on the $20 pp breakfast buffet. Yes, a buffet, NOT a served breakfast. Our waiter brought our party of three, coffee and orange juice, nothing more. There is no omelette station, it was 100% self-serve. Yet we were forced to pay 18% gratuity. This is the worst kind of gouging and there is no reason for it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Went Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Steven F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport for a business conference and found the staff to be particularily friendly. The little things like saying hello in the hallway and arranging a taxi at 3:30am. In particular Betty Salemme who kindly helped return a phone charger I left in my room. Great place for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Center Convenience”
Reviews.Author: chikletqt
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for the business traveler utilizing the convention center. There was a nice Keurig machine in the room and free wi-fi. Comfortable bedding. Some issues with noise between rooms and definitely in the halls- and I wear ear plugs. The mirror in the shower has a nice no-steam feature which is great for getting ready in the mornings. There are several restaurants and bars in the area, definitely for the travel crowds, not really any locals in the area. We used the free shuttle in the area that goes to State Street. There is a no-tip policy which I saw some of the employees abide by, and others not. There is storage for your bags if you arrive early or stay late, and a business center to print your boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, excellent amenities and service”
Reviews.Author: AllycatCanada
Reviews.Content: Rooms were large and well decorated. Service was excellent. Very convenient to the convention centre. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: frugalcriticandmom
Reviews.Content: Close enough to convention center to walk (weather was fine - wouldn't want to do it on a very rainy day...). Didn't really do anything but sleep there. It was clean and the staff was nice. I had to call because the message about my allergies to feathers wasn't relayed from conference to hotel or missed (I bet it would have been ready if I had called the hotel directly.) Wall Street Journal was supposed to be delivered in the mornings but they missed me the first two days.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: LateBookMark
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport for a conference at the end of October 2011. It was my second stay. It is a fantastic hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it if you are in Boston on business. A few things I really liked: There is a no tipping policy. As a European, even though I tend to be overgenerous when I tip, staff assume that I won't in bars and restaurants etc and they treat you less well. The Seaport's no tipping policy means that everyone is treated the same way. The staff are amazing and *nothing* was too much trouble. The breakfast was excellent. The toiletries are definitely worth taking home. One thing I really, really liked: I read recently that if you are in a hotel and ask the concierge for, 'an extra pillow' it is secret code for you want a visit from a lady of the night. At the Seaport, if you ask for, 'an extra pillow', you actually get - an extra pillow - or two. It is the only hotel that I have ever stayed in that has a PILLOW LIBRARY. They stock buckwheat pillows, goose down, duck feathers, Swedish memory pillows, hypopallergenic pillows, and my personal favourite (after extensive research) the water pillows. I was also really impressed that I tweeted about the pillow library when I was in the UK before my flight. They tweeted back and asked me what pillows I wanted when I arrived. They were there waiting for me. It is the little things that make a big, big, difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: samttech
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport Hotel for a conference, but I will now definitely return for work or pleasure! I loved the waterfront location, the proximity to the convention center, and the staff. Breakfast was piping hot, and Dana at the Tamo Bar was fantastic! Attentive, knowledgable, warm and inviting! I look forward to coming back to Boston and staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Good time, will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: rh-chi
Reviews.Content: Overall great hotel and service. We liked the no tipping policy (service included). Roomy, clean rooms. Location was ok, removed from most sites by a couple of Miles, but still ok. We walked everywhere. Being next to the water was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great room; be sure to check your bill”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseyTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, well thought-out rooms. The bathroom has large counters to hold your toiletries and includes a nightlight, something I've often thought other hotels should have. The included wifi was easily accessed, and the Keurig coffee maker was better than most. Everything was very clean. The only problem we encountered was with our express checkout bill...the room rate for the second night of our stay was $72 higher than it should have been. It was taken care of after a wait in the checkout line, but our friends, who didn't check their bill too carefully, realized when they got home that they had been charged $8/ more per night than their reserved rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for close to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: MRCN
Reviews.Content: Solid hotel very close to the convention center which is a 5 minute walk. Free wifi and printing. Primarily a business hotel. We walked all over town from there but most would take a cab to get to other parts of the city. Very nice people working there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for business traveler and tourist”
Reviews.Author: BarbarellAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: My hubbie and I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights for a conference. The conference venue is next to the hotel, conveniently connected to each other by a walkway bridge. The hotel is very nice with big rooms. Lots of extra services, free wifi, swimming pool and friendly staff. Although you can take a taxi or public transport to the inner city, you can easily walk there within 10 minutes. The hotel is next to the water, you can also take a watertaxi and have excellent fun and views from boat. Hotel restaurant deserves mentioning since they offer great food, with lots of healthy choices instead of only hamburger sliders and fries. Close to the hotel are several good restaurants to enjoy the local fish specialties. All in all, great value for money on excellent location, for both business traveler and tourist.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: IrelandFirstClass
Reviews.Content: From the second we arrived to the second we left - everything was perfect. Special mention to Betty the best concierge in the world. Each and every member of staff we came in contact with went above and beyond to make our stay exceptional. This is my No 1 hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: C1arkz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights to attend a conference being held at the hotel. Arrived very late and was checked in quickly and efficiently. Rooms are very clean - not the most modern but very clean. The staff I encountered were awesome - courteous and nothing was too much. Exceptional stay and loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alpine66
Reviews.Content: This is a big hotel with excellent business facilities. Location is great, service impeccable. Super clean and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Seaport Boston a convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: uvm366
Reviews.Content: New hotel in a rapidly developing area of Boston. Well appointed room. Friendly staff and a no tipping policy. Very convenient to the convention center and easy public transportation to the city center

Reviews.Title: “Nice views”
Reviews.Author: Autumn814
Reviews.Content: Rooms are average but views are nice. The location is good for anything in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Wedding Block + Wedding Festivities!”
Reviews.Author: Carlene M
Reviews.Content: My mom and I worked with the Seaport Hotel, specifically Brian Simeral, in planning our wedding block, rehearsal dinner reception and post-wedding brunch at the Seaport and it was a wonderful experience for us and our guests! We did not have the actual wedding there but all the other wedding related events took place there and I was impressed with how responsive and helpful Brian was throughout the planning process- even responding on nights and weekends to our many questions and requests. He was very helpful in getting us a great suite for the bridesmaids to get ready in and making sure the "VIP" bridal party guests all had rooms near us and early check-ins. The food at our rehearsal reception and the post-wedding brunch was excellent. It was also really cool to be able to hook up our xbox and play Rock Band in the Tamo Loft next to the bar for our rehearsal reception- it was so much fun and they have a great A/V system in there! They also let me use the dance studio on saturday night for an impromptu bridesmaid dance choreography session and brought all the welcome bags to the room without a charge (i'd heard many hotels charge a fee for this service). The hotel itself is gorgeous and modern, very classy- I will recommend it to any out of town guests looking for a place to stay in Boston and would suggest it for your next event. Oh and the guests are still talking about their "pillow bar" where you can select from like 10 different pillows at no charge- I loved my water pillow!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: I was at the Seaport for a business conference (October 2011). My room was very comfortable, and the service was outstanding. For my business trip I had quite a few little things come up...I needed toothpaste, or help with (free) Wifi, or wanted a different blowdryer...no matter what my request, the Seaport staff was extremely professional and courteous, and the service was outstanding. My bed was comfortable, the shower was relaxing, the gym was very nice. The food was delicious and room service arrived more quickly than I ever expected. I can honestly say the staff went out of their way to improve my experience. I enjoyed the stay very much -- would definitely recommend the hotel and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accomodations in a seaside hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carleen45
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on other reviews - only for one night before leaving on a cruise. It is a lovely location with a lot of good restaurants within walking distance. The hotel staff is incredible. Before coming, we emailed the concierge with questions, and she responded promptly with very complete answers. Everyone was very friendly and helpful - the bellman would not accept a tip for bringing up our luggage. I had recently broken my hand, and the concierge was able to find a hair appointment for me since I couldn't not do it myself. All in all it was a very pleasant experience and I highly recommend it. Another benefit is that you can take a water taxi from the airport for only $10 each.

Reviews.Title: “Seaport Hotel, Boston - Family Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: coolgirl_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seaport hotel in Boston's vibrant & bustling Waterfront area for my sister's wedding the weekend of July 10th, 2011. As new parents, my husband and I were very pleased that the hotel offered a crib or pack n play for our daughter, and the hotel staff, bellmen and valets were very helpful and friendly. I chose The Seaport, as I had stayed at the hotel for business and knew it would be an excellent choice for my sister's wedding guests, for many reasons, most notably: the staff are very professional and accommodating, for it's central Boston location, newly remodeled decor, in-house restaurants - Tamo bar (great for evening drinks), bakery/cafe (Starbucks coffee & great sandwiches) and Aura restaurant, modern gym & spa with indoor pool (great for cold winters!)... and proximity to Logan airport, public transportation and great new restaurants and bars! The wedding block room rate was excellent & an affordable for a prime Boston location, and the sales staff offered the Bride a lovely suite with living room area which was perfect for getting ready the day of the wedding. Also, the grounds are well manicured and we took many of my sisterâ€™s bridal photos in and around the hotel and on the Harbor. I canâ€™t say enough about the Seaport Hotel...it is the perfect Boston destination, whether you are in town for business, pleasure, a wedding or family travel!

Reviews.Title: “understated elegance in the financial district of beantown”
Reviews.Author: yanks105
Reviews.Content: If you're heading to Boston try something a bit different and stay at the Seaport Hotel in the beautiful relatively new financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenn1125
Reviews.Content: The location is great - close to airport and near good restaurants. Walking distance of most sights. The rooms have always been exceptionally clean and comfortable. Service is great, even if the valet parking got somewhat confusing when we were checking in last time. This is our hotel of choice when we're in Boston. The fitness center and the pool area are exceptional. The front desk staff has always been pleasant, helpful, and accomodating. We look forward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Pilot Rooms are awesome, service not so much!”
Reviews.Author: Katrinar787
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the seaport and randomly got put in one of the "Pure" pilot rooms that are hypoallergenic, have air purifiers, special pillows, and all sorts of other fancy features (check their website for a better list) and I had the best night sleep of my life (with intense allergies I'm usually not comfortable in hotels, but this room totally catered to that). The room was so clean and comfortable and very aesthetically pleasing. The facilities are gorgeous and its in a great location right next to the world trade center/the water. The views from the restaurant are awesome and they had yummy (but relatively pricey) food. My only complaint is there is no tipping the staff (the front-desk lets you know on arrival) and I felt the staff didn't work as hard as a result of it. We got our own taxi out front, waited 15 minutes for someone to help us with our luggage, Etc. I will note it was a busy weekend at the hotel with multiple weddings, but for the price of the rooms I expected high quality service everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Seaport Area”
Reviews.Author: highcountrytraveler
Reviews.Content: This is very nice hotel in the Seaport area with a friendly staff. It is within walking distance of a number of nice restaurants and attractions, such as bay cruise boats. The rooms are nice and there is no additional charge for wireless internet access. The on-site parking, at $33/day, while high, is less expensive than typical Boston hotels. The hotel has good access to the Mass Pike, but it is not in the heart of downtown, which may be important to some people.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice FInd not great location”
Reviews.Author: ELSUSHI921
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with a no tipping policy. The rooms have lovely views and a bit small but everything you need is there. The staff is wonderful. I felt the bed mattress was not the best ever, It wasn't bad, but not a clould like feel at The Westin, etc. Also the walls are a bit thin so you do hear alot of noise on the floor and above and below you, not LOUD, but just enough to annoy you. We were there for a wedding in the hotel so it was an easy choice to make, but I do know Boston, and its not located well for touring, its nice if you have a function or a conference or something in that wharf area. I also was upset as in the morning we ran down for breakfast and it was half full, so I was told there was a 20 minute wait. I asked for a manager and told him we were hotel guests and it was unacceptable for us to wait 20 minutes because they did not have the staff to clean off the table. I suggesed he fill in and clean off the table so we could be seated quickly. He was not happy but we were seated within 3 minutes.. The Hotel is pretty and has a wonderful view and everything feels very new.. The bathroom was very good too with lots of room to place things. They gave robes also.

Reviews.Title: “fine accommodations in lovely section of town”
Reviews.Author: robertSaltLakeCity
Reviews.Content: pleasant, clean, quiet hotel on seaport section of city, close to downtown

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel......service is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: JMo101172
Reviews.Content: I canâ€™t speak highly enough about the staff at the Seaport. From top to bottom they were truly phenomenal. Service was impeccable. Anything I (or my guests) needed was taken care of quickly and in such a high-quality manner. The sleeping rooms were large, comfortable and had many amenities. The bar was spacious and had plenty of seating for the whole group or small areas for a couple of people. Starbucks in the lobby area was key! The food was delicious. Betty at the Concierge Desk was so friendly and helpfulâ€¦..I loved talking to her. The front desk staff could not have been any more responsive to my needs. The meeting (Brian and all) staff was A++++ all the way. My guests could not stop raving about the meeting room space, food and how easy the whole thing was for them. I would HIGHLY recommend the hotel and meeting facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shopqwueen
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was nice for one person, with a comfy king sized bed. Convenient Kurig coffee machine in the bathroom. For the price, breakfast should have been included. Across the street from the T, but you have to transfer to other lines for most tourist attractions. The front desk personnel was uppity when I asked about getting a double bed room. This hotel has a dearth of double beds. But they did fax something for me for free and there were computers with internet for free too at the business office. I did not have a good experience in the hotel restaurant Tamo. The waitress was rude about the coupon they kept on giving out at the front desk. But since the tip is included in the check I guess she did not have to be pleasant. Do not get the Bostonian burger: it is a heart attack on a bun: burger with bacon and boston baked beans and fried egg! Good thing this hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants: Legal Seafood, Legal Test Kitchen, No Name and Yankee Lobster. My favorite thing about Boston was the relatively cheap lobster.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable. Attentive staff. Gorgeous setting.”
Reviews.Author: Andiamo_38
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a conference and I went sightseeing. The Seaport Hotel was very nice. It is right on the water and is just a step away from the Silver Line that takes you to the easy to use Boston subway called the "T". I also took a free bus that takes you from the seaport area to downtown Boston. The hotel is very comfortable and spotless. We did not have an ocean view but the room was pleasant and quiet. Restaurants close by are terrific."

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!!! Very classy!”
Reviews.Author: MKlady91109
Reviews.Content: The hotel was immaculate! Service is impecable! The food absolutely amazing! Loved every minute of our stay however the bed was not very comfortable! Best part tips are included... All tips! Awesome location to the harbor walk and fabulous restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Great family overnight”
Reviews.Author: Frank W
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight with 2 small kids. Front desk was great - even gave our daughter a little pink bear, which she carried with her constantly. They couldn't find the toy cars when we checked in, but came up to our room with a selection for our son. Had a few meals in the Aura restaurant - very kids friendly. Brought kid-safe cups. Good kids menu. Hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk with kids to the Silverline, which connects to the Red line T. You can also easily walk to South Station (red line T) in about 20 minutes. The Children's Museum is right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: t777jb
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Seaport. The hotel is great, but it's location was just ok. It's a bit of a hike to get over to the main part of downtown Boston. There isn't a lot to see or do within 10 minutes walk of the hotel. The subway is fairly close so that is a cheap way to get over into the more interesting part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Tagging along on Daddy's work trip”
Reviews.Author: AmyOle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 'tagging along' trip to Boston. Although my husband had to work all four days, the kids (ages 8 months and 3 yrs) and I had a fantastic time. The Seaport was a fabulous place for us to have as a 'home base'. From the moment we walked in the door, my children were treated like special guests. They got to pick toys out of a (huge) treasure chest (a big deal for a 3 year old), and were constantly doted on by the staff. Our best experience was when we got accidentally locked out of our room during a trip to the pool (the keycard demagnitized)-- a lovely maid took one look at my two tired, wet kids and let us right in. What a doll! The concierges were always very helpful and professional. They gave us fresh maps and walking directions every morning, and made me feel quite at ease about traveling with two little ones in tow. The aquarium (Longwharf) was only a 20 minute walk away, and we also walked through downtown to Beacon Hill / Public Gardens in about 35 min. The close proximity to the Boston Children's Museum (5-7 min walk) was another perk.... plus we booked the "Seaport Kids Package", which included four free tickets (they're pricey otherwise) to use whenever we wanted to. The pack- n-play was perfect for my 8 month old. I so prefer those to the "Romanian Orphanage" style bar cribs that so many hotels have. The only 'negative' I have is that the pool is definitely a lap pool set up for adults. It was on the chilly side (good for exercising, bad for little ones), but they had kickboards available that my little girl enjoyed playing with. We actually stayed here right over the time that Hurricane Irene blew into town. I was impressed by the preparedness of the staff-- we received letters in our rooms detailing emergency evacuation procedures and were kept up to date about the storm's progress by the concierge every time we saw him. This is a full-service hotel and no one would accept any tips! Quite refreshing-- Highly recommended-- Oh-- and my husband and I quite enjoyed the 'Pillow Library' to select from. It makes it that much nicer to have a pillow that is close to the one you have at home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great and Growing Part of Boston.”
Reviews.Author: twj410
Reviews.Content: The Seaport Hotel in Boston is a really nice hotel with modern conveniences and nearby restaurants and activities. The hotel is very clean and fairly new. Many of the nearby buildings are also new, and feature familiar chain restaurants as well as some local specialties. The T (Boston's subway system) adjoins the Seaport hotel providing quick access to much of the city, although walking to the financial district and -- for the ambitious -- the North End is possible from the hotel. Cabs are plentiful by the hotel, so even though it is a little out of the way compared to other hotels in Boston, it is easy to travel through the city. The rooms feature a large clean bathroom, a flat screen television, comfortable beds, and -- in our room -- an incredible view of Boston Harbor, Logan Airport, and East Boston (Try to get rooms XX35, 36, 37 or, 38). The hotel features hypo allergenic rooms, and offers a pillow menu with a dozen or more options for pillows. The rooms are equipped with [free] WiFi (although ours was week in parts of the room), wired internet connections, and plenty of outlets. This hotel caters to the business traveler as well as the tourist. Although valet parking is a little pricey (comparable to other hotels in Boston, however) the valets refused my offer of a tip explaining "Service is included." That was a nice touch on our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alliburn
Reviews.Content: We paid alittle more for the waterview and it was so worth it. The room was very spacious, nice and clean with an excellent view of The World Trade Centet. The locstion was great. Its a trendy new hot spot with great resturaunts and bar/clubs. We were pleased with the hotel and staff but the walls are very thin so in the early morning u can hear doors shutting and people talking. Overll experience good though.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Cancunies
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Boston. It is very close to the airport. Very clean and very nice staff. Definetely recommend to people to who visit Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: NovaDiners
Reviews.Content: Excellent location by the water front in Boston. Check-in was a little slow due to low staff numbers, but room was just as ordered. Highlights were the fitness center - very large and well equipped; also the brunch buffet was excellent and very good value. Only downsides were noise due to several functions in the hotel with a party on the same floor as our room.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotels for service, atmosphere, location in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Diane A
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel and also arranged a cocktail reception for over 100 guests. I have planned meetings and events for the past 14 years--Thomas Carbone, banquet manager, was one of the best! I was not able to confirm final numbers until about an hour prior to the event, and even increased my count by 30%, but Thomas happily accomodated. The staff was very attentive and pleasant. I would highly recommend this facility to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, but you pay for the convenience.”
Reviews.Author: poneill331
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, however, I think the price in Boston is exorbitant for hotels. This room was a King Standard and was small, but clean. Right in the revitalized Seaport area, not really near Faneuil Hall or downtown, but a short cab ride or good walking distance (few miles). Nice amentities in the room, comfy bed, but no breakfast included in the price of $233 before taxes, which was a conference price, too. My biggest issue with the hotel is the lack of sound barriers. Walls were so thin I awoke at 2:33 a.m. to loud voices and noises from either next door or above me, not shouting, just people talking. I could hear everything and couldn't get back to sleep until after 4:00 a.m. Not cool when you have to be clear for work in the a.m. You would have expected them to build this hotel with more soundproofing. This is a Fidelity Investments owned property not affiliated with any hotel chain. So if you are collecting frequent hotel points, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and a view of the water”
Reviews.Author: wanderkitty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location, but it lacks signage to easily find it. You can take silver line public transport from the airport to the hotel. The hotel restaurants are great. They have a 'yappy hour' with dogs near the outside lounge area. The health club is larger than many hotels I have stayed at. The rooms are very comfortable. There is a Bose radio and smallish flat screen TV, plenty of towels and bathroom accoutrements. I requested and received a complimentary partial water view. It had a very nice view of the lights of downtown Boston along with the view of the harbor. All the staff are very, very helpful with questions or needs. Restaurants in the area are plentiful. There is a very nice elevated park area with Adirondack chairs for casual meetings or working outside. If given the opportunity I would stay here again for business or vacation. there is a no tipping policy that I have not experienced before. The trolley tour stops at the hotel and harbor tours are just across the street. Try the $7 water taxi to Logan for a unique way to get to the airport. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, hope to return soon”
Reviews.Author: NewEngland06
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Seaport hotel. Both time we attended a concert at the Bank of America pavilion, 5 minute walk from the hotel. It is nice to stay at the Seaport Hotel after a concert. Both times we were greeted by a friendly and polite staff. The rooms, as well as the entire hotel are very clean. The hotel is located in the up and coming South Boston seaport area. Added Some new restaurants to the area since our stay last year. Hotel is easy to get to by subway, take the Silver line to World Trade Center, stop is right at the hotel. We recommend this hotel and we hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: cymry
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily for its quality and location. The quality was good, though I was expecting something a little more for the price we paid: rooms were clean and appealing, with nice touches like recycling bins and shampoo/conditioner dispensers rather than bottles. The mini-fridge was very small, and there was no microwave. The coffee machine made it difficult to make tea (they only provided one kind of black tea, which I don't drink). The location was a little outside of the downtown core, but not so far that we couldn't walk it. It took us about a half hour to walk to the Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market area. Many of the smaller restaurants in that area are also closed on weekends. The service at the hotel was excellent; the girl at the front desk was very helpful. They immediately noticed that they had forgotten to replace our pillows with non-down ones, as requested, and a quick call to housekeeping fixed the problem immediately. Overall a good place to stay, though a little pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading website”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: I tried to book a room on the Seaport's website for an "advanced" rate, but when I called the reservation line to confirm, they told me the rate wasn't available???? Seems like false advertising or bait and switch. I even told the reservation operator I had a screen shot of the rate and she still would not honor it? Very disappointing and misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Seaport”
Reviews.Author: Joey1963
Reviews.Content: We flew into Boston and drove to Bar Harbor Maine then returned to stay a few days at the Seaport Hotel. It was a lovely stay all the way around. We took the water taxi directly from and to the Airport which was a really nice touch. The concierge staff was very helpful and the area is very safe for walking. The hotel offers free bicycles which we took out on our last day with their mape to the beach at South End. The bikes were a great deal of fun and in excellent shape. After touring the beach we decided to ride all over Boston and wished we had decided to take the bikes out ealrier on the trip. Biking around boston was so easy we would have done that during the whole stay instead of cabs. What a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Alexacasper
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Boston and we really liked staying here. We arrived at Boston Logan Airport and then took a water taxi to the hotel, which is located at the quays. The hotel is located at a walking distance of downtown Boston but around the corner there is also a MBTA subway station. The staff was very friendly and helpful (tips are included in the hotel price which is rare for the US). The rooms were ok and clean and we had a view over the quays and in the distance Boston Logan Airport. Negative was that the airc onditioning was too cold in the lobby and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location when heading to the World Trade Center”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGrrrl
Reviews.Content: The Seaport Hotel is an incredibly convenient location - not only is it directly across from the World Trade Center, but it's next to the Mass Pike and close to Logan Airport. The staff and service are definitely on top of customer service, especially when problems arise. We had reserved a room back in April and upon arrival had to wait for one to be cleaned/prepped. The front desk held our bags and immediately sent us to the bar for some drinks on the house. We were barely situated when we were informed that a room was ready for us and our bags had been taken care of. The rooms are nice - the TV is wall-mounted making it easy to view from desk, chair, or bed. The wireless was great despite a full hotel of IT people (you KNOW everyone was connected)! One of my favorite things was finding out that the hotel offers a "pillow bar" where you can order from several different pillow types in order to find the one that best suits your fancy. We sampled both the Tamo restaurant - great food, albeit pricey - and room service - definitely expensive but a nice alternative when you don't feel like going out. Breakfast at the hotel is a wallet-killer, but there are plenty of options if you feel like a short walk in the blocks around the hotel. Downsides to the hotel - if you get a room towards the lower floors, expect some street noise.
