Also noticed that the door locks don't allow for a quiet close, so we heard every person who went in or out. Other than that, no complaints; we will definitely be returning to the Seaport for our next visit to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay - thank you”
Reviews.Author: tryinghar
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 9 nights whilst attending an event at the World Centre opposite. Everything was clean and staff (particularly housekeeping) were friendly and most polite! Room service was excellent and bar and restaurant staff courteous and meals reasonably priced. The doormen were ultra helpful and really nothing was too much trouble! We loved the tourist trolley service right from the hotel door and felt safe strolling to the eateries close by the hotel. Loved Boston - wonderful city and hope we can return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: evanjva1Usa
Reviews.Content: We were booked here as part of a curise package. Hotel was in reasonable walking distance from pier. But the taxis in Boston are very inexpensive for a city and a lot less expensive than the $26 the tour company wanted. The one thing that will always stick in my mind is that is was a gratuity-free hotel. We witnessed a bellman being offered a tip and he refused it saying, "It's already been paid." The rooms were well kept. And the internet was free. We would definitely go back there the next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dnumme
Reviews.Content: I attended a weekend conference. Staff were very, very helpful. Rooms were nice and clean. One complaint: the water pressure in the shower was awful! Being close to the water makes it's location wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Believe in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: JustJeri
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Boston will not be forgotten. With a city so alive, there are many options - let the professionals at Seaport Boston Hotel help you figure it all out. We started planning this trip about 5 months ahead of time. I chose Seaport based on other reviews, but didn't decide until I picked up the phone & called their concierge department. I won the lottery with Betty Salemme! I quickly nicknamed her "Boston Betty" & I felt she really became a friend. She planned this trip to Boston for us & it could not have been better. She knew what questions to ask, to discover what type of experience we wanted. She even helped my husband plan a surprise for me, behind my back! This hotel has everything: spa, gym, built in "nightlight" in the bathroom, electronic "Do Not Disturb" button, clean sleeves on the remote control, restaurant & bar, coffee shop, "pillow menu", easy access to The T, fine dining within walking distance, "party" bars within walking distance - even in heels! Seriously, if you can't find what you need here, you just didn't ask the right question! I happened to love the location. Some reviews here act as if the hotel is poorly located. I appreciated the fact that it wasn't in the overly crowded, tourist-trappy area. Directly across from the hotel is a Dunkin Donuts, a 7-11 & a Fresh City. Boston is a walking town - be ready to hoof it. If you think you don't want to walk, or if you are going pretty far out of the city center, say, out to Fenway, the city makes getting around very easy! I appreciate a city that takes responsibility for transporting its people. And it is one of the best bargains in Boston. The locals are fun to watch, they have this place figured out! I learned a lot by watching them. Again, if you think you are gonna come here & NOT have to use your feet, you are mistaken. I come from a place where you have to use your car to get to anywhere, so yeah, walking in a city is a bit foreign, but a vacation is about experience. Staying at the Seaport offers you that in so many ways! We were in town for the celebration of Independence Day. The city was packed, but surprisingly serene. I have been to Chicago, NYC, LA, ATL. I assumed Boston would be similar. It has a whole different vibe & each section of the city has it's own pulse. I will say that our stay at Seaport was enhanced by the planning Betty did for us. During such a busy time in Boston, we would have been scrambling for reservations & tickets to attractions. When we arrived at the Seaport, the front desk had an envelope waiting for us, with our complete itinerary, tickets, and even contact names at the places we would be visiting . Betty came from her concierge desk to greet us, too. After talking to her for months, it was a joy to finally meet the woman who put this trip together for us. She even went to the trouble to get us an early check-in & a secluded corner room with a nice harbor view on one side & a city view on the other! We will be back to Boston & some of our friends have expressed interest in visiting. I can't imagine staying or recommending any other hotel than the Seaport.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: RHW1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a few nights on business. Meeting room was great and spacious with daylight. Food that was catered was fresh and well prepared. Had dinner there before flying back: good american food - very authentic. The room was nice and quiet. Good amenities and state of the art facilities in the entire hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Seaport District”
Reviews.Author: JoeDBuffalo_NY
Reviews.Content: Spent many weekends in Boston but decided to try a different locale and was very surprised how much there is to offer in the Seaport district. The hotel had great amenities (an especially well equipped gym) and an excellent staff. The rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. We were even able to see the fireworks from the bridge next door at the staff's suggestion. Silver line of T makes the hotel accessible to everything, including the airport. If you're interested I suggest the Harpoon Brewery tour which is right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you like tipping!”
Reviews.Author: Aussiewriter
Reviews.Content: How refreshing to arrive at a hotel and try to tip the bellboy and have him refuse, likewise everyone else there! This was a lovely hotel, spotlessly clean, comfortable and with friendly staff. I stayed in a king harbour view room with my husband. We were travelling with some girlfirends of mine who had a twin room without the view, altho once they saw ours they wished they'd payed the extra $20! My husband had the bes nights' sleep he'd had in over 4 years, so I bought one of their glorious feather pillows for him. Now I wish I'd bought myself one too. The rooom service was great - we were so exhausted from walking we couldn't find the energy to go out at night. Waking up to all the activity on the harbour below was great. There are some wonderful restaurants just 5 mins walk from the hotel with fantastic seafood choices. Boston was a great city to explore and I look forward to staying there again. Will also stay in the Seaport again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Hotel, Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: mptravel007
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Seaport with my family (myself, my husband, children 8&10). This was not our first choice, but most hotels in the area were sold out, so at the Seaport we stayed. The hotel is acceptable, but nothing special, particularly not for this price range. First, the hotel is in a less desirable area of the city. Not much is within walking distance and access to the T requires a first leg of travel on the Silver Line on which travel is by bus. Getting to virtually any destination of note in the city takes multiple transit transfers. We did find a good little breakfast spot (Flour) and excellent restaurant for dinner (Sportello) each about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Second, the front of house staff (doormen, front desk, concierge) is reasonably professional, but not particularly friendly or helpful. Third, when I made the room reservation, I was told that a suite could accommodate a cot in the living area along with the pull-out sofa and so requested one. However, when we got to the room the cot was not there. When the housekeeper brought it up, she was reluctant to set it up and for good reason, it would have blocked access to the bathroom. Note, after several nights of poor sleep from growing children knocking each other off of the pull-out sofa, we again requested a cot. This time a smaller one was brought up and we rearranged the room to put it below the window in the living room - cramped, but better than blocking access to the bathroom. In general, the suite was small with furniture pushed against window coverings, a television blocking the view in the bedroom, and a tiny closet. The furnishings are worn and frankly, kind of boring - neither elegant or interestingly contemporary. The bed and pillows were comfortable. Climate control was fine, as was sound insulation from other rooms. Room service was very good - the room was very clean when we checked in and neatly tidied and cleaned every day. Fourth, the pool is warm, clean and in a bright space with a nice view. Lane markers were always in place which made playing with the children difficult, even when we were the only ones in the pool, which was generally the case. The locker rooms are spacious and clean. The exercise equipment is adequate. Fifth, we did not take advantage of the restaurant or bar, based on others' reviews. Sixth, we needed a rental car for a short portion of our trip. The Seaport has an arrangement with Enterprise where they will meet you at the lobby, forms in hand, with a car at the curb. On the return, we left the car at the curb and gave the doorman the keys - easy. Would we stay again? If there were no other better located options, sure.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Spotless, Great value”
Reviews.Author: mossymor
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Seaport we were there for 3 nights. We had a room with 2 queen size beds for 2 adults & a child. The room was lovely bright and modern. Tea & coffee making facilities which a bit strangely were in the bathroom. The beds were really comfortable if a bit small for 2 adults. The pool at the inhouse leisure cenre was great, towels supplied and a machine for drying out your swimming togs. Everywhere & everything was spotless. The hotel is located at the World Trade Ctr which is on the waterfront. & is right on the metro silverline. Although we found to travel most places around Boston required at least 1 change. Quincy market or the Aquarium were about 15 mins walk We didn't dine at the hotel restaurant but we did have breakfast at the snack bar which opened about 6 in the morning. $3 for a big tub of porridge. (Oatmeal, if you ask for porridge they don't know what you're talking about). The snack bar was very popular with local workers & business people.The hotel seemed to have a lot of business people staying there and has a lot of conference facilities. Overall Fab hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, wish I could stay there forever”
Reviews.Author: SouthpawKB
Reviews.Content: The Seaport Hotel at the World Trade Center is a beautiful, vibrant hotel with very friendly staff and everything you could possibly need. We stayed in a "deluxe double" room and although they apologized for not being able to give us a Harbor View room, we actually could see the Harbor just by looking to the right. Everything was very clean and very comfortable. This is a no-tipping hotel, with a small fee added each day that covers all the gratuities you might need give at other locations. My daughter was intrigued by the "Pillow Library" so we called and requested a couple of Swedish Memory Foam pillows to make our beds even more comfy. The room included a Krups coffee maker with coffees and tea (yum!), Gilchrist and Soames toiletries (divine!), and a fridge, though we found that it wasn't cold enough to keep milk fresh. There was a Bose clock radio that works with any MP3 player. The room also included a hairdryer, iron and ironing board, bathrobes, and there was even a much-appreciated umbrella in the closet! The flat-screen TV is mounted above the desk area, so it doesn't take up valuable real-estate on the desk. The internet access worked flawlessly. They offer to store your luggage for you when you check out, if you aren't leaving town right away, and give you a claim ticket. The stored luggage was very secure. The hotel is very convenient to the MBTA's Silver Line from the airport, and they have a shuttle for employees and guests that will take you down to State Street near the old State House and Quincy Market, for free. We didn't give it a try, but they say they have free bikes you can use, and their garage is a ZipCar rental location, so there are lots of ways to get around. Need food? There is a Seven-11 just across the street and a Dunkin Donuts (of course - there's a DD every 10 feet in downtown Boston.) The hotel has 3 different eateries within it, as well - a sit-down restaurant, a bar, and a small cafe with sandwiches and coffee. There were events going on while we were staying, with lots of loud music, but we didn't hear a thing in our room. We enjoyed every minute of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in great location for us!”
Reviews.Author: purduevol
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific view of the bay from our room. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. I loved the shampoo, would love to have it at home. The coffee maker was awesome, I need one of those at home too. We tried breakfast one morning and found it very nice with a good variety but it was a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and customer service”
Reviews.Author: M0nica_M3
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, and quite reasonably priced, given the competition for rooms in Boston. Everytime I've stayed here, I've been happy with the room they give me. The views of the water are mesmerizing, and the front desk is always extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for the Boston marathon”
Reviews.Author: Mariaismaslife
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - very nice for a reasonable price (by Boston standards). We went for the Boston marathon and liked that it wasn't in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. Only a 5 minute cab ride from where buses pick u upbin morning and about 10 min cab ride from finish (you could walk!) Hotel had a special all u can eat pasta buffet night before-- very nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but would try others in the area”
Reviews.Author: tschickardt
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, clean and friendly staff. A little off the beaten path. Taxi's rides were short, however I think we only had one friendly driver out of a dozen or so. It was nice to have no tipping services throughout the hotel, for sure a plus.

Reviews.Title: “We were not disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Learning2Hope
Reviews.Content: We chose the Seaport Hotel for our family vacation based on good reviews, and were not disappointed. They were very affordable in comparison with other area hotels, had very helpful staff, and our children were very happy to swim in the pool. The rooms were clean and well-stocked, although a bit smaller than I'd initially expected. We had one King size bed, and were happy to find a pull-out sofa as well. The view was nice, although a balcony would have been a pleasant addition. There are a lot of nice dining options within walking distance; some are child friendly and some are not. It was just a short walk to the Children's Museum, and was near public transportation as well. Seaport had everything we needed, and we were glad not to pay steep prices for things we didn't. Over all, we enjoyed our stay, and would return if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was terrific and we'll return”
Reviews.Author: Reueler
Reviews.Content: The entire visit was excellent from the friendly service to the cleanliness of the facility, to the quality of the accommodations. An excellent hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Seaport Hotel in Boston is Full of Delighters!”
Reviews.Author: bnabors
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Seaport Hotel several times and love it. This hotel not only is convenient to the subway but is also within walking distance of great eats. The hotel staff is attentive, rooms are spacious and very clean. Best of all, the rooms are full of extras, such as full size blowdryers, makeup cloths, shampoo & conditioners in the shower and a big umbrella in every room. I can't say enough about this hotel. Will stay here again and again. Highly recommend Whiskey Priest, Legal Test Kitchen and Barking Crab. All are within walking distance and are great!

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return - this time with my family!”
Reviews.Author: conferencetrav
Reviews.Content: This is from an actual email I sent the hotel, " ...I stayed with you for a conference last month and wanted to make sure I let you know how much we appreciated and enjoyed our stay. I am definitely looking forward to staying with you in the future - I'm hopeful to bring my family next time -at least my wife! I also wanted to specifically mention "Richard" who was professional and provided exceptional service." Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Might as Well Be Homeless...”
Reviews.Author: GRDL
Reviews.Content: Seeking disappointment? Well, you've come to the right place. Guests contemplating stays here should arrive at the Seaport Hotel without any expectations that things like confirmed reservations will be fulfilled. People, like me, silly enough to reserve a room through the hotel's reservation line, and confirm it with a credit card number, will long for a hotel where such things are actually honored. While some of the staff is amiable, others here seem out to prove that guests are nuisances, and above all that promises are not worth keeping, especially when bedraggled travelers show up armed with a flimsy confirmed reservation. Instead of confirmed reservations, potential guests at the Seaport Hotel should arrive with low expectations, especially for things that one might reasonably expect at other hotels. When these guest (the ones with low expectations) are then cast off like a homeless person, they will not be disappointed after all when they - despite careful planning - have to find shelter - and at the last minute - at some other waterfront SRO.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: CT_Traveler57
Reviews.Content: Awful service, awful workers. Not a single positive I can say

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wcminvest
Reviews.Content: This is a very fine hotel with nice rooms and excellent service. I must admit that I was a bit worried after reading a number of less then postitive reviews before my visit. My conclusion is that most of the negative reviews are petty and inaccurate. I found the rooms to be very quiet (no thin walls that I noticed), the beds and bedding to be of a very high caliber and the service to outstanding. I also love the location. I had seven different business meetings in Boston over a two day period and found it quite easy and quick to get to all of them. Personally, I love the location of the hotel...it feels very open and airy and being near the waterfront made me feel like I was on vacation while doing business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location.”
Reviews.Author: 14Roger
Reviews.Content: The seaport is a nice hotel and is a 4 star hotel. I stayed 3 nights. The hotel is not trendy but is modern and comfortable. It is just a plain nice hotel. No fancy lighting or anything, just a great hotel that I would definitely stay at again. The hotel has free wifi every where which is great. The seaport location is nice with a number of restaurants nearby. There is a nice view out to the downtown core which is a 20 minute walk (hotel to quincy market). Back Bay area would be a lot longer to walk. There is a subway stop relatively close by but depending on where you're going you might have to change subway lines a couple of times. The rooms are quite spacious and really clean. Every day they make up the rooms and clean the bathroom amazingly well, almost as if there is a new guest checking into the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Convention Center hotel that doesn't feel like one”
Reviews.Author: liverpool85
Reviews.Content: Having had a disappointing stay at the Seaport's competition, I was ready to experience some hospitality in Bean Town. My first impression, however, was not the best, as I seemed to be interrupting a private conversation so I could get checked in. The staff recovered quickly when I asked if I was interrupting, efficiently checking me in...though not quite warmly. The rooms at the Seaport are packed with amenities and I appreciated the refrigerator being stocked with water. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room seemed more insulated than the Westin. The biggest difference I found, and the piece that made this a four vs. a three review, was the food and beverage. Mike in Tamo was out of this world. A terrific bartender who truly loved his hotel. His service had us talking the whole week. The food was definitely a leap above usual hotel fare, and everything was tasty. We had planned on dining in Aura, but just couldn't leave Mike's company...a very nice touch was that we could still order Aura's food in the other outlet. The lobby and public space shined impeccably, and the door staff was extremely helpful. I unfortunately experienced the same desk employee in the lobby on my last day...she seemed incredibly efficient and in charge...but she issued orders loudly and showed more warmth towards her fellow employees than guests. She seemed to want to take care of the guests...but it came across as dealing with us in order to get us out of her hair. There was also a spa which I couldn't partake in, and I loved that Seaport had a deal with a bike rental so you could explore on two wheels. Free wifi was a treat, as was the all inclusive pricing. Having now stayed at two Boston Convention hotels, I would recommend Seaport to anyone that asks.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate if you are Attending a Conference or Convention”
Reviews.Author: Louis59
Reviews.Content: The Seaport Hotel is of Holiday Inn quality, at best. My recent six night stay for a convention at the nearby convention center left me wanting to be at the nearby Westin or Renaissance for a number of reasons. The rooms are decent, but nothing to write home about. My room, on the 14th floor, had a pervasive moldy or mildew odor and on my second night at the hotel, when I asked to switch rooms, the second room on the same floor had the same â€œfunkyâ€� odor. The roomâ€™s pros: Bose wave radio with easy-to-use alarm function, free high-speed internet that was screaming fast, and comfortable beds. The cons: 26â€� wall mounted flat screen TV (still shaking my head at that one), a/c unit that barely breathed cool air with any force, and no opening window or vent to the outside to try for fresh air. There are no balconies available, which is a shame in this setting. The bathroom was, again, adequate. Fairly small room, with piping hot shower and good water pressure, but no individually bottled shampoo. I respect the hotelâ€™s desire to be â€œgreen," but the bulk dispenser in the tub/shower dispensed a mystery liquid that would not lather, so on one of my trips by the Westin, I stopped in and asked for a bottle of guest shampoo, which the housekeeper gladly handed me and which I used for the remainder of my stay. There was a nice bar of soap, and a bottle of lotion, but no special amenities to speak of. My sink had nearly no water pressure, and only offered either scalding or icy water, which made shaving difficult. There is a makeup mirror (not lighted). The Keurig coffee machine is in the bathroom, which is a nice touch, but the housekeeper stopped restocking it midway through my stay, for some unknown reason. Other nice aspects of the hotel: the front desk staff is very attentive and welcoming, and the hotel delivers the guestâ€™s choice of USA Today or Wall Street Journal each weekday morning. The lounge staff is friendly and attentive, and the wine list and menu are adequate. For breakfast, the hotel has a â€œWe proudly brew Starbucks coffeeâ€� (read: â€œnot a real Starbucksâ€�) off the lobby, but service there is slow, and there is a Dunkin Donuts located directly across from the hotel if youâ€™re prefer a fresh, quick, breakfast. For truly wonderful dining, visit the nearby Legal Seafoods Test Kitchen (in the same block as the Renaissance), Del Friscoâ€™s (five minute walk) or the Union Oyster House, which is a 10 minute cab ride away. All in all, this hotel is an adequate choice if you cannot get into the nearby Westin or Renaissance while attending a conference or convention. Itâ€™s a four minute walk across an uncovered bridge to the convention center, so bring an umbrella if rain is in the forecast. For a view better than a nearby office building, ask for a corner room on an upper floor, which members of our group were able to get at the same convention rate as I paid for my moldy-smelling queen-queen room.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandTraveler36
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in good condition and the housekeeping staff were very friendly and professional. I was with a large business group attending a conference at the hotel, and was also with my family (including a baby). Unfortunately, I had 3 unprofessional and unpleasant experiences with the front desk staff. One could have been an aberration, two would mar the stay, and three is inexcusable. 1. Upon check-in, the staff member wandered off with my driver's license for several minutes, leaving my credit card at the desk unattended. He finally came back and it turned out he was checking on the status of the crib we had requested for our child, but I could not understand why he needed to wander off with my driver's license instead of calling housekeeping. 2. Later that night, I needed to order in-room dining but as our child was asleep, I didn't want to make the call from the room, so I went down to the front desk to place the order. There were I believe 3 bored-looking staff at the front desk, with no other customers in sight. One of the staff, upon hearing of my situation, looked irritated at being bothered, waved me to a house phone so that I can call my request in, and went back to chatting with her colleague. 3. The following morning, we realized it would be difficult for me to finish attending my meeting while my family packed in time for the noon check-out, so I called the front desk to ask for a ONE HOUR extension. Of course, the hotel has a right to refuse this request, but the staff who answered the phone seemed annoyed at being bothered, said no very rudely, and practically hung up on me. We scrambled and managed to check out at noon on the dot, but felt that we had been kicked out of the hotel. This hotel does not value their customers, and I will certainly inform all my colleagues locally and nationally to avoid the Seaport Hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the convention center”
Reviews.Author: LauderdaleEvans
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Seaport hotel while attending an event at the Boston Convention Center. The hotel is clean, well-appointed and has a very friendly and helpful staff. The convention center is just a short two block walk across a bridge. We really enjoyed the service in the lounge. The servers were extremely knowledgeable which is all too rare in hotel bars these days. Room was well appointed and bed was quite comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Raph_06_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Boston Seaport Hotel for three days for Easter with my husband and two little boys (4 and 2) and the hotel was very good for us. It is very conveniently located, the room was perfectly clean and big enough for us and the kids had a lot of fun in the pool. We parked the car and did not take it at all during our three day stay, we went everywhere we needed using the T or walking. We did not use the restaurant or room service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient....”
Reviews.Author: JMTX
Reviews.Content: As I've travelled often in Boston I wasn't sure about the location however, it ended up being very convenient. Tips are included in the price therefore, no nickle and diming and the staff and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Regret looking at the high rating, not a great choice”
Reviews.Author: LeeCSingapore
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this hotel and normally I write a review after returning home. Unfortunately I have had enough. All was good on check-in and I thought it would be great, I even got a call 30 minutes later asking if all was OK. The room is OK, nothing special, basic bathroom and an empty minibar, what is the point of having it. One nice touch was a pod type coffee machine. I then prepared some laundry and it was 6pm so I knew it would not be back until the following night which was fine. I forgot to call housekeeping and asked the reception on the way out if they could arrange, the lady I spoke to was just full of excuses not to help. Why didn't I call myself from the room? (I forgot) Why don't I go back to my room and call? (I am on my way out) Why don't I call in the morning? (I have had no sleep all week as I flew in from SIngapore, I want a lie in and you have to call before 9am to get them picked up), House keeping ca't enter the room with nobody there !!! What, how do they clean it... and it went on and on, luckily someone with an ounce of customer service overheard and said no problem we will deal with it....... Next day I asked if I could have a late check out for the next day and the lady at reception just said how can we tell, you will have to come back on the day of checkout and ask... That is OK but no need to be rude. The hotel is full of kids so no chance of any peace and quiet, breakfast is a theme park and not that good either for the money... I now wish I paid a couple of extra dollars for a decent hotel. This should not be ranked at number 17, I think a problem is that service is included in the price so they don't get tips and the staff just can't be bothered, there are one or two who are very nice but the rest let these ones down. Location is OK but apart from one or two restaurants not much else around... This is at best a mediocre hotel, not worth the high rating for service they go on about

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: atraveller091010
Reviews.Content: The shuttle that supposedly take you to the market never showed up. They promised me 10-15 min. After 25 min I gave up and was disappointed for all the time I spent outside the hotel waiting for the shuttle. The health club only opens until 9:00 p.m. However when I got there at 8:45 p.m. it was closed. They told me if no one is there they close!!!! For all the money that they charged my a night $297 it'd expect better service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Support by Concierge & staff made this trip special”
Reviews.Author: franmurray
Reviews.Content: The location, atmosphere, and quality of the hotel are great but what really made my recent stay special was the staff since i had a sling on due to a dislocated shoulder. The concierge, Betty Selemme, was outstanding in her recommendations and making special arrangement for my events and mailing packages home to lighten my load. The rest of the staff at the Seaport are also exceptional and treat you like a VIP making the stay exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Fisrt Impressiosn - Service is not good”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: I phoned internationally direct to the hotel to make a reservation. In this process the phone was answered on the front desk and she said 'please hold'. So I did, for over 3 minutes, then I hung up. I rang again, only to be given the same response. When I tried to interrupt, I was not heard and the hold music started. Rather than sit on hold again for 3 more minutes and clock up another bill for waiting, I hung up and rang back a third time with the intention of interrupting as soon as she answered the phone by saying don't put me on hold, but she was in machine mode and the hold music started again. When she finally answered the phone off hold I proceeded to tell her that i did not like the way i was dealt with and that being placed on hold without an option to request a transfer was costing me money. To my surprise, she started justifying why she had to do this and this and that. As a customer you don't need to hear an excuse. The best part of all of of this was my company was running a function at the hotel with rooms for all of our guest and utilising conference facilities. As a paying customer a standard level of service is all most ask for, and this is not what i got. I did receive a phone call to apologise, but thats it. Upon arriving at the hotel, the experience was ok. What would have appreciated to place tangibility to an apology would be a good will gesture upon arrival, just something. Well as you can expect there was nothing, no contacting me during my stay by the staff member who phoned me the week prior to see if all was ok. This is a simple customer service gesture, but I was expecting too much or was I. Maybe I would expect a respoonse to this too, but again I might be expecting too much again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but service is poor due to auto tipping”
Reviews.Author: hansenjg
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location. Rooms are upgraded with lots of extras (umbreallas to use, pillow menu and more). The trick is that the hotel tells you at check in that they dont allow tipping to staff, everything is included. The hotel charges $3 per night for tips to share among staff and the restaurants auto add 18% to all checks. This shows in the staffs service level. The wait staff is unattentive and definitely not friendly, I guess its a matter of why bother when we know we only get 18% from everyone. Nice hotel in a great location but dont expect much in terms of service.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, low quality for the price, dated”
Reviews.Author: amayd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at much nicer hotels for this price. Also, the service it terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Not much bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: cari2007
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and clean. But way overpriced! Pillows ere horrible and the bed needs replacing. Considering the price they should at least offer a continental breakfast in the morning. And they should offer some sort of discount on the parking! $35.00 a day is crazy! No one was ever at the concierge desk and the staff did not seem too friendly.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good hotel over all”
Reviews.Content: bar service was extremely slow, staff not too friendly, food was very good, room was nice but bathroom was dirty with hair on floor in several places...easy fixes! hotel was a very good hotel, wish the bed was taller, softer, bedding was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly with luxury.”
Reviews.Author: Danny4111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business conference. All of the personel were extremely friendly and very accomodating. The room was extremely clean and updated. As i walked through the hotel I noticed the entire hotel was very clean. Everything looked like the hotel just opened up last month. The food served for the banquets was some of the best I have ever had. I also enjoyed the lounge in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “bit far from town in winter...”
Reviews.Author: oz_flashpackers
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, felt new. the seaport is a bit out of boston central, though the tourist trolley buses do go through the area. room was large. charged $35 for 8 hours parking - rip off. buffett breakfast was pretty gourmet. pool area is great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing helpful staff and a wonderful clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: luappi
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with the Seaport Hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay in the seaport region of Boston. There is nothing negative I can say about our stay. We were in town for a conference at the BCEC and our group consisted of 2 adults and 5 teens. All staff members went out of their way to help us and absolutely no one made us feel like second class citizens because our group was not comprised of business travelers. I was especially impressed with the concierge and the Front Desk members for their exemplary "above and beyond" attitude and service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, clean, comfortable, safe, easy to get to hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dkenefick
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay (3 nights) here and the experience was wonderful. The hotel has three eating options; a fancy restaurant, a comfortable lounge or a quick bite at a cafe stand (add to that a gift shop with candy). It also has plenty of comfortable seating options in the lobby (comfortable stuffed chairs and couches - same in the lounge). The staff is friendly, helpful and professional. The room is clean and the beds are comfortable with fluffy pillows. The rooms have a refrigerator (came in handy). I'd be happy to stay here again. I attended a conference with around 4000 people and the hotel had many staff strategically placed around the meeting areas to give directions to anyone in need. They did an excellent job.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for minimal customer service this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: marcat82073
Reviews.Content: Third year staying at this hotel, will more than likely be the last. I was there on business. My company perfers to send a check to cover the cost of the room and tax, always a problem. Front desk staff wants to argue with you instead of finding a solution. ie looking in the correct place on the folio to find the deposit. None of the employees smile or greet the guest when they see them in the hall or lobby . But hey they got thier $169.00 per night and the $3.00 inclusive fee per night , so what do they care right?

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ldypro
Reviews.Content: I was booked at the Seaport Hotel thru my company for a Golf Expo. What a great location for the EXPO event...and what a great hotel. Short trip from the airport (took a cab but will take the SILVER LINE bus right to hotel next time...$2.00 bus compared to $24 cab) Service at this resort was A1...top notch. I would not hesitate to stay here...even by myself, I felt safe and no worries.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT stay at SEAPORT! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Domonique
Reviews.Content: Tagged along on my husband's business trip and brought our 3 kids with us (ages 8, 6 & 6mos). The service was excellent, the food was excellent, we had a view of the harbor AND the city...it was so great! We can't wait to go back. We got an Executive Suite for $239 per night. It was a little on the small side, for 5 of us, but definitely perfect for business travel. The room was actually nicer in person than it was in the pictures on the internet. The kids and I were able to walk to the Aquarium and the Children's Museum (this was GREAT, we spent hours there!). The hotel is directly across from the World Trade Center in the Financial District so there weren't tons of restaurants or shops within walking distance. Concierge was very helpful. We loved the restaurant in the hotel (Aura) and the Tamo Bar & Lounge. Valet parking is great but costs a whopping $42 per day! A few mins drive to Faneuil Hall / Quincy Market which has tons of shops and eateries. We all agreed we definitely want to go back in the Spring when the weather warms up!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: tried_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for our anniversary.Location is just ok. Water view is a fish pier. We had a terrible encounter with security!! We were not offered any kind of customer satisfaction.The pool was freezing and there was no jacuzzi or hot tub. Not a very well run hotel. We stay in boston very often and learned a lot staying here. Would pay the extra to stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 4 star with unmatched service.”
Reviews.Author: mepatm
Reviews.Content: Seaport service was OUTSTANDING! From the valet service to the nice man who brought the breakfast in bed. Everything was great! The front desk even got me flowers for my significant other with a 5 minute converstaion... they were great! Rooms were super clean and nice. We ordered room-service and it was perfect!! Only downside is the hotel is away from downtown... but if your doing something in the seaport area.... you can't go wrong with the seaport. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value and amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyVacationersMa
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute visit to the Seaport after deciding to take the kids to the aquarium for the day - we live only 30 minutes from Boston. The rate for a Friday night stay was far less expensive than other similar hotels. Check-in was a breeze and the room was ready at noon. We had dinner at Aura, their fancier restaurant, and had a wonderful experience. It happened to be their monthly "kids' night" where there were babysitters, art projects, and toys set up for the kids at the restaurant. Brilliant! Our son loved his meal - which was cleverly served in a Bento Box - and our adult dinner was only $30pp for a 3 course fixed price menu. Amazing. Our server, Ili, was a delight and wonderfully knowledgeable and patient. And I highly recommend room service for breakfast. Delicious, beautiful, efficient. We will make the Seaport a family Boston tradition. The staff clearly are proud of their hotel and care for its customers extremely well.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: transientm
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was within walking distance of Boston's Institute of Contemporary Art. But everything else about the hotel made us additionally happy I had happened on this hotel. The hotel amenities, service personnel and decor were super. Our room was comfortable and well furnished. Try the "pillow menu". I only found out about this as we prepared to leave the room for the last time--too bad! Bathroom was well appointed. Free wireless and super fitness club with steam room rounded out the amenities. We had a nice afternoon snack in the Tamo bar seated next to a warming fireplace. A short, 3 minute walk out the front door of the hotel right after noon took us to the Silver Line Metro station for our trip to Logan Airport. Took just 15 minutes to get to the American Airlines terminal, an easier trip than if one took the "T" and had to transfer to the airport shuttle bus. If you like walking instead of riding taxis or the "T", the pedestrian route into the downtown of Boston or to the North End for shopping, sightseeing or food is simple.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ekaskons
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenage sons, and I stayed over President's weekend to attend a Funeral on Saturday, and an event, related to the Funeral, at the hotel on Sunday. We requested two rooms on the same floor, and were very pleased that they gave us adjoining rooms. This made everything a lot easier. Rooms were lovely, spacious, and immaculate, with a small refrigerator in the bedroom and a Keurig in the bathroom. There is a Dunkin' Donuts and a 7-11 across the street. No real view from our room, but it was fine. Hotel staff was wonderful, and very accommodating. At one point, they arranged a van so eight of us could ride to the North End for dinner - parking is horrendous in the North End, especially on Saturday night. Nice restaurants in and nearby the hotel too. There is a parking garage attached to the hotel, and we were able to charge it to our room. They have a great system where one of your room keys lets you in and out of the parking garage with no additional charge, and no need to take another ticket. We had two cars, but our older son left a day early to return to school. We mentioned this at checkout, and the hotel graciously removed the second night of his parking from our bill. Lobby is lovely with lots of comfortable seating, which was nice as we often ran into friends attending the event and could sit and talk to, or wait for, them. There was a nice Apple desktop computer in the lobby for guest use, and the free Wifi worked throughout the hotel. We did not use the gym, but our friends said it was great. All in all we had a wonderful experience, and do not hesitate to recommend the Seaport Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I have never been so insulted in my life.....”
Reviews.Author: Bigrob7605
Reviews.Content: Well to be honest they are nice and pretty on the outside. But on the inside they are full of issues... disrespect... and lies... I was actually hurt the 1st day of me and my girlfriends stay in the shower because it was left in a dilapidated state and not marked it was broken and that the hot water was messed up and got too hot and you could not turn it off. And after that i called the frost desk and the staff made a report of it and laughed when i told them what happened. And i thought it was very unprofessional to do such a thing after being burned with scalding hot water for 15 seconds. The manager said he was going to contact me and try and give us a few perks for the remainder of our stay for the whole thing happening. But he never called back and when i called him back he ignored my phone calls and i still have yet to have him call me back for that and the other issues we had while staying there. The Direct TV was out the entire time we where there. So late at night there was nothing to do but just sit there... We couldn't enjoy any shows or anything. Thank god i had my laptop with us and i had some movies on there that i paid for through a digital movie rental place. And not to mention while outside trying to take photo's one of the hotel security staff screamed at me and told me to stop and tried to drag me off the hotel property and said that i need to leave now because no pictures are aloud to be taken outside of the hotel. And i asked how? So he showed me a clip board that said "Suspicious people are not aloud to take photo's and must be removed off hotel grounds" So after telling him i was a guest at the hotel and told him my room number he said "Really? You are a guest?" And i said. Yes i am staying here. He said "I dont find that very likely" and he continued to try and kick me off hotel grounds. So i went back in and tried to report that once again like all the other issues we had when we where there. And like everything else. Nothing was done about anything. So to be honest we will never stay there again. Those issues are the kind of issues you would expect to see a a red roof inn or one of the cheap hotel's. Now that i think about it you would not see those issues at a red roof inn. So in closing. Save your self the trouble and go elsewhere. There are far more hotels in the Boston area then the Seaport Hotel. And you will get the respect you deserve. And you will be treated good and not as if you are just a bag of money and once you pay they could care less what happens to you or how you stay is. Makes me sick every time i think about our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Mom056
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport Hotel because I was an exhibitor at the Boston Globe Travel Show which was directly across the street. It was easy to unload my car and set up. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Travelady13
Reviews.Content: Did not know what to expect of this convention hotel. The hotel is clean, staff is friendly and go the extra mile. Parking is conveniently located within the building and has a dedicated elevator for hotel. The fitness center is also great. If you have to be at the convention center, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best experiences”
Reviews.Author: PVG1
Reviews.Content: The over-all experience was more then I could have imagined. The rooms are very comfortable and location was perfect for my meetings. I could go on and on about the great staff at the hotel from the door man, front desk staff, and the maid, but the service in the restaurant was great. Staff was smiling all the time and even remembered my name from the first day. The food was excellent with a wide variety of choices. No tipping policy took some getting used to.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DRNH
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Seaport Hotel to attend an event at the World Trade Center. Travelling with 3 young children we were a bit anxious. However, the staff immediately welcomed us and even gave our kids books to borrow during our stay. The World Trade Center is directly across the street which made it very easy to come and go. We used the pool which was warm and clean. The pool and healthclub is open to the public but was very slow. The pool staff was very accomodating and helpful. The rooms were clean and there was little, if any, perceivable hall noise at night. The Seaport is not located in the 'downtown' metropolitan area of Boston. However, the T Silver line is across the street from the hotel and it's very easy to get into town. Also worth noting is that the streets near the Seaport are not busy and it's extremely easy to get on and off Interstate 93. Overall, this was a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel with Excellent Service and A Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JBJump
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for a night and wish we had been there longer - the hotel is a bit removed from the main visitor attractions in Boston but it is right on the "T" so getting around without a car is easy. The friendliness of the staff is noteworthy. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruins11
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for a wedding. Very clean, very nice everywhere - room, hallways, lobby, parking. Rooms are good size and comfortable. All the employees are friendly and helpful and they do not accept tips as a hotel policy (though we did tip a few workers who went the extra mile.) Good location if you are at the convention center. A little off the beaten path for Boston downtown but it is accessible on foot, by cab or by Silver Line MBTA to airport or South Station. Plus my niece got married here and everything was top notch for the ceremony and reception.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Well Worth A Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jmp1975
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and based our decision on an affordable price and that there was a pool. We really lucked out because this hotel ended up being a gem! Very friendly staff, clean, quiet, and super convenient from the airport. Hop on the Silver Line bus and the first stop after leaving the airport is across the street from this hotel. Cost of the bus ride: $2! This hotel is doing a great job w/ little touches. Lots of tv channels, free internet, no tipping in the hotel, bath robes, umbrellas in the room, a pillow library, Kuerig coffee maker in the room - some really nice touches! A few things that could imporved on: not a lot of signage so I needed directions when we got off the bus, the shower head was dated and the water pressure wasn't terrific. None of these things should keep anyone from spending time at this hotel - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for families (on weekends)”
Reviews.Author: NHVT504
Reviews.Content: Love this Hotel. Staff are Warm and Friendly. I took my family to Boston for a Christmas trip. Upon our arrival front desk staff were happy we arrived and VERY friendly. Upon our arrival in the room, Cookies, milk and a note from Santa were waiting for my 2 young children. "Santa" also left two Gift bags filled with small toys for them to keep. After settling in, we went to the pool and had the entire pool to ourselves. After our time in the pool, we went to the children's Museum (short walk, maybe 1/4 of a mile) and then dinner. Upon our return from walking around downtown Boston, we decided to retire to our room. As we were getting ready for bed, room service brought 4 ice cream sundaes. What a way to spend the weekend! This hotel goes above and beyond every time. WAY better than any chain hotel. Please Keep up the great work and I look forward to our next visit to the Seaport Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Forced to pay 18% tip at bar, and for subpar waitress service!”
Reviews.Author: nampizeht
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a complete joke that I was forced to pay an 18% tip at the bar/restaurant - especially at the bar. Ordered 2 drinks and paid a $4 tip. WTF is that? And why should I pay an 18% tip for sub-par waitress service?!?!?! They had 1 waitress working our section and at least 1/2 of the tables were sitting there twiddling their thumbs. Bull! Absolute bull. I would pretty much never consider staying at the Seaport again, or recommend it for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Costs a bit more, but spoil yourself. Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Fuller1981
Reviews.Content: Wow. This was, without question, the most luxurious hotel we stayed in out of a total of nine in two weeks. Not without some faults, but very impressive indeed and certainly worth a visit if you want to treat yourself. The location is perhaps slightly out of the city centre, but perfect for the financial district and conference centre, as well as next to a metro station, which was very convenient. The parking is very expensive (albeit normal for city centres) but if you donâ€™t have much luggage and are prepared to walk a short distance, there is cheaper parking in the area. We were warmly welcomed and the enormous, very tastefully decorated reception made us feel somewhat under-dressed. Itâ€™s very spacious and provided access to the restaurant and bar, both of which looked smart and sophisticated. Small details like a table of different vases filled with apples in the day and changed to candles in the evening, make you feel that a real sense of attention to detail is exists and pride is taken in keeping the place presentable at all times. One of the best features about this place â€“ for a tourist at least â€“ is that they stress that gratuities are included in the costs and tips are not expected. Furthermore, staff echo this time and again, demonstrating that they have been very well trained. We have no objection to tipping in the slightest but will always feel at odds with the fact that it is virtually mandatory everywhere in the USA. In the UK, we tip to say give thanks for hard work, a good job or exceeding expectation but Stateside, it basically means that no service ever costs what you are charged and you have the anxiety of working out what is and isnâ€™t appropriate, fearing rebuke by staff if you donâ€™t get it right. To have this nuisance taken away was really lovely and something the hotel deserve commending for! Moving on, we were not offered assistance with luggage and instead made our own way to the room, on the twelfth floor. We had booked one with a view over the harbour and if itâ€™s not something youâ€™re used to, it was quite fantastic, especially at night. The room was beautifully decorated and very clean. We had a fridge, couch, TV, the usual things and unlike ever before, our own PC! Donâ€™t get too exited â€“ a wonderful thought but internet access is an additional price and was the slowest weâ€™ve experienced since dial-up connections. Iâ€™m prepared to give them the benefit of the doubt and assume it may have been temporary but simply could not have managed had I been a business customer. I'm sure we saw mentioned somewhere that the whole media system was due an upgrade shortly. The bed was very comfortable and I can honestly say Iâ€™ve never come across a â€˜pillow libraryâ€™ before but I suppose itâ€™s nice touch if your fussy where you place your head. Breakfast in the morning was the best of nine hotels during our stay â€“ a wide selection for the continental breakfast, excellent buffet â€“ fresh and hot and delicious! Staff were polite and friendly and service was swift. We didnâ€™t try dinner (but presume it would also be good). We did, however, try cocktails and a dessert in the bar â€“ a lovely venue in itself and both drinks and food were very enjoyable. While there, we did have some clothes laundered, as they reeked of smoke following a trip to the excellent Plimouth Plantation. Although not all that expensive, they definitely came back slightly smaller which was a disappointment. However, when addressed at reception, we were not charged for the service and given the parking for free which is, to our mind, more than adequate compensation. In conclusion, we were very impressed with this hotel and would certainly stay there again. There are some minor flaws to remedy but they are certainly getting nearly spot on. It is certainly somewhere to stay if you want to splash out on something a bit nicer than your average hotel and was much appreciated on our road trip! Unfortunately, we didnâ€™t visit the spa and health facilities so are unable to comment on these but like the restaurant, have faith that they would not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Do Boston in comfort”
Reviews.Author: MomWorking
Reviews.Content: My family went to Boston to learn about American history and walk the Freedom Trail during our Thanksgiving break and check out other sites like Fenway Park. We also rented a car to to check out the Mayflower. The hotel has an onsite car rental agency and Enterprise delivers a car to the hotel if you need one. Betty, the concierge staff was very informative and delivered a car to us when we were running late. I love the idea of no tipping policy because I keep running out of money to give. Despite that, most of the staff members were very respectful. The hotel was reasonably priced and we were able to stay in a suite. There is a small refrigerator in each room. The beds are very comfortable allowing us to sleep 10 hours a night !. The free wifi needs a little fixing. It was very slow and stuttering. The pool is small. My kids were bummed there was no hot tub. There were frequent joggers around the harbor. Overall - a great experience and would highly recommend the hotel for family.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations, service and location”
Reviews.Author: MarieMcD122457
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay, great corner room with harbor and airport views. Great service from hotel staff and tasteful yet low key ambiance. Would defintiely stay here again; excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Air, land and sea all in one view!”
Reviews.Author: RubyDiner
Reviews.Content: We won the overnight stay at a company party last January and thought that the day after Thanksgiving would be a perfect wind down time. We swam in the pool, ate dinner in the bar/lounge and tucked ourselves in early for a nice slice of shut eye. We didn't even set the alarm for the morning. We treated ourselves to the buffet breakfast for the perfect send off. Loved the view of the harbor AND the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience”
Reviews.Author: clamshellvt
Reviews.Content: I read some of the other reviews and would have to say that I didn't share the same experience. The hotel was clean, quiet, and we really had nothing to complain about. The room was a bit smaller than expected but I wasn't there to hang out in the room. The front desk was very accommodating. The onsite restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “You wont get any sleep here”
Reviews.Author: oregonnative_10
Reviews.Content: You walk in to a beautiful lobby and are greeted by a very professional staff, then go to you nice room with a comfortable bed. Then you find any time your in your room all you hear are slamming doors, people yelling in the hallway returning for their wedding or convention. And this goes on ALL NIGHT LONG. You can try to talk to the front desk but it just goes on and on.

Reviews.Title: “Totally dissatisfied with desk reaction to my request”
Reviews.Author: pedro_garcia_lario
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a 4-day conference at the Hotel, after a complicated process of reservation until some rooms became available just a few days before the conference date. For this reason and because I wanted to stay 1 more night for some Boston sightseeing I had pre-paid the 5th night for a much higher rate. During my stay I learned that other colleagues got this 5th night at the same lowe rate applied to the conference dates. When I asked for the application of the same lower rate to this 5th night I was told it was not possible, as this was pre-paid. I found this unacceptable, because they could have easily fit the rate for the previous 4 days so that I could be treated the same way as my colleagues. No apologies, no excuses were given. In addition, the coffee machine in my room didn't work; it was cold because the air conditioning was limited to 25C, the internet connection was of a very poor quality. If a hotel like this cannot solve a simple problem like this I cannot recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to convention center, easy access to airport & highway”
Reviews.Author: Hope1215
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a convention at the Convention center. So convenient to just walk a few minutes across the bridge to convention. The airport is very close, yet we heard no noise from our room. Hotel parking very easy and competitive pricing. This was really an excellent location for the Boston business traveler. We would definitely stay there again. Our service was excellent, so I can't relate to some other comments posted here.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive regarding the service !”
Reviews.Author: jcr38
Reviews.Content: 180 $ per night is a high price for a noisy room (from corridor and neighboor rooms). And breakfeast is not in the price ! Nevertheless it is well placed (near the airport) and offer many interesting options (swimming pool and fitness space).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place the relax at the end of the day”
Reviews.Author: restls
Reviews.Content: We we very pleased with the Seaport Hotel and the helpful and friendly staff. This was our first visit to Boston, so we wanted to be in a location that was convenient to the downtown attractions. We were right across the street from the public transit station, which made getting around very easy. The cost at the Seaport was very reasonable, compared to the other hotels we considered. The room was very spacious, the bed was exceptionally comfortable, and the heated floor tiles in the bathroom were a pleasant surprise. The only down side was the cost to park our rental vehicle, which was $42.00 per day, but I suppose that is not unlike most larger cities. We would definitely stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible time getting our room!”
Reviews.Author: Cinbay
Reviews.Content: It seems as if this hotel makes a habit of overbooking their rooms and not making it right with their customers. Calling to confirm the night before our arrival we were told they didn't have a second room for us the first night even though we had a confirmation number for two rooms. Found another hotel a few blocks away that was twice as much because there wasn't a wedding group discount. Found out the people who didn't confirm prior to arriving were also turned away, but got a free room up the street and a $100 voucher at the hotel. The second night, after being told our room would be ready later, were again told they were out of rooms. After 20 minutes of pleading and complaining, they magically found a room. To smooth things over, they gave us a plate of fruit. Only after hunting down the manager and being very demanding we were given one night free for our second room. In my mind this didn't even get us back to even on what we had to pay for the first night on the second hotel room. If you ask me this hotels way of handling bookings was a complete joke. I really got the impression if you had a room booked and a confirmation number, you were told they didn't have a room. If you went away quietly great, but if you made a stink they would find a room. A terrible way for a hotel to do business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for night before Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Steveh3Texas
Reviews.Content: We flew into Boston Airport and stayed 2 nights at the Seaport Hotel prior to our cruise from Boston Harbor. This was a perfect location for either the Port or the Airport. The Silver Line (which is a bus with its own passageway into the subway network) stops right next to the Hotel. At the airport, hop on the Silver Line bus and for less than $3, you are delivered to the hotel. When going to the Port, take the other Silver line bus and it drops you off right next to your ship. Or a short cab ride to either. The hotel is located near the water but is not in the Downtown area. Once again, the Silver line takes you into the subway system and you can be walking the Freedom Trail with no problem. We saved money on cab fare and spent it for a corner King room. Great views and very large room. The staff wasn't too impressive, concierge not too friendly, never saw anyone in lobby to help with bags, front desk refused my request for a one hour late check-out (my fault for having booked a popular room). If cruising out of Boston, I would stay here in a flash. Also, read my review of No Name Restaurant which is within walking distance of the hotel. Join "I Prefer" program before staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed and good view but pretty small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: schayward
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty nice with views of the water. It in the financial district so it's a little out of the way for much of anything else. Although if you're traveling with kids it is only about a 8 minute walk to the children's museum. The bed was great but the room itself seemed a bit smaller than average. Overall I would say this is best suited for the business traveler unless you have a car or don't mind taking cabs everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: JT14
Reviews.Content: I needed an overnight stay between a late international arrival and an early domestic departure. I had originally planned to stay at one of the connected airport hotel (which I have experience of). However, their rate was high so I looked around. Am glad I did. The Seaport is less than 10 mins in a cab - by uncongested freeway - from the airport. So it is absolutely as convenient as any of the aiport hotels. Factoring cabs, it probably adds up to the same rate but has the following advantages: - no waiting for a shuttle/long walk - bed linens are very comfortable - free wifi - good food (I took a late meal in the bar) - extremely friendly and professional staff. I wouldn't particularly choose to stay here if I was visting Boston downtown. Overall, the hotel is a good but not remarkable 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Girlstar128
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Seaport Hotel over Labor Day weekend. We were there for a wedding, and this was the recommended hotel. We are really happy we stayed here. The service was excellent, the rooms were clean and nicely furnished, bathrooms and toiletries were very high quality, and the food in the restaurants was good. The bellhops and front desk staff were very helpful. The only area that needs improvement is the concierge. The one time we tried to use the concierge (to ask for directions to the childrens museum), there were 3 people ahead of me, and she kept calling out for help, but nobody came. After waiting 10 minutes, I went over and asked one of the guys working the front door and got my answer in 10 seconds. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ignored request for repairs”
Reviews.Author: cortlandtgal
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to find that a light bulb was out in the ceiling fixture and the Bose wave radio did not work . We put a call into guest services for maintenance to come up and address our issues. During our 3 day, 2 night stay no one ever came up to fix these items.

Reviews.Title: “very good experience”
Reviews.Author: jokim41
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston for a relative's wedding, and we stayed at the Seaport Hotel for two nights. The rooms were cozy, though a little on the small side, especially with a rollaway crib. Cleanliness was excellent, and service was also excellent. The location was wonderful, close to convenience store across the street and restaurants within walking distance. The in-hotel coffee stand was also very convenient. Finally, the computers available both within the room and in the lobby were a definite plus, making airport check-in much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Seaport Hotel has it all!”
Reviews.Author: cajohnson21
Reviews.Content: Great food, great service, great location! We stayed at this hotel to see a concert nearby. The views were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night before a cruise. I was upgraded to a room that a view of the harbor on one side and a view of the downtown on the other. There was three rooms, a bedroom area, bathroom, and living area. The decor was modern and the bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly. I did not eat in any of the restaurants and to my knowledge, I just saw one in the lobby. I did not use the pool. But the lobby was pleasant and modern. There was Internet in the room and a rental car company in the lobby of the hotel which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Calio
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel were the really friendly, helpful staff; they were great the whole time we were there. The hotel itself is tasteful and attractively decorated and the location, although not downtown, was fine for us as tourists. There is a subway just over the road but even to walk in to town takes little more than 10-15 minutes strolling along the waterfront. We stayed in a harbor view room and the view was good, the room itself was a good size and very clean and nicely appointed. Plus they had a fridge that you could actually use for a couple of your own bits and pieces. The bed was huge and soft and they have a fab 'library' of different pillow types that you can chose from. We ordered room service which was (as usual) a little expensive, but nice enough. We didn't eat breakfast here since it wasn't included in our rate and was really expensive, plus there are great places in town to grab a bite. When looking for a hotel we found the rate here pretty reasonable compared to many of the otehr hotels in town which didn't have such good reviews. The only downside was that some other guests just didn't seem to care that slamming thier door at all hours might possibly disturb others!!!! This wasn't a huge problem, just annoying the couple of times it happened...people can be so ignorant!!!!!!! Having said that, this can happen anywhere, in any hotel. All in all I would recommend this hotel and we would almost certainly stay there again if in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boston Stay So Far!”
Reviews.Author: nayers4
Reviews.Content: If you have a vehicle like we did, the location is great. It is on the harbor, with excellent views of the airport so our children could watch airplanes take off and land. It is also minutes from Quincy Market, a fun place to eat and shop. The hotel had a $99 special, which is amazing. Most people staying there were for business, but the hotel made us feel wanted even when they saw small children :) Very accommodating and exceptionally clean.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Nice Facilities, a little Expensive”
Reviews.Author: mmcconnell1618
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport this week while attending a conference. The location is very close to both the airport and downtown and is easily accessible by the Silver Line bus/subway. The staff was very attentive and nice with the exception of check-in. My reservation was listed as one day longer and when I asked him to change it to the correct date I got a snooty answer about the Hotel being full and I would be giving up my room. Then he wanted me to initial a form in several places to confirm. It wasn't the best welcome from the cold rain outside. Despite the check-in the rest of the stay was very nice. The rooms were well appointed but not spectacular. Low-energy light bulbs were too dim and gave a washed out look at times but that seems to be standard practice for any hotel these days. Room service was prompt with good food and the room was well cleaned every day. One interesting note is that the Seaport has a "no-tips" policy. I'm not sure if that is a good or poor motivator for the employees but it can be nice as a traveler. There is a $3.00/day fee tacked onto your bill which is split between all staff. They ask that you do not tip directly. Overall the staff was friendly, the facilities were clean and nice but I felt the room price of over $230/night was a bit high for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the tourist”
Reviews.Author: Deepray
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business but if it were my own money there are better values to be found. The hotel is 3.5-4 stars in my book. The rooms are nice but nothing makes them stand out compared to other 4 star hotels in the city. The last hotel I stayed at was the fairmont battery wharf and that hotel was much nicer. The only thing I liked more about this hotel is that you have the option to park your car yourself instead of having to use a valet. The location of the Seaport is not great because the neighborhood is mostly corporate. The good news is that the silver line stop is right across the street. The hotel staff was okay not the most attentive, you have to really reach out and ask for help instead of them coming to you to make sure everything is alright. They need at least two doormen to help people check in. The hotel was fully booked but they really need more staff during peak times. The hotel has a no tipping policy which I like in theory, however without tips I feel like people are less motivated to go the extra distance for you. While no one would ever ask you for a tip at the fairmont, however I feel that they extend themselves because there is always that possibility. That's basically the difference between service in the United States and in Europe. If you are staying at the hotel for business it will be great, the gym is also very nice. If you are a tourist look elsewhere in downtown boston, don't expect to be able to walk anywhere from this hotel. I have to say that the housekeeping staff was excellent, well done!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: 1mat
Reviews.Content: Great location for the convention centre, but not much there for the tourist. Prices racked up for the conference. Hotel pretty nice, but not realy justifying the Â£200 per night price tag. I booked it because it was close to the convention centre (2 min walk). In retrospect, I'd have stayed in town near South station and taken the Silver line from South station to Convention centre (it is mostly underground and avoids the traffic, taking <10 mins).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in South Boston”
Reviews.Author: Peditox
Reviews.Content: Beautiful accomodations; convenient to the Silver Line; beautiful waterfront views

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: worldspectator
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Seaport Hotel. It was clean, quiet and our room had a lovely view of the harbor. We could walk to the wharf area in 15 minutes. We were very happy that we made the choice to stay out of the downtown area. Breakfast buffet was excellent and good value.

Reviews.Title: “terrible the pool was advertised as heated and was like ice”
Reviews.Author: rocdoc1211
Reviews.Content: overall the hotel was ok we were there to use the pool and the gym the pool was like ice and the gym was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but location is not thebest”
Reviews.Author: vbabayko
Reviews.Content: Over all Hotel was great, lobby is kind of small, but rooms are wonderful. Very comfy beds, great linens and sheets, you can sleep all day in those beds. We had a little bit of a problem with AC it either blew too much or hardly any. And water in the shower was not too hot, it was warm but I like my water steamy hot. BUt the beds made up for everything.. Food in the hotel is ok, actually we were very disapointed with food overall in Boston, every restaurant we went in to had horible food, and we went to high end expensive restaurant. The restaurants around the hotel had the best food, so dont go searching for restaurant all over city go by the once by hotel, better food. Te hotel location is ok, if you are visiting Boston for liesure, not business. Its kind of far from a lot of things, you end up doing so much walking, in a big city its kind of hard. We ended up taking taxis a lot and spend way too much money on taxis. We were with a group of 6 people. I would recomend this hotel becuase it is very comfy and you do get a very good rest in the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- could not do more to help”
Reviews.Author: zotar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on a trip round the east coast. What a great hotel! OK- it is not in the middle of Boston, but it is only a 15 min walk to the centre ot a minutes walk to the Silverline bus which regularly connects you to the subway system. There is also a free bus which takes you downtown every 5 minutes. Our room was excellent and the gym is excellent too. We had stayed in a number of hotels on our trip and this was by far the best. We also needed tickets for the Red Sox game and the fabulous consierge got them no problem- cheaper than the face value. A stay here is an absolute pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Service was Top Notch! Room was Spectacular with a Harbor View!”
Reviews.Author: jimmy4mac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at the Seaport to celebrate our Anniversary. The staff was very helpful and the amenities were unbelievable. Great location and the views of Boston Harbor are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SznNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night in order to go to the aquarium. Upon our arrival we were offered a gift of a stuffed animal for our toddler-the perfect gift! Staff was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and the room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: ryoma23
Reviews.Content: We spent a night to send our son to a boarding school near Boston. The parking fee of $32 a night is too expensive, and the quality of the breakfast buffet is not up to the class of the hotel. Cold water not coming out of the tap in a satisfactory flow, and if we mixed it with hot water it was too hot. On the other hand, all other elements are positive and we would recommend the hotel if you are willing to spend $200+ for one night without breakfast, which is too expensive again at $19.50 for a buffet not too rich.

Reviews.Title: “Our Boston trip was amazing and the hotel stay was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: stacylingerfelt21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a weekend trip to Boston this labor day weekend (2010). We had an amazing time in Boston.
