The Seaport Hotel was amazing from the awesome harbor view, great location to the T and great view of the city. The concierge was very friendly and helpful in telling us where to get great pizza and where to get on the T at. The pillows that were on our bed were made out of feather and we personally don't like feather pillows, but all we had to do was call down and new pillows were brought to us. We actually got to choose which type of pillow we wanted...the hotel had about 10 different types of pillows to choose from. The hotel also had free internet service which is an added bonus. The hotel is located right across from the T station which was extremely helpful and convenient to travel Boston. We will definitely visit Boston again and when we do, we will stay at the Seaport again. 5 stars in our book!

Reviews.Title: “A Joy to Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: mom2dancergirls
Reviews.Content: I loved the Seaport experience. In Boston for a conference at the World Trade Center, the location was obviously perfect. The accomodations made me wish my conference was longer. The fitness facility was great with all the standard aerobic exercise machines (treadmill, elliptical, etc) and a nice selection of weight machines and free weights along with exercise balls and mats and a great selection of classes available for a small fee. The Seaport offers a Pillow Library so you can choose the pillow that best suits you. The bed was so comfortable as it was, I never needed the "library". The room is nicely appointed with everything a traveler needs (including iron and ironing board, fridge, free wifi and Keurig coffee maker in each room). But the thing that makes the Seaport so marvelous is the service and attitude of the staff. To a person, every interaction I had with employees of the hotel (and the world trade center as well) was overwhelmingly positive. They were helpful, prompt, pleasant and extremely competent. The no tipping policy was a little difficult for me to follow given such great service.

Reviews.Title: “What a great view”
Reviews.Author: duffy305
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect when we booked this room and to my delight the view was fantastic. The photos on the site do a nice job of giving you an idea of what it is like but being there is so much better. Another pleasant surprise was the liveliness of the bar towards the end of the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: texohlrich
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to everything and beautiful facility. Here for a conference but would come back for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at this hotel because it was the...”
Reviews.Author: JetSetTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because it was the only hotel with rooms still available during ACS conference at Boston Convention & Expo Center. What a nightmare! Stay began by being "greeted" by unprofessional desk clerk. Hotel room was relatively clean, but wall heating unit didn't work -- it would only blow out cold air no matter how warm I set the thermostat. Let this go & dealt with cold evenings because I didn't want to have to deal with hotel staff. Worst experience of all was when - after having "do not disturb" light on, I returned to room that evening to find that comforter I'd placed on the ground had been thrown back on the bed, my pajamas had been touched and folded on dirty comforter and, worst of all, my toothbrush was removed from glass holding it safely off counter and placed on a hotel towel (bristles and all touching it - gross!). Other toiletries had also been touched/moved around. Called the manager on duty and he forwarded call to security who did nothing but (30 minutes later!) send up someone with cheap disposable toothbrush. Location was okay (~7 min walk from conference), rooms okay, parking was only ~$30-something/day, but rude, unprofessional staff made this stay a horrible experience. Do yourself a favor and go anywhere BUT Seaport. If you're in the area for a convention, book your room early so you can get a decent hotel. You'll be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch! So convenient to get around Boston”
Reviews.Author: Cher017
Reviews.Content: This summer we stayed two different times at the Seaport Hotel. Both stays were great. Even though it is not near the main hub it was so easy to get around Boston on the T. The silver line is right next to the hotel. A car is not necessary in town! The hotel is immaculate with great service and friendly, professional staff. Will definitely make this our hotel to stay at when we go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great beds, free Internet, loved it”
Reviews.Author: JosephSloboda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference and i have to say i was very surprised. Based pn the low price of the room I was not expecting the hotel to be very nice. To my surprise i could not have been more wrong. First, the hotel is "service inclusive" which means that nobody who works here will even accept a gratuity, and we tried real hard to tip the bartender and he refused (twice). And with this being said i would have thought that the service would be sub-par but it definitely was not. Everyone who works at this hotel understand the meaning of the word customer service. The rooms were very clean and the beds are very comfortable. Flat panel tv's and free wifi throughout the hotel is also a very nice change from many of the hotels we have stayed at. There are good restaurants and nitelife within a very short walk, and just a 10 min taxi ride to the airport. I highly reccomend this hotel. Joseph Sloboda

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss: Sevice is a gamble”
Reviews.Author: redsunglasses
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from the reviews. Overarching theme: either service was great or substandard. There was no middle ground, and no consistency. I stayed in Boston for a professional conference, and the Seaport was well located for the conference-negotiated rate. Boston prices are high, and the prices I saw were comparable. The shampoo and coffee didn't get restocked the first two nights, so I left a note for the maid, and the problem was resolved. Room service was very late twice; both times I was quoted 15-20 minutes for a bowl of soup, and it took up to 45 minutes. I did try to go down to the lounge area, the Taro, and sat there for 10 minutes without getting waited on, so I left. (Most complaints happen during non-busy times.) The next time I ate there the service was great. Finally, the complimentary umbrella was broken. No problem, I brought it downstairs to ask for a new one and the staff member said "You're the third person looking for one, sorry, I don't have any. " No solution, no follow-up...just out of luck I guess. Okay, but several hours later, I called down to guest services and they brought one right up. Finally, for the last two nights, I've noticed small welts on my abdomen and back...strictly reporting my observation. Maybe I'm having an allergy to something, draw your own conclusion. I don't expect a six-day stay to be perfect. I waited tables all through high school and college, and things happen. But, if I were the manager, I think I would have some quality issues on my hands. And I don't plan on recommending it or staying there again, even though the view was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: fluffnfold
Reviews.Content: I was pretty pleased with this hotel overall. I stayed here for only one night with my spouse while he was attending an event at the BECC (Boston Exhibit Convention Center). It was a Saturday night, and there were many weddings and social events in the hotel. Our room was on the fifth floor, the floor above some of the event rooms, and it was a little loud at times. The location is great for the convention center; it's an easy walk over a bridge on an extremely low-traveled street. The lobby area is small but attractive, with beautiful floral arrangements that they seem to change every Sunday (when I arrived on Saturday, the flowers were not the same as when I left on Sunday). There is a gift shop, coffee bar (Seaport Cafe), a more formal restaurant (Aura), and then a more casual bar/restaurant with some outdoor seating (Tamo). I saw the fitness center, which seemed well-outfitted, but not the indooor pool. There is a very small outdoor garden space on the plaza level if you feel you need to relax outside. Parking is included in this hotel, as are all tips - very unusual in the USA. The valet parking attendant and bellman would not accept tips, telling us that service is included. The rooms are a decent size, with a small seating area with two comfy chairs. Bathrooms were a good size also, and stocked with Gilchrist & Soames products. There was a bathrobe, safe, and umbrella in the closet, and there's an empty small refrigerator for your personal use (it was only filled with four bottles of water - which were not complimentary). There is a 7-11 convenience store as well as a Dunkin' Donuts across Seaport Boulevard, so it's easy to buy things to bring back to the room. But beware of bringing wine or beer into the hotel - we were told that it was against Boston city law to bring alcohol into a hotel room. We were stopped in the lobby and asked to check out cooler containing beer (and it was just a 12-pack, enough for personal use for 2 people for 2 days; it wasn't like we were rolling in a keg!) There are a few restaurants within walking distance: the Barking Crab, Daily Catch, Legal Test Kitchen (LTK), Mortons, Wicked Priest, Anthony's Pier 4. The hotel location is really close to the traveling Cirque du Soleil production called OVO, and we were fortunate to score great seats at the last minute. We weren't sure what to expect, having seen permanent shows like KA and O in Las Vegas, but it was excellent. It was very easy to get to Logan Airport from this hotel, a 15-minute trip costing only $2 per person. There's a subway station for the gray line right outside the plaza-level door. (It's a bus, though, not a subway train that drives you to Logan.) I would stay here again if I were in town for a convention or trade show. While it's a short walk across a bridge to the Downtown/Financial District area, it's probably not the location that I would choose for a stay unrelated to a convention-center event. On the other hand, it's really easy to reach the airport from this hotel, and since you can even see the planes lined up on the runway across the river, it could be a viable option for an airport hotel (without the noise) that still allows you to enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect conference hotel, though not cheap.”
Reviews.Author: rebg23losangeles
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, modern interior design & decoration, excellent location across the street (literally) from the Harbor & water-taxi stand. Guest room was very nice, though still want more AC outlets(!). Breakfast buffet was pretty good but was $24, which is pricey. Also rooms weren't cheap at $249, but like a lot in life, you get what you pay for. Conference center is fairly big, and laid out logically, so no silly long walks to get around. Top-shelf AV gear, and above-average food too. Aside from minor quibble about $$, the computers in the business center were set up a bit funky, in that the nice iMac (which I prefer) wasn't configured to print, and the Windows machines didn't allow direct access to USB thumb drives for printing stuff from it. They expect you to email it to yourself then open attachment from web email -- not very slick, but minor overall. From BOS airport, take the Silverline bus!! In the airport / baggage claim, look for 'T' transit-ticket-vending machines & buy a $5 pre-paid fare / ticket. Look or ask for for Silverline stop at Pickup curb, and the First Stop after leaving airport is 'World Trade Center / Seaport Hotel', 4 miles from BOS. The fare is $2, so keep your fare tix for the return to airport, else cab is $15 or so w/ tip. Would recommend strongly and would go back for biz or vaca (tons of walkable destinations + water taxi is great).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location for summer in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Hardscrabble34
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Seaport Hotel. Easy to get to, with convenient parking on site. Great location to explore the newly redeveloped South Boston waterfront, or stroll all the way up to North End. The Silver Line makes getting anywhere further away, very easy as well. Staff extremely friendly and helpful, from basic advice to digging in the kitchen for late night chocolate. Booked online and got a great deal as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and wonderful surprise.”
Reviews.Author: JBORL
Reviews.Content: This hotel greatly exceeded my expectations. The quality of the rooms and the very helpful staff compares favorably to any of the top tier chains. Don't let the reasonable room rates fool you. This is a first rate hotel. Superb fitness facility to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stoppinf off point for Provincetown ferry”
Reviews.Author: Jack186306
Reviews.Content: A quality hotel that became "budget" when they were able to accommodate a family in one room for an overnight before we caught the early P'town ferry

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Place! Employees who care!”
Reviews.Author: Cleogirl33
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Seaport Hotel. Our trip didn't start out as planned... my boyfriend shattered his ankle the 2nd day of our trip. Unfortunately we weren't able to get around the hotel & area like we would have wanted. BUT... the front desk clerks obviously felt our pain and actually "cared" about us. They sent up a beautiful wine & cheese tray (complimentary) to our room since we couldn't get out and about. I thought that was very sweet and not typical of most big hotels. Thanks so much Seaport (and Tanesha!)... you made our stay a little better considering the circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of false rates!”
Reviews.Author: waileacapital
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is great and the staff friendly- If you decide to extend your stay, beware- they will charge you more than what is online. I tried to negotiate with the front desk, because posted rates were $100 lower and they would not honor that. Since I had already stayed at the hotel for 3 nights at the higher rate, it would have been courteous to extend the price for my family. So much for trying to keep customers happy. I think I will give the competition my business next time. Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel, beautiful and immaculate...”
Reviews.Author: Rdnu
Reviews.Content: Loved hotel, beautiful and immaculate. Location great, quiet with only 10 minute walk to downtown. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “CUSTOMER SERVICE DOES STILL EXIST!”
Reviews.Author: LN2BFIT
Reviews.Content: this was by far the best customer service experience i have had in a long time - from OMRA making my reservation, to front desk woman at 3am when i arrived, to extremely helpful concierge, to wake up call service, to check out - everything was wonderful and everyone was so helpful and pleasant. beautiful room with comfy king size bed, large bathroom, great shower water pressure :), view of the water, just an overall great experience. you should definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Accomodations, Staff, and Services”
Reviews.Author: emdeming
Reviews.Content: There is no other hotel I'd recommend higher than the Seaport Hotel in Boston. We used nearly every service they offer, with the exception of the on-site restaurant. Without fail they performed in a courteous, professional, efficient, and accurate manner. We asked for nothing that we didn't get - except the extra feather bed (at no charge) because they were all in use for that week. Take special note...you can order from their extensive "pillow menu" to create the perfect sleep experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and friendly”
Reviews.Author: halltab
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a conference and an extra day for sightseeing. The hotel has a no-tipping policy. We needed something brought to our room one night, and the staff person was prompt and courteous but firmly refused the tip we offered. Hotel internet connection was strong but slow, like most hotels. The room was very clean, beds very comfortable. We thought there might be noise at night, but it was very quiet. It is an easy walk to downtown Boston and also very easy access to I-90.

Reviews.Title: “Seaport Hotel comes through again”
Reviews.Author: Prof01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Seaport a year ago and not much has changed â€“ thatâ€™s a good thing. Again was given a suite (thank you, Seaport) w/ 1.5 bathrooms (w/ heated floors) & separate living room. Huge windows in BR & LR. TV in LR, BR & B. Bose sound system w/ iPod dock, coffee maker, robes, fridge. Lights everywhere. Free Internet (Seaport provides computer, plus cable & wireless for your computer) is much faster than last summer. Can make long distance calls in continental US over the Internet for free. Large multi-head shower is best hotel shower weâ€™ve used & weâ€™ve stayed in a lot of hotels. Orchids in LR and throughout hotel. Sufficient number of elevators so no waits. Super staff â€“ attentive, nice, hard working. Housekeeping greets you w/ your last name. No tipping policy. Great location â€“ across the street from the ocean, across walking bridge to convention center, good mix of restaurants in area (Anthonyâ€™s Pier 4, Mortonâ€™s, Dunkin Doughnuts), 20 min. walk to Faneuil Hall (but taxis always out front), very close T stop, etc. Weâ€™re looking forward to our next stay later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families”
Reviews.Author: 19mel57
Reviews.Content: My nine year daughter and I accompanied my husband on business. It is definately a business class hotel and not geared toward families. I couldn't even get my child a bowl of ice cream at 4 in the afternoon. Staff gave me directions to the 7-11 across the street. They do have a little take out area for bakery items and coffee that kept limited hours. The few questions I asked the desk regarding restaurants and museums weren't answered correctly. It was fine for my husband because it is across the street from the World Trade Center and a train station.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: DavidUmstot
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed, great views, easy access to Logan airport and downtown, great value for this class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming port in the late-night storm...”
Reviews.Author: TraceeT
Reviews.Content: After being badly abused by Airtran Airlines at Logan (1st and LAST trip with that airline), the Airport Hotel Information guy, Kenny, urged us to go to the Seaport as they were able to arrange a last minute reduced room rate for us. We owe you a lager Kenny, what a sweet deal! Beautiful Harborfront location, friendly staff, CLEAN rooms, and beds that rival that other "Heavenly Beds" place. No complaints at all...I think we should get the Seaport Hotel people to give the Airtran Airlines people some tips on customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, what a beautiful experience!”
Reviews.Author: FenwayFan23
Reviews.Content: I attended a family wedding at the Seaport...it could not have been a more beautiful event. The staff was attentive, the attention to the multitude of wedding reception details were extraordinary, our hotel room was gorgeous...oh, Boston you're my home! If you are planning a wedding, I give this place a 10+.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious experience/probably not great for kids”
Reviews.Author: leafpeeper98
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Take a look at the very comprehensive review by Dessup of Pittsburg for a listing of all the little amenities that have been so thoughtfully provided. We booked through a bargain outlet and were still given a room with a partial harborview. It was named one of the best places to work in Boston, and I can see that reflected in the relaxed, yet professional way that the employees conduct themselves. All tips are included which employees readily volunteer. Obviously, someone is doing something right as they all seem to be genuinely helpful and welcoming, All in all, a heavenly experience. One small quibble is that the pool is a lap pool. Just three lanes of humans swimming round and round. No chances of floating around and just enjoying the water. This would not be a good place to take the kids. The pool area is very nice and the health club swanky with classes happening.

Reviews.Title: “I want to move into this hotel, Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Hooper191
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. Very spacious with a couple of restaurants, a high end fitness center, and the rooms were beautiful! Very clean, spacious, comfortable, all you could ask for in a room. The location is great, near the harbor, restaurants and sight seeing near by, not as busy as the downtown area. The staff was very helpful and polite. Highly recommend staying here. Would be great for leisure or business purposes, they have everything you'd want. Conveniently located across the street from the subway, easy to get to downtown area or north end.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Home”
Reviews.Author: rottieluver
Reviews.Content: Check-in was seamless. Rooms were bigger than other 4 star hotels, clean, and comfortable. The pillow library was nice. Bathrooms spacious, robes comfortable, and Gilchrist/Soames amenities. This is a 3-4 block walk to Fanueil Hall, but safe with lots of walkers even in the evening. Close to LTK, Mortons, Barking Crab, Childrens Museum. Has free computers for guests as well for those of us who did not bring work laptop with us. Could update TVs as they are small.

Reviews.Title: “A mix of luxury and average”
Reviews.Author: dessny
Reviews.Content: This place was a little confusing on quality. The room was furnished with an out-dated topped built in, with lots of storage. But the other tables were nice wood pieces. They have a card telling about their pillow library. And various density pillows on the bed. That made me happy. The bed left me nothing to complain about. The curtians matched the era of the built-in counter top. The closet was stocked with an extra blanket in a bag. (I'm sure that's good for allergies.) The iron seemed a little better than most hotel irons. There also was a large safe (big enough to fit a laptop). Also a robe and umbrella. They have Bose radios and keurig coffee makers in the rooms. Again, the toiletries left me confused. The shampoo was strong smelling and harsh, but everything else seemed mild. I like that they use a pump for soap at the sink. (seems less wasteful) Something interesting that they had were doorbells on the rooms. The wireless Internet was free. So was the gym. Which was a real full blown gym with exercise classes. Parking cost us $30 for a 2 night stay. There is a cafe, bar, and restraunt down stairs. The cafe was great for a quick breakfast. And we got the "trio" for dessert and coffee at the bar. They brought a pot of fresh coffee and the desserts were well worth it. Oh, and they have a no tipping policy in the hotel. So no maid tip, and tip was added to our bill at the bar. So overall... We liked it but it fell a tad short of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously high price for ridiculously bad experience”
Reviews.Author: truthbetold_10
Reviews.Content: There for a conference, was expecting massive amenities given the nearly $300 per night price tag. The room was small, cramped and not ready when we checked in. The bed was too soft. Housekeeping did not service our room! The concierge - while helpful - was backed up 10 people long. The conference rooms were a two block walk from the hotel. The food was terrible - salad with no dressing, cold rubbery ravioli and the food service was brusque.

Reviews.Title: “good option at waterfront”
Reviews.Author: annablume
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2x there. from the waterfront options it seems to be the one you where you get most for your money. recommend the upgrade for waterfront view, especially the corner rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of your room assignment”
Reviews.Author: cajd019
Reviews.Content: BEWARE The Seaport staff assigns the worst room in the hotel to a single, elderly women traveling alone... adjacent to the elevator resulting in a sleepless night. I wasn't aware of the proximity of the elevator until I returned to the room very late or I shoud say early in the morning. VERY NOISY EVEVATOR. This is an expensive hotel, but not as plush as many others where I have stayed in the US with lower rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, value ok, beds need replacing...”
Reviews.Author: advisorX007
Reviews.Content: I think this is an ok hotel however my major complaint it the sub par sleep quality. I guess if you like no firmness at all in a bed then this is a great one for you but if you need support forget it. There was also some noise the second night I was there, a droning mechnical sound kept humming, it took 2 hours to fall asleep. This was probably some a/c unit in another room or I was near the a/c unit for the floor. TV could be updated, very small, must be an original LCD panel. Was not able to check the pool or gym, but the pictures looked good. Was not able to use the restaurant, bar, or deli which all looked inviting. The conference areas were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “For almost $300 a night I expected more!”
Reviews.Author: Gina2510
Reviews.Content: It was just some little things that really annoyed me with the hotel. I didn't like the fact that the gym closed at 9pm and basically had a health club feel to it. You couldn't just scan your room key and go in to work out. You had to sign in which obviously means since there's an attendant they weren't open all night! They closed at 9pm! Including the pool. I thought that was lame. Not even free coffee in the morning. When we checked in they couldn't find our reservation and then said it was for the previous week. How was it for the previous week when I called to confirm the day before?That's never happened to me before. There wasn't too much going on in the location, kinda boring. Just far enough from downtown to be dead. There was only water in the mini bar which I thought was weird for a "fancier hotel" and forget about the room service menu! $16 for small eggs with toast. Sides like tomato slices were $8! Even at more expensive hotels I've never seen such crazy prices. I think I just expected something to stand out like a big jacuzzi tub in the bathroom, you know something special. On the plus side it was overall a clean, nice looking hotel. There was a mortons right across the st. and they have a great bar menu now which is a great deal for such a nice restaurant.......I loved the bed too! It was nice and soft. They also take small dogs which is a big plus! To me this hotel is comparable to any $100 hotel. You're just paying for the fact it's in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good high-end chain hotel in Boston harbour”
Reviews.Author: mandaJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we had to extend our New England trip due to the volcanic activity. This was one of the hotels which was provided and paid for by British Airways. I have to say what a treat it was to be staying in such a lovely hotel under the circumstances we found ourselves in. The hotel is situated 3 miles from Logan airport and is within walking distance of the city centre. The immaculatley clean and unthreatening subway stop is a short walk from the hotel and can take you to Boston Common within minutes. Water taxis and ordinary taxis area also easily accessible close to the hotel. The hotel stands proudly near the harbour and close to the Boston World Trade Centre. First impressions inside are positive, with the reception area being spacious, tidy and nicely decorated. A huge display of fresh flowers took centre stage in the reception, and modern artwork was on the walls. The reception staff were very friendly and hospitable, being especially sympathetic to our plight!! Our 'deluxe-double' room on the 11th floor was spacious and very comfortable, having two double beds, a large flat-screen television, IPOD docking station and a Bose radio. Internet access was free and a computer was on a large work desk. The bathroom was adequately spacious and was stocked with towels and complimentary toiletries. Recycling bins were available in the room. The room was at the front of the hotel and had fantastic views of the harbour and the city centre. Food was good at the Seaport - we ate there at breakfast, lunch and dinner during our three day stay and enjoyed tasty, freshly cooked food. The waitresses in the bar area were very professional, and we especially enjoyed breakfast as the waiters were incredibly funny and accommodating. All in all we had an enjoyable stay at the Seaport Hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone. Thank you to the volcano for allowing us the opportunity to experience the Seaport - had we gone home on time I feel we would have missed out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just top notch”
Reviews.Author: stingray62
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up in front we were treated like special guests. Staff were professional and over helpful. Rooms equipped with everything you need. Bed was super comfortable. Just a nice place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Not a good weekend”
Reviews.Author: VisitNJ
Reviews.Content: We arrived before the water main break and spent 3 nights. The hotel was not very accomodating with the bottled water -- housekeeping didn't replenish them or the coffee. The towels and robes were very stiff and scratchy. The computer screen wouldn't turn off and glowed all 3 nights. View was lovely. We walked to the Quincy Market area and ate lunch there. Lots of people. Ate dinner at Pier 4 across the street -- wonderful seafood. Ate dinner next door at Mortons -- famous steakhouse. Third night we ate dinner at the Union Oyster House -- great seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Guess we had an Off Weekend”
Reviews.Author: AmyGust
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at reading some of these other reviews of the Seaport hotel in Boston. While it seemed to have potential to be an outstanding 5 star hotel , this must have been an off weekend. The parking concierge was welcoming, helpful and efficient. Then we stepped through the doors and it all ended there. I had prebooked using the online reservation system, so we had no problem that way.but the staff had an edge that day, and were not very welcoming nor helpful. we were not even told our room number! Had to look at the key and ask somebody in the Lobby where to find the elevator. truly, we had our luggage, room paperwork and just stood there looking lost. We booked a Harborview room and that was a true delight. Although the bed looked as if it had been sat upon several times after being made, we looked beyond that to great view of the Harbor. We attended a dinner in the Lighthouse Room. The staff there were incredible. Polite, respectful, smiling, helpful, and presented the food and themselves and ultimately the Hotel in a very posivite reputable manner. Then we returned to the room. This was the weekend of the Water Main break and Boston was under a BOIL Water ordinance. There was no signs nor information beyond a piece of paper slipped under our door that said we would be allowed to use the small bottles of water ($2.00 each) at no charge. 2 small bottles for drinking and brushing teeth . I started to worry about the water served at our meal and the ice in our drinks and the food prep.....but I tried to ignore this and gaze out the window at the wonderful view of Harbor lights. There was a computer in the room. it apparently was broken as there were all types of warning windows and Low Battery alerts. But the dang thing would not turn off.....so we tried to sleep with a glaring monitor....then gave up and threw a towel over the whole thing. we really didn't want to call maintenance at 2am. we read the inroom information and were hoping to see a map of some sort. we did not know there was a pool..and when we found the Fitness room it was locked tight. The lack of information regarding what ended up being a State of an Emergency, the lackadaisical attitude of the front desk staff, the "Surprise" extra charges and taxes and fees on our bill....all added to a less than favorable stay. In all fairness i would try a stay there again. It is conveniently located. There are several places to dine near by, some great walking places and if you get the right room, that wonderful harbor view.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - top notch service!”
Reviews.Author: shegeek_emc
Reviews.Content: Service better than the best hotels in the world. Clean, great location, easy for conventions, overall great hotel. Rooms are a bit small, but all the ammenities to provide the needed things every business traveler needs. AND, not tips - no one would accept one. Super nice change of pace!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lsandi
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a stay at the Seaport hotel and it was wonderful. Excellent staff, big rooms that were immaculate (bathrooms have Gilchrest and Soumes products) and a fantastic pool/spa. We would definitely stay here again. The location is slightly away form the main drag but its 7 minuts in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: CayoRon
Reviews.Content: Fabulous job Seaport Hotel! I recently attended the Simmon's Women's Leadership Conference and loved my stay at the Seaport Hotel. This was my second visit and was not disappointed. Keep up the good work Seaport Team!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Seaport!!!!”
Reviews.Author: runnermike1899
Reviews.Content: First time we stayed at the Seaport Hotel. Were in Boston for 4 days for the marathon. We will be staying here again. Rooms were very nice and comfortable. The Hospitality Suite was fabulous. Would recommend for small families staying. Very nicely furnished & clean. Staff was tremendous.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with excellent staff and great service. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: rob_ct_00
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Seaport Hotel for quick family vacation to Boston last week. It was our first time staying at this hotel and it is not easy traveling with 2 small kids and a lab puppy. From start to finish, the Seaport Hotel staff was excellent and did everything they could to make our stay comfortable and stress-free. The hotel was clean and nicely appointed with a very comfortable lobby and nicely decorated rooms (we were in one of the corner executive suites - well worth the few extra $$). The fitness center, locker rooms and pool were all very clean and fresh-feeling. There are many good restaurants in close distance to the Seaport Hotel so there are quite a few options to eat all meals outside the hotel should you choose to do so. Getting a cab was easy, there is a cab stand right outside the hotel, and you are in close distance to many major attractions. Overall, this was truly one of the best hotel stays we have had in quite awhile and I would definitely return for either busines or pleasure. - Rob in Simsbury, CT

Reviews.Title: “Always happy to stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJMM92648
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Seaport Hotel in Boston quite a few times, and it is possibly the only hotel I ever arrive at that I am instantly happy to be back as soon as I enter my room. It is a very well maintained, upscale hotel, and somehow perfectly bridges the balance between the guestroom needs of the business traveler with those of the leisure guest. The rooms are comfortable, spacious, and have all the amenities one should expect from this level hotel. Having all gratuities included in the price is a big plus, and the free internet and free health club access also adds to the overall high value. The health club is also a fully professional club - big and full of lots of equipment (I'm guessing it has local members). The only downside is that the location is not in the heart of downtown nor a short walk to the main tourist attractions of Boston (unless the city's convention center is your attraction). But it is less than 1 block away from a T stop on the Silver Line that connects by rapid transit bus directly to the airport and to the transfer stations of the other T lines for ease of getting anywhere you want to go in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “weekend trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: NHFamof4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Perfect location, close enough to everything but not in the downtown area. Everything is either a very short cab ride or the T. Clean, grat service. Quiet and beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel on harbor”
Reviews.Author: hessmesss
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend to watch the Red Sox. Hotel is very convenient to Logan and one stop away on the SL1 ($2/trip). We traveled on the T all weekend, and had no trouble getting around town. It does stop running at 1230am, so we had to leave the baseball game a little early to get back to the hotel in time. Great neighborhood! We ate at LTK, The Barking Crab, Flour Bakery, and stopped at Atlantic Beer Garden to watch the Sunday game. Would recommend all of these places! Hotel has a nice restaurant, bar area, and coffee bar, as well as a very large comfy lounge - we just didn't have time to really check those out. Across the street is a dunkin donuts and 7-11 for convenience. Our check in and check out both took 2-3 minutes, very easy, everyone working there was very friendly. Rooms are large and beds are comfortable, Bose stereos and Keurig coffee makers, bathrobes, umbrella, wifi hookup, and flat screen TV. The fitness center was very large, we used the treadmills, the pool is moderately sized but we didn't use it due to lots of children in at the time we were interested in. My only complaint is that we called and orders pillows from their "pillow library" but never received them. Also, the room doors were VERY loud, and you had to pull them slammed to get them closed - we were unlucky to have some noisy neighbors going in/out and heard their doors slamming until 2am one night! Overall, it was a very nice place to stay and I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection with no pretention”
Reviews.Author: katie1220
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport over spring break with my two daughters, ages 6 and 8, and my aunt. The staff arranged connecting rooms for us, which was very helpful. The hotel is sleek and modern, yet comfortable. The rooms extremely well appointed, with a desktop computer, flat screen TV and video game controller provided in each one. The rooms were very clean and well maintained. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a particularly good experience in the Aura restaurant with Chris the server, who went out of our way to please my children. The hotel has a hip looking bar area, and a comfortable lobby that boasts apple computers for the use of guests. Although you are a mile or two from the hub of it all, transporation is easy via the free hotel shuttle and the "T" subway system. If you have kids, be sure to visit the Boston Children's Museum, just half a mile from the hotel, which was fabulous. Oh - and of course the kids loved the indoor pool, which was located in the very upscale fitness center at the Seaport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneCPasadena_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a college tour visit to Boston with two teenagers. The four of us were very comfortable in a corner executive suite. The staff here is the nicest I have ever run into at any hotel - from the front desk, to dining, to housekeeping, they were accommodating, pleasant and helpful. Ritz-Carlton could take lessons from these folks! The location of Seaport is also excellent, right across the street from a subway station. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Many nice,little touches”
Reviews.Author: FwaysGreens
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel with nice touches: clean, attractive room, bathrobes, Bose radio, free internet, non-fogging mirror, attractive lobby, etc. It's very close to the convention center and world trade center, a little out of the way from the main downtown attractions, but very close and easy to get to Logan via the SL1 Silver Line bus. Definitely would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be The Cleanest Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler70
Reviews.Content: I travel for business at least three times a week. I've stayed in the Seaport Hotel about 50 times over the past year. Occasionally I've had minor problems with the reservations, but the reason I keep booking is the cleanliness of the rooms. Not once in the 50 times I stayed was anything out of place. The shampoos have changed once or twice, but the toilet, the tub, the sinks: perfect. The bed: nothing in the world more comfortable. For a good night of sleep, and peace of mind, this is the hotel for you. Pros: price is reasonable for a hotel of this class, location is good for business travelers and tourists alike, and the rooms are perfect Cons: the seaport location is not ideal for everyone, and there is not a ton of businesses open late around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: mmbmv
Reviews.Content: The people working at the Seaport Hotel had to be some of the friendliest, most competent people in the service industry. They anticipated needs (toys for kids, extended parking, great advice) and were just genuinely friendly. Our rooms (we went for the King Suite) were well set up, clean, and very comfortable. The location was great! Had the weather been better, we would have walked everywhere. We walked to the aquarium and the North End with ease, with a two year old in tow (stroller was needed, though). The only two negatives were the television and the food. We might not have noticed the TV but for the rain. The channel selection was not good, and the pay movies didn't allow stop/start. There was a weird hum while watching the movie too. The food was good (they do allow you to order room service from any menu, not just the room service, a BIG plus) but not great. Stick with appetizers, they were the better choice. All in all, a wonderful experience, and one we will be looking to repeat!

Reviews.Title: “impeccable service; yet again”
Reviews.Author: JADS_Christie
Reviews.Content: Every year I frequent this hotel for no less then a 4 night stay and every year they never seize to amaze me with the service they provide. Love when I get out of the taxi there is a nice bellman to help with the heavy baggage after a long travel. Check-in always goes smoothly; thank you once again for the high floor request.. no need for traffic noise after a hard day at work. Only thing I find they are missing is a vending machine in the hotel for those of us who do not want to walk in the cold to the 7-eleven hehe... Bed was a bit hard this year, but now i'm starting to think there may have been a button somewhere to fix that... Rooms are large enough; they have bath tubs for when everything aches you dont need to stand to relax. All in all a great stay... PS the pub down the street has great food...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OregonArt
Reviews.Content: One thing you need to be aware of is that the hotel allows pets, a policy I strongly disagree with, and recommend you ask to stay on the no pet floor. There's regular and also rooms equipped with a portable air filtration system. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and they have a complementary business center with 3 PC's and printers for checking flights/printing boarding passes. For $109 not incl taxes for a king size bed room I think it was exceptional value. We had a problem with the first room but it was resolved quickly, and we moved rooms in about 30mins, and they gave us some compensation on the bill. I rated the hotel 5 star because of how this problem was handled, and the hotel and room seemed brand new (Toto toilets too) . I don't think that it's worth paying the premium for rooms facing the water, and while we did not eat at the hotel we found a place called J Pace and Sons down the street. From the lobby turn left then right at the cross street, and it's on the right about 2 blocks down. They have delicious breakfast, lunches, dinners, etc for $3-7 and a sit down area if needed, it's entertaining too. Travel is easy, the Silverline1 bus from outside the arrivals luggage area of the airport goes to the bus station just across the street from the Seaport hotel. At the airport pay the driver $2. If you go into the city take the same bus to the nearest subway station. Buy tickets in multiples of $2 to avoid left over money on the ticket. The only thing I can really complain about is the small number of tea bags in the room, one can ask for more and they will deliver them but it just seems stingy, maybe it has something to do with the Boston tea party? Last if you go in winter time take warm clothes incl hats, gloves, and boots or walking shoes and watch out for ice if the snow slush freezes.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ansh97
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides perks for Fidelity employees so it was even better. The rooms are luxurious, the view good and the service, too, good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfw1024
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seaport for four days in Jan. 2010 while attending a convention at the Boston Convention Center. The staff is very welcoming, helpful and friendly. I had a problem with the Internet on the free in-room computer, which could not be resolved by the Hotel staff. They contacted their resident computed tech. that left a message suggesting ways to correct my problem along with his cell phone number to call him if his suggestions did not work which I thought went above and beyond. The on-site exercise facilities are top rate. We especially like the steam room, which certainly helped to remove the kinks after spending a day working the convention. We also like the non-tipping policy; itâ€™s so much more convenient to have a service charge added t the bills. All in all we would certainly recommend the Seaport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Class Luxury”
Reviews.Author: bradwana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Seaport last August for seven nights as the hotel was ideally located for the live concerts at The Bank of America Pavilion which I was attending. The neighborhood is quiet but boasts several small restaurants and bars within walking distance. Transfers from Logan airport take approximately 15 minutes. The large rooms have good facilities and the hotel itself has an excellent business centre. Staff are friendly, efficient and very helpful. I was fortunate to secure a room during 'low' season for Â£65 a night through Hotels.com as on a subsequent visit in December the room rate was twice the price! The hotel obviously attracts many businessmen due to it's location south of the financial district. There are better located tourist hotels in the city but for me, The Seaport ticked all the boxes. Excellent Business Class Luxury . .. occasionally at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmpctc
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel but it was way away from downtown they had a bus that stopped in front for workers but the nights were TAXI the lobby was nice we came over from Logan on the water taxi which was awesome the rooms were ok but it was inportnat what side of the hotel you were on

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Happy_To_Travel4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport Hotel while attending a conference and can't say enough wonderful things about the experience. The entire stay was a little oasis of calm and serenity. The courtesy of all the staff was tremendous, and any request was addressed immediately. The room was lovely -- quiet, immaculate, nicely appointed, comfortably climate controlled, with excellent bed and linens. Complimentary WiFi was a huge plus. I would recommend the hotel without reservation to my colleagues, friends, and family. Looking forward to a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, close to ICA”
Reviews.Author: PoetDoc
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, helpful staff, and very clean room overlooking the harbor and world trade center. It was a few minute walk to the Institute of Contemporary Art which was the purpose of the stay. Called the hotel directly and got the best deal and reservationist was helpful to meet needs of 4 people staying in 1 room. This hotel is not part of any big chain. Ate at the Aura restaurant - while a bit pricey the food was outstanding. Free internet (when will other hotels catch on?) Now we are planning to stay there again when the ICA changes exhibit. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a newly constructed area”
Reviews.Author: ZebraNYC
Reviews.Content: In a recent business trip to Boston I stayed at Seaport Hotel Boston. At first I was doubtful about the area and the hotel but must confess it was a great surprise. Seaport is has been all reconstructed from scratch and the outcome is just wonderful. Calm and very safe. The hotel is walk distance from Boston City Center. Front desk is very friendly and very helpful by answering all questions. I stayed in a corner room overlooking the bay, the city and the airport. The room as great space and double glass windows - NO NOISE AT ALL. The only downturn is the windows don't open. Hotel is non-smoking. Bed is comfortable but not the best I slept in. Ropes are good quality and the amenities are excellent. Coffee machine and hair dryer in the room made a difference. Closet is not very big but enought for 2 or 3 days of stay. The living room and the room had tv and computer. Internet is FREE. Great if you are on business because you can leave your computer at home. Great features from the computer: room service, valet and ask questions virtually. Pool and Spa!!! Overall a great hotel and rates are very good too. Buffet breakfast is a MUST!! Great food and service. However the staff at the bar is not very friendly and waiting time is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View. Not sure about the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: avdbeit
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel mostly because of its great view, location, etc. I'm not too sure about the rooms which in my opinion might be ripe for a makeover. Let's face it, this is not a cheap hotel and I don't mind paying a price when it's 100% justified! :) Would however recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: mariec1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, but if I went back to Boston, I would stay downtown. The Seaport was a couple of miles from downtown, requiring an extra subway change to get to downton.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just outside downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: vivacious_vivid
Reviews.Content: Got a $99 rate on the hotel website as a holiday special. The location is right on the wharf, across from the World Trade Center. There are several restaurants around, a 7-11 and starbucks nearby but other than that, not much shopping or things to do. You can catch the silver line T across the street which is direct to the airport if you need that, otherwise you can connect to other T lines to tourist spots. Self-parking is $31 with in/out privileges until midnight the day of checkout, which allows you to spend the rest of the day touring the city if you want. The hotel was easy to find and the parking is in a garage right beneath hotel with an elevator straight to the lobby - uber convenient. I got a king room which was plenty roomy, flat screen tv but not the best reception of all channels. Free wifi was included and had a strong signal at all hours of the day and night. Coffee maker and fridge in room, ice on every floor. The only complaint I have is the taxes that are added to the bill, almost $10 per night which I suppose all Boston hotels have, tis just annoying. They should post the REAL price when you book the place. They also have a free shuttle running into the city near Faneuil Hall and Freedom Trail. Found out about that quite by happy accident :) If you have a car that you want to park easily and go in and out like I did, this is a great place to stay. The $99 rate was quite attractive but would be worth more. If you want to be in the heart of the city, this is not the place though it is easily accessible by the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...if you're coming to Boston and want to be near town, don't look anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: capecodgrl007
Reviews.Content: I've learned to lower my expectations with most hotels, regardless of cost. This hotel is awesome - we stayed here prior to an early a.m. flight tomorrow (very convenient to Logan), and I can't think of a better way to start our New Year's vacay. Beautiful room/suite; decor is contemporary but tasteful and creates a very calm, comfortable yet stylish atmosphere. Thoughtful attention to details; free internet & wifi, VOIP calls, coffee, full compliment of hair dryer, nice shampoo/body lotion, etc. The room we had was very spacious - if you're a business traveller, you could easily stay here for extended stays and be quite comfortable. There's a kitchenette (unobtrusive, but a great touch), nice bathroom with great amenities - even bath salts!! Which I gladly used in a hot bath on a cold night. We had a nice sitting area with a flat screen TV - great for hanging by yourself or entertaining for business, big window with sweeping view. Separate bedroom with corner windows - another sweeping view and a nice change from most small, dimly lit rooms. Also a flat screen in the bedroom, Bose w/iPod adapter, etc. This would even be a nice set-up for a family if you had adjoining or adjacent rooms - room for privacy with nice mingling space too. Again, just a really nice hotel, great staff, and convenient location. Would DEFINITELY highly recommend...regardless of what you're in Boston to do or see.

Reviews.Title: “Short of a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, as charming as you'll get”
Reviews.Author: DonInConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Seaport is simply a splendid hotel: Extremely tasteful without being snobbish, elegant without being cold. Indeed, the staff is remarkably warm and caring - I found this to be true on a business trip in August, and again on vacation in December. Seaport is a modern tower along the waterfront, near the Renaissance and the Westin. Wonderfully convenient to the Silver Line, and in the warm weather it's just a few steps to the wharves & the scenic harborfront. From the Silver line, go UP a level to the concourse & use the lovely plaza-level pedestrian bridge. It brings you in above the lobby, but saves crossing streets and dealing with traffic ... and it brings you in past classical music piped through speakers in the Seaport's little garden area. The front desk staff here is beyond top-notch: Helpful and warm, and well-informed about the city if you have questions. There's also a good concierge. The porters/valets working the door are great, too - equally friendly, professional and well-informed. The good news: There's no "back" side of the hotel facing the industrial zone. Bad news: There's also no front side facing out onto the harbor. Instead, Seaport is set perpendicular to the waterfront (same with the Renaissance) - so views improve a bit if you're on a higher floor closer to the water, but the average rooms have no magnificent water views. The rooms a understated: A slightly nautical theme, perhaps, with light wood tones and light colors. All attractive, new, crisp. Smallish rooms but sensibly laid out with excellent amenities. More importantly, there's there "cozy" feeling that very few business hotels come close to achieving. Enjoy the remarkably sensible doorbells: You use a switch in the room if you wish to illuminate little "service room now" or "please don't disturb" signs. Best of all, the doorbells mean there's none of that hideous keys-on-door rapping in the early morning, followed by the awfully loud "Houskeeeeeeepppping!!" that you hear in so many business hotels. Instead, the maids can use the doorbells - which generate no noise to other rooms. The gym is magnificent - first-rate machines in ridiculous abundance, along with a spa-like locker area (including heated tile floors) with first-rate showers and one of the best steam rooms I've found anywhere. (Don't forget to use the ingenious eucalyptus-water spray bottle; there was one in the men's steamroom that added a lot of sinus-clearing power to the steam. I've heard the women's side doesn't have one -- if not, ask at the desk). The only improvement here would be to make the pretty pedestrian pool more interesting (removing the lap-lane barriers would be a start) ... and surprisingly, there is no hot tub. That's the only serious squawk I've got about Seaport. The restaurant needs a makeover: It has the feel of a Clarion (or an upscale cafeteria at a nursing home) because of the boring design and decor. The overpriced breakfast buffet was just too small and had too few interesting choices. Lunch and dinner might be better. Room service is also mondo expensive. But this is one place where I'd spend the money: Clam chowder, a coke and a pizza is crazy costly, but that 'coziness' factor means a lot. Room service here is more of a treat than a "oh well, I'm too tired to go downstairs" sort of chore. Swing out the flat screen TV and enjoy. Climate control is modern and efficient, amenities are outstanding. Bathrobes and FREE overnight shoe cleaning. Which brings up the nicest feature here: They hit you with a small service charge when you register, but then expect - and accept - no tips. It's not a "tipping isn't necessary" guildeline, but truly a "we kindly request that you not tip" policy. I forgot and offered an extra buck to the cheerful and efficient guy working at the Starbucks - he politely declined, saying that's included already. Free Internet: A very nice extra! Look for special activities here. At Halloween, they did an imaginative game that send kinds to a half-dozen areas of the hotel to gather candy. At Christmas, they had an outstanding $99 a night special - and did up the public areas with plenty of appealing Christmas decorations. Nearby are Legal Seafoods Test Kitchen and several interesting seafood places along the wharves.

Reviews.Title: “A simple room - good price ($90-) for the location”
Reviews.Author: BostonWagga
Reviews.Content: The simple clean and comfortable hotel room we obtained for the night of the "Boston Blizzard" was a close location close to the airport. While we live in Boston we were expecting a early rescheduled flight at 5:30am and felt it may be easier to check in if we stayed closer, after a 3:30am alarm and confirmation the flight was canceled so we got back to sleep. The staff were nice and welcoming. The location is very convenient for close walking distance to the Silver Line MBTA Station that can make a easy trip to many different points of interest in the city including restaurants, convention center and sightseeing. We had a good deal on the no frills simple room for ~$90- so can not complain at all.

Reviews.Title: “Solitude, serenity, and sophistication along the Boston waterfront.”
Reviews.Author: maninthehills
Reviews.Content: Great price through Travelzoo and hotel's own price-matching. Professional, customer-oriented, courteous and helpful hospitality management at every juncture. Overall very modern, well-constructed, well-maintained with nice art touches; compact but adequately-sized rooms with great layout and amenities, including water view. Very soundproof, good clean bathroom, good clothing storage, free wireless, iPod, etc. Bose plug-in. Convenient integrated parking ($31 per; barter for free or reduced, we did and got it). Quieter, less-developed Boston Seaport area is moderately developed and appealing in separation from the ruckus and waterside tranquility. Enough quality local restaurants or just minutes to Chinatown, Back Bay, et al (Boston metro is not that big and at off traffic hours easily navigable). Fairly large scale, but boutique in feel and function. My Boston choice going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with fabulous views of Boston Harbor”
Reviews.Author: FiltonKingswood
Reviews.Content: My second stay at Seaport and it's looking great after the refurb of the restaurant and bar. Buffet breakfast is great value and if you don't want to eat dinner there, the superb LTK is only a few minutes walk away. If the bar's a bit quiet, then head over to the Atlantic Beer Garden. Downtown Boston is only a short walk away and the pool opens at 5am, great news for jet lagged insomniacs! Rooms can be a bit pricey if there's a convention on, but worth checking for any last minute room returns as the prices come down dramatically (on this stay the Seaport was cheaper than the Holiday Inn at Beacon Hill and I booked 10 days before I arrived).

Reviews.Title: “All the little details exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: MurfBoston
Reviews.Content: This is not your average hotel. Here are a few unique experiences...when I came out of my relaxing shower...the center of the mirror was steam free...allowing me to shave without any clearing of steam... My wife liked the black towel for mascara and make up removal. The recycling bins in the room made for purposeful cleaning. The pillows and bed was like a magnet, preventing from getting out of bed. The doors have a shock absorber that minimizes neighbors slamming doors. It was so quiet. The exercise room and pool was exceptional, with cleanliness and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Seaport”
Reviews.Author: Gfinn524
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Seaport quite a few times on business, and they never disappoint. The staff is amazing, respectful and helpful with anything you need. The bar downstairs is a great place to go hangout after work, and the restaurant is absolutely fantastic. The chef puts her own spin on every meal, and it's definitely worth it if you're in the area, to stop by and have a bite. (I recommend any soup they have!) Also, the bar has pub food, the best burgers and fries I've had in a while. All in all, Seaport is my favorite hotel in the area, and I'm sure I'll stay there again this year.

Reviews.Title: “I was not impressed”
Reviews.Author: jumblebees
Reviews.Content: Rooms were adequate,mattresses uncomfortable. Went to have dinner on friday night and menu was very limited as they were having family night and had many children in the main dining room. My colleague and I were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingASAP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seaport for 4 nights in October. This is a great hotel. We were greeted upon arrival and from that point on the staff was wonderful! The hotel is located in the World Trade Center area but you can catch the Silverline directly behind the hotel for any point in Boston. The hotel room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The bar was reasonable and we ate breakfast daily in the restaruant due to my father's limited mobility. The fitness center is probably the best I've ever seen in a hotel. The hotel was also the destination for my son's wedding reception that weekend. It was incredible. Very elegant reception room and again the staff was first class. We were very pleased with all accommodations from beginning to end. The Seaport is pricey, but a splurge once in a while is worth it! Stay here...you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda dropped the ball.”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Alright I stayed at the Seaport Hotel in Boston for a recent trade show. Ill get straight to the point. Cons. The flat screen tv came in really scrambled and the channel selection was very poor. The room service was extremely astronomically over priced for the food quality. The bedding was something youd expect a 95 year old women to put on a spare bed very thick and uncomfortable. I had the misfortune of being in a room near an elevator and this one guy kept going out in the elevator hallway to try to get his girlfriend to go back out with him over his phone both nights I was there he was out there multiple times talking about personal information I only eves dropped because watching the tv was pointless and the walls are very paper thin you can hear everything almost everything in your neighbors room. The 12$ grilled cheese with bacon I ordered in the restaurant came with out bacon and wasn't that good. The restaurant staff didnt seem that concerned with serving their patrons instead they were more glued to a baseball game that wasn't even the SOX!!! Expensive Parking. Pros. The beds mattress was comfortable. Good soap, polite desk staff, Good parking garage staff the guy cut my bill by 1/3 once he saw the look on my face( as my company wasnt paying me to park) Also the staff will refer to you as your name which is cool and the housekeeping will even leave you a voicemail to figure out when you want your room cleaned. They also have a light switch type deal for the do not disturb sign. In short I stayed in a double room im not sure if the suites are nice but I had the opportunity to stay 2 extra days instead of driving an hour in the morning to the trade show but I denied my boss and chose to go home and drive in the next time. It kinda pains me to be negative about this because from the outside and just knowing Boston I always though it would be an amazing hotel to stay on for business of pleasure. If you do stay hear just a suggestion you can get an assortment of hot dogs burger dogs and tosuitos for around 3-4$ at the 7/11 across the street or the dunkies....And watch out for the red light right outside of the hotel just because threes multiple red lights that tell drivers to stop doesn't mean they will.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RonRandDonnaR
Reviews.Content: Seaport hotel was everything we wished for! It was clean with a friendly staff. It's location across the street from the T station was so convenient! Boston is a great place to visit with preteens. It's a nice walking town!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: mmarieh1027
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seaport Boston in August. It was a wonderful stay! Family I was traveling with had a business convention, being held just a couple blocks' walk away at the Convention Center. And, I was able to walk a block in the other direction and catch the Old Town Trolley tour bus for quick, easy, and inexpensive transport throughout the city's destinations. The hotel had great views, depending on your room. Ours was of Boston's financial district to the left and the harbor to the right. We loved it. Hotel cafe was a great stop for a quick bite to eat. And, the hotel business center was a life saver for printing out our e-tickets for our plane ride home. Concierge was helpful, doormen were always there to open our taxi doors. All staff friendly. Room was clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bizman1NewYork
Reviews.Content: The Seaport Hotel was nearly perfect. I liked it's proximity to the metro, yet it was in a quiet off the path street, Parking was very convienient and the rooms were as nice as anything that I've seen for a long time. I travel a lot for business and have stayed in rooms of all of the major U.S. luxury hotels chains and some in Europe and my sense is that this one had a slight feel of a luxury European hotel which makes it a bit different than many of the ones in The States. Among a great reason to stay there was that it is a green facility. They recycle materials when they can and use highly efficient systems for energy consumption as the hotel was desgined by engineers. What's more is the whole hotel is non smoking for those of us who enjoy the luxury of not having to ask for non smoking rooms. I travel a lot for business and If there is one negative I could say about it is as with all luxury hotels in general, especailly in cities like Boston, is that they are not cheap (though I am reading that some people good deals.) I realize that there's reasons for the high costs but one has to ask themselves do they need an expensive lobby, restaurant...when many mid priced facilites offer great rooms for less money without the extra frills, (fancy lobby, restaurants)...other than that I give this hotel a top rating and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: nemserhall1
Reviews.Content: Comfy robes, complimentary umbrellas in each room, wireless access are all available in each room. Very quiet, away from the Financial Center but very easily accessible to all the wharf. ( Children's Museum, Fanueil Hall, Aquarium, Anthony's Pier 4, No Name Restaurant) Silver Line Metro stop just across the street from the hotel. Next to the World Trade Center/Convention Center on the Wharf. Street parking available for those that want to feed quarters. Saturday night and Sundays are free, otherwise hotel parking is $31. Very nice room overlooking the harbor. Very pleasant staff. The bar is excellent but did not eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CharlesofCharlesston
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip back to Boston in 5 years to attend a conference at the new convention center. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the convention center ,on the water, and a 15 minute walk from downtown. The room was available when we got there around 1 PM, clean, and comfortable. Free wireless access is provided in the room. A big plus was the rooms were extremely quiet (never heard the next room) and there was a great exercise facility (locals even go there). It provided everything that my wife and I expected from a hote.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done...”
Reviews.Author: Rich1717
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is eager to help, and the rooms are very nice. The hotel provides access to a very nice health club. It is adjacent to the Silver line which makes it super easy to get to the Airport or the rest of the T-accessible Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: DCroamer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed in a suite while my wife attended her annual meeting at the Boston Convention Center and the Boston World Trade Center. This hotel is a good, solid business/convention hotel. Comfortable but not plush, more utilitarian than luxury. Overall, this is a very good hotel. First, a couple of good things. The proximity to the convention center is very good. The hotel is close to Logan â€“ on the morning I left it took 12 minutes to get to the airport. The gym facilities were new, well maintained and in a nice, light, airy space. The food from room service was good, though limited choice. There is access to public transportation and I believe the hotel runs shuttles during the week to downtown. It was only about a mile walk to South Station, but I noted that there was a â€œTâ€� station near by. Views of the harbor and city from our 15th floor room were spectacular. Close by the new Institute of Contemporary Art. Our room was clean. The service was efficient. Notably, for many of the services, there is no tipping and a service charge is built into the tab. For example, I tried tipping the doorman who helped me with my bags and he refused, as did the waiter who brought up my room service order. The staff was nice, efficient and helpful. The bed was comfortable though not outstanding. There is free wi-fi in the rooms. Now, a couple of negatives (though they are small). Location: the hotel is out on a wharf in what had until recently been an industrial zone/port facility. So, while there are other hotels and office buildings in the area (close to the Convention Center) and some well known Boston restaurants (like Anthonyâ€™s Pier 4 â€“ overpriced and over-touristed) the hotel really isnâ€™t close to the action of the city. There isnâ€™t, for example, a nearby drug store or a lot of choices of restaurants, bars and shopping. For all of those things you have to cab or walk more into the center of town â€“ my guess is that it would be at least a mile and a half walk. Next, I like my rooms cool to cold â€“ especially if Iâ€™m staying on the upper floors of a hotel. You couldnâ€™t open the windows and while the thermostat said it was set at 65, it never felt cool or cold in the room. However, these are minor complaints for a good hotel in a area of the city that is quickly being rebuilt.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Freeway12
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business seminar here last week and I went along. We travel quite a bit and always stay at 4 or 5 star hotels. This place was just ok. Nothing much to elaborate on. We did have a partial harbor view room. However the room was rather small and the bathroom very ordinary. Staff was friendly. Refrigerator in room didn't work. Safe in room was a nice addition however one morning it kept erroring out and we had to call to get security to come up. Waited about 1/2 hour and had to call again and someone was right there. No big deal. If the cost of rooms were not so high, we could probably give it a better review. But with all the choices in Boston, we would stay elsewhere when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: lauralap
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our pre-cruise hotel stay at Seaport. The beds were really comfortable, the rooms very nice and well appointed and the views were beautiful. The only complaint I had was the receptionist was cold and didn't really want to bother answering my questions.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: reech
Reviews.Content: Got a room for two nites thru Priceline for $95 per nite. The Seaport Hotel is easily accesible via the Silver Line on the T. It's also with-in walking distance of Fanuel Hall, the Aquarium and the Common. The Trade Center is right across the street, and there are plenty of restaurants in the area. Everything at this hotel was perfect. The service, the cleanliness of the rooms, the attitude of all the employees, etc. They don't allow tipping, and everyone is still top notch! Had a couple of requests, and the staff were up with-in ten minutes (even at midnite!). You can choose your pillows from a menu- cool! We didn't eat at the hotel, since No Name was right across the street and the food is great there. We were upgraded to a suite (didn't even have to ask!). Room had flat screen TV's, totally sound insulated, and clean clean clean. It's a hotel that has anticipated your concerns and responded to them. Parking is expensive, but it is everywhere in Boston Hotels. They give you readmittance privilidges, so you can take your car out if you want and not have to re-pay. Concierge was great... she advised us to take the T to Harvard and save $$$$ and time. They have a spa and gyma nd even have pilates classes. All in all a wonderful hotel that I would heartily recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hospitality, Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: travelwithmygirls
Reviews.Content: There's really nothing not to like about this hotel. They take great pride in their amenties and service, and it shows. We stayed in a harbor view king with our infant and golden retriever. The room was somewhat basic, but the bed and linens were very comfortable, and the view was outstanding. We order from the seasonal room service menu, and the food was amazing. Artistic plating, super-fresh produce, delicate flavors...it was better than a lot of restaurant meals that I've had recently. We also had an outstanding lunch at Tamo Bar the next day -- bottom line is that Rachel Klein's food is top-notch, and worth seeking out even if you're not staying at the hotel. The staff were extremely polite and courteous, the gym/spa/pool was excellent, and the parking garage was safe and convenient. I love the neighborhood that the hotel is in -- some people say it's a little too remote, but I think it's got a perfect balance of nightlife and peace and quiet. Again, it's almost impossible to fault it for anything -- I highly, highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Prof01
Reviews.Content: The Seaport Hotel is in an up-n-coming area of Boston (South Side), quite near (10 minute straight walk out a side door) the Boston Convention Center. We won an auction at SkyAuction.com and although our winning bid was substantially less than the normal room rate, we were given one of the hotelâ€™s new (only four months old) suites. Best room ever! â€“ a full living room with big flat screen TV; separate bedroom with another flat screen TV and full computer (complimentary although disappointing slow) â€“ but with installed software and also complimentary wireless and wired connection for your own computer; big bathroom with best mirror lighting weâ€™ve found, heated tile floor, huge shower with multi-shower heads plus rainfall and wand choices; comfy bed; PLUS a half bath (6x8 feet) with heated tile floor. Quite simply the best hotel room weâ€™ve experienced and we travel a lot. Great restaurants (e.g., Legal Test Kitchen - LTK, Anthonyâ€™s Pier 4) are within a short walk in either direction. 25 minute walk to Quincy Market. Hotel staff is courteous and very helpful. Hotel has a no tipping policy that is politely â€œenforcedâ€� when you try to tip (e.g., baggage storage). Simply a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: OCNEWMOM
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels all over America, and few experiences have been as positive as my time at Seaport Hotel in Boston. First of all, the service is exceptional, despite their "no tipping" policy. Everyone from the doorman to the concierge to the cleaning staff is friendly, polite, and more than willing to go the extra mile to meet your needs. (The only slight exception was that the bar/restaurant service was only mediocre.) The rooms are very large, brightly lit, clean, and well-equipped. The bed, in particular, was extremely comfortable. The gym is clean and very well-equipped, as well. The sound insulation in the hotel is excellent; although it's located right by the airport, we never heard outside noise or noise from neighboring rooms. In addition, the staff was very accommodating in providing extras to make our stay with our toddler more comfortable, including an extra fridge and a microwave, at no additional cost. To sum up, I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Bed - Hotel Services are Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Micknyny
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this business hotel due to its close proximity to the Provincetown Ferry Terminal. I am a stickler about the bed and bedding -- probably the top thing on my list when reviewing a hotel room. In this case, the bed, bedding and room were all top notch. Interesting to note: the hotel offers a "pillow" menu from which one could phone housekeeping with a special order (down, tempapedic, etc) ... this was a nice touch. While the "king" room not spacious, it was quiet and the furnishings are new, seem expensive, and well-maintained. The public spaces in the hotel were likewise well-appointed. Finally, a note of caution: room service - as found in most business hotels - was a bit on the outrageous side.
