It is clear that this hotel caters to the business traveler on a generous expense account. Most leisure travelers will find the collection of hotel services expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I need in a hotel. No problems at all.”
Reviews.Author: lousyd50313
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport for a week and a half. I was very pleased with the accomodations. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The desk space was ample. The water was always hot. The staff were always friendly. The concierge came up to my room on the first night to help me figure out why my laptop wouldn't connect to their wireless. (It was my fault.) As a downside, the in-house restaurant is very expensive, even for a hotel. But there are many other restaurants in the area, from cheap sandwich shops and a specialty grocer to the more posh Legal's Test Kitchen. I can't comment on the price, because I got a conference discount.

Reviews.Title: “The Seaport was perfect for our stay.”
Reviews.Author: JJB105
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay near the Trade Center and The Seaport was right there. Weekend rates were quite good for the level of service and the facilities available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for young and old alike.”
Reviews.Author: emmasmomVermont
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at another hotel in Cambridge and take the T into town, not anymore. The Seaport Hotel was fantastic. It is located 5 blocks or so from the Boston Childern's Museum and a short walk from the Aquarium and other attractions. The staff was fantastic and I have not had room service that was as quick, courteous and hot and delicious in a long time. My daughter had a great time in the pool and because it is a lap pool, I did not have to worry about the "deep end". I did get a great rate through the hotel's special so I will be watching for that again! Also, it is so easy to get to. Right off of I-93S - I had no problems with traffic or parking. Overall - a great experience. emmasmom

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: zhellings
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Seaport Hotel on the harbor near the convention center and world trade center in Boston. I had read the previous reviews in Trip Advisor and was a little concerned about the comments that it was too far away from everything. All my fears went away in very short order. Our room was an executive suite with amazing views over the piers and Boston Harbor. There were a number of restaurants nearby from casual to very upscale, and there is a silver line terminal literally across the street from the hotel. One day we bought a day pass for the transit system and in minutes we were able to get anywhere in the city. The hotel staff were very courteous, every amenity we needed was in the hotel room - including free wireless access and the cost was very competitive if not less than most other highly rated hotels. In short, we would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel itself- top quality,location is fine but probably not the best option for first time visitors to Boston”
Reviews.Author: farawaymum
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights as part of a longer Boston visit after joining the "I prefer "program and got not only a great rate but an upgrade to a really beautiful 2 room suite.I found the location on the Silver T line (2 mins walk away) convenient - the T is easy to use, frequent, cheap (buy the 7 day $15 unlimited pass) but you will need to make a few interchanges between the different lines to get to the main tourist sites from this hotel. On the other hand , South Station (for Amtrak and buses) and the Airport are very easy to get to from the hotel via the T. The hotel itself is beautifully appointed with free internet and every comfort you could need in the room plus soundproofing so no door slamming or outside noise can be heard Staff were friendly and helpful- they actually have a knowledgeable concierge. I ate at the on site restaurant for both breakfast and dinner and it was lovely.I am not sure about the no tipping policy they advertise as a compulsory service charge was added to all the meals- not much difference to a tip as far as I can see.The Boston ICA is 5 minutes walk away and is a must see for all Boson visitors- they have a free night (Thursday I think) but it is worth the cost of entry anyway. In summary if you want a really nice hotel and need a change from the usual hotels in other more "touristy" parts of downtown Boston the Seaport Hotel is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, Location terrible”
Reviews.Author: ReadHere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport Hotel because I ran in the Boston Half Marathon (Memorial Day weekend), and the starting line was just outside. It's a typical large convention hotel. If you've got a function to attend at the Boston World Trade Center, or at the hotel (they seem to do a lot of weddings), then ok, you've got to stay there. But for touring Boston, this place is not where you want to be. Too far off on the periphery. The check-in is ok but impersonal. Room is satisfactory. Room service breakfast was ok but not worth the $35 (I had no choice that day, because I had to leave early to line up for the race). Bar was good, and they made an excellent gimlet. Overall, don't come here if you are looking for a great Boston vacation/touring experience. Only stay here if you need to attend a function at the Trade Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennyRilionni
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online for our Anniversary in Boston after reading the reviews. When we got there they treated us with the best service and when they heard it was our anniversary, upgraded us for FREE to a Suite. It was huge and very beautiful. The room was extremely clean, with a great view of teh ocean. The location was fantastic. We stayed in several hotels in the area and this is by far the best value, the best decorated, and the best service for the money !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful in Everyway!!”
Reviews.Author: georgiagalof2
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was absolutely perfect in everyway - clean, friendly staff, very beautiful, great amenities, comfortable beds. The view was breathtaking. The location was great - on the harbor, close to the T and Silver line bus, (which you should take advantage of going to and from airport in and only cost $2.00). My husband, daughter and son in law were there for the Boston Marathon and was very pleased with our selection. We will be there again in the future. You will definitely not be sorry that you chose this hotel and location. I do recommend the Trolley, whichever one you choose, i don't think you will regret it. Enjoyed the stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to World Trade Center area”
Reviews.Author: chris_in_philly
Reviews.Content: If you're in Boston for an event at the World Trade Center or the Convention Center, the location can't be beat. There is a T stop right next to the hotel. There are a number of decent retaurants within walking distance. However, I did not feel like I experienced Boston staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and friendly”
Reviews.Author: world_traveller_wm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at seaport hotel for a conference at world trade center. It is as close one can get to reach the conference venue if it is held at WTC. It is just 10 minutes walk to Boston downtown, and a 5 minutes walk to the subway silver line to conveniently reach anywhere in Boston area. The hotel is very well-maintained. The room is clean and roomy. Staffs are very friendly and helpful whenever I need any assistance. High-speed wireless internet access is available anywhere in the hotel, free of extra charge. For some old laptops without wireless card installed, each room is provided with ethernet cable. I packed the cable accidentally with my other wires & cables. When I offered to return it back to them after I found it in my luggage, I was kindly asked to keep it. I humbaly accept their kindness. It will cerntainly remind me of the nice experience at Seaport Hotel whenever I use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right on the water”
Reviews.Author: demerara54
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights, absolutely no complaints. Everything was as it should be. Location right on the water and the Silver T line. A bit out of the way for nightlife, but cabs are readily available.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to Boston centre!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_traveller86_01
Reviews.Content: We got a good price on the Seaport from Expedia.com. It turned out to be a great deal because this hotel was worth paying much more. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was big and clean. We especially enjoyed free use of the internet in the business centre which helped us to book all our activities. The coffee shop for a quick breakfast in the morning was also great. The hotels 'no tipping' policy which was refreshing. The hotel is really easy to get to from Logan airport (just 5 mins on the silver line) and its also quick to get into the city centre by continuing on the silver line. We bought a 7 day unlimited pass for only $15! The surrounding area is really nice and we felt safe walking at night. There is a dunkin doughnuts and a 7eleven right across the road, outside the hotel's back entrance. We highly recommend the Barking Crab (5min walk) for a cheap seafood dinner in a great atmosohere. The only compaint I do have is the toliet in the bathroom had a really loud flush and the bath was quite shallow, however we never compained about this and the staff were so helpful I'm sure they would have moved us if we had. Overall a fantastic deal and lovely hotel. Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “One of My Favorite Hotels Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Knox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seaport in April, 2007 and I've been trying to get back ever since. This was a great hotel- spacious rooms, extremely professional and courteous staff and awesome amenities. The only drawback (and this may actually be a benefit to some folks) is that its a little remote from downtown. That said, we walked from the Seaport to everywhere from the Old North Church to the Market to the Common, so it's not COMPLETELY remote. Additionally, the train can be picked up just a few yards from the Seaport's front doors. My business was at the World Trade Center, which was literally just across the street. I truly loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: The Seaport is a nice hotel, outside of downtown and at a good distance of the airport. The rooms are nice and clean, the bed was good, but you could hear the A/C unit and airflow thru the pipes at night. When you spend more than two days the breakfast becomes boring (and is quite expensive for what you get). The room rate looked quite OK, but ended up with +USD25/day due to various taxes and service charges...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: PJackkand
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Seaport Hotel - for a romantic night out - from start to finish simply an amazing experience! Food was awesome in the Hotel Restaurant. Drinks were served/refilled fast and awesome bartending staff were amazing!! Lobby attendants were amazing. Room was very roomy and awesome view!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Crunk75
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 night stay at the Seaport Hotel, and I must say, this place is great for business travelers. They have FREE wireless internet and the rooms are designed with a spacious desk so you can do your work. There is also a refrigerator, which is nice to have. The bed was comfortable, the room was modern and clean, the restaurants were good, the staff was nice. It is also right across the street from a great deli and the Silver Line. Convenient to go to the airport, or anywhere on the train. It was just a great experience. You will not be disappointed if you stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Seaport”
Reviews.Author: fredricafun
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I did a long weekend here, and really loved the place. It's a nice location, although I think we would like to come back during warmer weather so we can really enjoy the waterfront. Everything was nice, the rooms were well kept and the on site restaurant (Aurora?) was excellent. Overall a good little local escape, and I would recommend it... but again, maybe over the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Fitness Center and Pool/Spa Area”
Reviews.Author: BostonFoodie73
Reviews.Content: We ate lunch at the Tamo bar and quality, atmosphere and service were excellent. My husband and I were pleasantly surprised with the fitness facility and pool/spa amenities- very well done! We will definitely come back to the Seaport!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Kids”
Reviews.Author: sevanddee
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Valentines day. We had our two children 4 and 6 with us. The package included 4 passes to the Children's Museum. This hotel was perfect for us. Great pool, lots of families and a nice setting. We had dinner at Aura and it was fantastic. There were lots of couples and lots of families and everyone seemed to be having a great time!! I know we did. The service was excellent and the food great. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Mini Vaca!”
Reviews.Author: PrittyPeepers
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Seaport Hotel for valentines day. We got the presidents king room, which was very nice. King sized bed, mini fridge, nice view of the city and the water, hotel robes were comfortable, hotel staff friendly and accomodating. Best mini vacation in a long time. Definitely recommend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Great quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: Archaea
Reviews.Content: We decided to make an impromptu trip to Boston and found a great rate for the Seaport Hotel on Hotels.com. We live 2 hrs from Boston and like to go for a good dinner and visit museums with our two daughters (4 & 7). Although the Seaport isnâ€™t necessarily in the center of all the action we like its location because it is very easy to get to from I-90, easy parking, great views of the city and harbor, and easy access to the T silver line. We had requested a room with 2 queen beds but were surprised to find out the front desk attendant upgraded us to an executive suite. This hotel has great, friendly service; at check-in they had a toy chest full of things for our daughters to choose from â€“ thatâ€™s all it took to win them over. It was a very nice room with 2 flat screen TVs, a nice seating area, desk with a computer with complementary web access, and king bed in a bedroom. The kids enjoyed swimming in the pool, while my wife and I took turns working out in the complementary gym. For us the gym is one of the highlights of this hotel it is very large, well maintained and has more equipment than our gym back home. Unfortunately the hotel restaurant was closed the night we were there but we walked a block away to LTK for an excellent dinner. Overall we had a great experience and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seaport, but location could be an issue”
Reviews.Author: solomentehawaii
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to Boston for a conference. This was only our second trip away from our kids in 6 years. In shopping for a hotel, I was shocked at the rates in the area over the Columbus Day holiday. Simple 4 Star hotels seemed to be in the $350 range....which to me translates to the Grand Wailea in Maui...why would I pay that in Boston...okay so not a big city traveler. Anyways, I went with priceline and got this for $175/night. We bought the Charlie card that is $15 for a week of subway/bus use...what a steal! We took the silverline bus to the hotel, which was as easy as riding a hotel shuttle. We arrived at the hotel at 730AM and the front desk clerk advised she could offer me a room then, even though check in wasn't til 3pm, or we could wait to get the king sized bed we had requested. We decided to wait. At 1030AM she called and had given us a king size bed with a beautiful view of the seaport. The bed was great. The room had nice bath products, a cool flat screen that could be turned, the ability to print from our laptop in the room to the business center down stairs, and in room bath robes(I love that). For tourists, there isn't a lot outside the front door (dunkin donuts and 7 eleven) but it is a clean industrial/commericial area. There is a bus stop across the street and that was our link to the city. We were about a 10 min ride to downtown on this underground bus, and again we only paid $15 for the entire trip for unlimited Subway use. Of note, our favourite restaurant of the trip, Yankee Lobster is about 2 blocks away. The twin lobster dinner with coleslaw, corn, and two lobsters was only $23 and was great. The lobster roll was pretty good, too. I definately recommend Yankee Lobster. We went to Park 9 and others, but this was our favourite. The main drawback of this hotel is that is isn't in the heart of the tourist attracttions. If that is essential for you, then perhaps you should look elsewhere. We walked to Quincy Market once, but it took a good 20min, so we opted to take the subway day and night. The service, amenities, cleanliness, and comfort of this hotel were great. I would easily return here. We were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a health club that does things differently”
Reviews.Author: Grumpier_mike
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport when I couldn't get a room at a different hotel. The rooms were nice and the staff were friendly. However, I was pleasently surprised by some of the other aspects of my stay. The first thing I noticed is that this hotel has a somewhat "green" attitude. You can recycle your newspaper and other misc stuff. I appreciated this because most hotels tend to be very wasteful. The hotel also discourages tipping. This is a little strange and I left a tip for housekeeping anyway, but I would guess that they must do a reasonable job of compensating their staff. OK, all the other stuff is nice, but the best thing about this hotel is the health club. It has free weights, cardio machines, weight machines, spin classes and a lap pool. The health club is not huge, but it is fantastic by hotel/resort standards. All this was included in the price. No better way to burn off some stress and some of the calories from work-related travel! If I had to give an overall summary, I would say that people who are really interested in "luxury" might find this hotel only adequate. I really appreciated some of the characteristics that make this hotel different.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Boston !”
Reviews.Author: mac099
Reviews.Content: Great Stay! Upgraded! Wow! First time I've ever been upgraded in any hotel ever. It was Thanksgiving and were not that busy but whatever. Went from a regular room to a small suite with two rooms and Ocean view. Kids liked watching the big ships go by. Two Tv's and no Sponge Bob for adults. Great stay, easy access to the rest of Boston. Don't listen to the people complaining about parking costs - it's Boston and it's like that everywhere. I've stayed in alot of hotels in Boston and this is one of the nicer ones. Thanks - Seaport !

Reviews.Title: “They gouge you for parking”
Reviews.Author: gouged
Reviews.Content: Stayed over one night for a wedding. The accomodations were lovely, but I was shocked to discover that they charged us thirty-nine dollars for parking in the hotel's garage. I've stayed at many a hotel in many a large city and have never been charged close to that amount for parking in the hotel's garage Attempting to gouge its customers rates it two stars in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Okay conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidwestLiketoTravel
Reviews.Content: The potential of Seaport Hotel is great, but unrealized. First, it is unlikely you will part anywhere near the correct place if you self-park -- very confusing. Front desk staff is friendly enough. Rooms were adequate and fairly new. Not much in the area within walking distance besides Convention Center and other hotels. Oddly designed in that the gym/pool are located on the same floor as the convention space. We didn't comfortable in our athletic/swim attire with a Marketing Sherpa show in front of us. Could have been worse, absolutely. But I guess we just expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, clean, hotel w/ luxurious beds”
Reviews.Author: TXglobetrotter_09
Reviews.Content: Pros: I love this hotel. It is new, fresh, clean and amazingly luxurious beds. I had a side view, but could see the bay. Great service. Cons: Not downtown, but the WorldTrade Center Train station is just across the street and a 10 minute ride to major sites. Parking is high, but I recommend using the T and getting a Charlie card for the week ($15).

Reviews.Title: “Fine,but...”
Reviews.Author: f2s
Reviews.Content: Partner wanted to stay near Conference Center. Seaport has competition at various price points,Boston Harbour,Marriott Long Warf,InterContinental,Renaisance,Westin Waterfront. Plus the airport hotels are close enough , and you can use the water taxi. Seaport does nothing bad nor very good.Our 8 nights were rather dull.Endless event meetings going on. Its a no tipping hotel,but,18% service,5% tax,and 3$ room service charge later you wonder whats the point. Hated breakfast , coffee shop closes at 5.30 pm . Few shops or restaurants in the area. The gripe is in room noise.Thin walls , vacuum WC noise , and door slammers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stixy386
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great... we booked a room through Priceline for only $180 a night. So for that price we received a great room with a view, king size bed and a decent size bathroom. The one downside with this hotel is the location, if you're looking to do touristy things I would stay in the heart of the city more. But it was a great hotel to stay in for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: AnaesDoc
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel. Rooms spacious and well-appointed. I'm beginning to think that a great hotel can be determined by whether or not a full (non-collapsible) umbrella is in each room. The Seaport of course provides this and much more. The free WiFi is appreciated. Only downside is location. I was there for a conference, so it was well situated for those purposes, but it does take 20 minutes to walk downtown (and I walk pretty quickly). I would stay here again, especially if for another conference at the Seaport WTC.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel a little way outside the main downtown area”
Reviews.Author: Spont
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Boston where we stayed at the Seaport Hotel. Transfer from the airport could not have been easier. A bus just outside the main exit passes the hotel and we were actually in our room about 20 minutes after boarding. There is a 'T' station just by the hotel too on the Silver Line which provides a link between the airport and Boston's South Station. We found we could actually walk to the Boston Aquarium/Quincy Market area in about 20 minutes and to Boston Common in a few minutes longer. The hotel itself is about 10 years old and is well appointed. There is a pool/fitness centre and the room we had was very nice with a view of Boston Harbour and the airport on the other side. We didn't hear any noise. The breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant was well worth having. Set us up for the day. The hotel is all-inclusive and there is no need to tip any member of staff. In fact, there are notices asking that you don't. One of the waiters in the restaurant actually pointed out that we shouldn't tip him as service was included in the bill. In a few years time, I expect this hotel to be better placed for local attractions as the adjacent World Trade Center attracts more visitors. If you don't mind a short walk to the Downtown area or a trip on the 'T' (costing just $2 if you'd rather ride) then I think you will find this hotel a good bargain. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love Seaport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msbrutus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel the weekend of July 4th for a wedding. Seaport Hotel has beat all my expectations and I have stayed in hotels/resorts in Florida, NY/NJ, NC and California. Seaport definitely beat them all. The customer service was exceptional. The people that worked their greeted us warmly. They were available to us to help even when we didn't realize we needed help :) without being overbearing. The food at the restaurant downstairs was fabulous, we had a family breakfast buffet one morning and and some friends and I had breakfast the next morning. The food tasted great, was fresh and the price was excellent. The facilities was spotless. The view from our room was gorgeous. For the day of the wedding the wedding coordinator was available to us and so helpful and kind. They provided steamers and help with them when we needed. I was very impressed. This is the first review I've ever written for a hotel and I highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Jiddydodge
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent addition to my business travel. I would not hesitate to reccomend the Seaport to anyone. The staff was courteous, consciencious, and professional. The room was very nice, and I loved the free WiFi available in the room, not just the lobby. Their business services for printing really helped through my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but, too pricey.”
Reviews.Author: FastPass
Reviews.Content: It's a little pricey. Although, very comfortable and well run. My daily rate was $299 (it really feels like a $199 - $225 hotel). And, I had to extend one night and they upped the rate to $399. The one glitch was that there was a Bose clock radio in the room and it didn't work. The same thing happened for a business associate staying in another room. All-in-all - I'd stay there again, but not at that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Seaport Hotel - OVERRATED”
Reviews.Author: travelingmind
Reviews.Content: The overall visit and experience was terrible from the start. Valet parking wouldn't let us park had to find parking lot and then spoke to other people attending same event and half got to valet and half had to park themselves in a garage that is part of the hotel but you still are reguired to pay for even if your staying overnight at the hotel. Checking in was a nightmare. Waited 20 minutes to check in. Rooms air conditioner unit was not working. Staff was not helpful in giving us directions to function rooms and the food at the event (wedding) was Horrible.. I wrote letter to let the G.M. know about our stay and he wrote back that no one else has complained and he would investigate it. I don't care if no one else complained and I didn't ask for an investigation, I thought he would care to know about how is hotel looked to paying customers. No wonder the hotel was awful if that is how the G.M. is rude.

Reviews.Title: “Seaport fun”
Reviews.Author: Javisdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seaport for four days. The hotel was beautiful and we were immediately upgraded to a suite. Our room had a flat screen and a computer - how great! The staff were friendly but not outgoing, you had to really approach them. The location was a bit far from other hotels, but within walking distance of the Children's Museum and the Aquarium. We took the water taxi and it was awesome. I don't know about the food there, we found the dining in the hotel to be overpriced and too upscale but there were several options within a block. We loved our stay at the hotel and had no problems. it was really fun. On checkin our kids were allowed to chose a toy from a treasure chest. They loved that! We would go again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Seaport”
Reviews.Author: Delmonico
Reviews.Content: I was at first very excited about my stay at the Seaport Hotel, hoping it would be excellent. My first problem was stained sheets. I told my husband they looked as if they had been laundered, but the BROWN stain made me have doubts. The plug in the tub did not work properly, so no bubble bath. The AC in the room did not work well. Although the temperature read as if it were ok, it was very hot and I had trouble sleeping. This discussion came up from another person that I met while at a seminar there. They said the same thing about their room and suggested that I turn the fan on to run all night. This did help. The next night, I ordered a bottle of wine through room service. The cost was to be $28 plus taxes and delivery fee. I was charged $45. I called room service to go over the problem and got no resolution. I had to take the bottle downstairs along with the price list that was in the room. I did get partial credit but not a full credit. WHY? Is it really that hard to calculate? Charge what you post and don't false advertise. I called twice before arriving to double check that the room charge would be put on the corporate card and was told both times, yes, it would. Didn't happen, I had to use my personal card and get reimbursed from my company. The only thing that I enjoyed about my stay was the food. The food was excellent and maybe the best breakfast I ever had in my life. I will say that I did request that maintenance fix the plug in the tub. They did, and I was able to take a bath my second night there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swimkat
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for a meeting and decided to try something different from the usual big chains (Marriott, Westin, etc.), and were very pleasantly surprised by the Seaport. Great service, very comfortable beds, quiet, easy access to the convention center by a walkway, and just down the block from a terrific restaurant called Salvatore's. The T is just outside the hotel, making travel into the city very easy. We really appreciated the in-room fridge; exercise room and pool were really nice but didn't allow kids<16 (a real bummer since our daughter is an athlete and was counting on continuing her training during the vacation). Minor downsides: in-room coffee was awful, telephone receptionists were less than enthusiastic.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: karbon69
Reviews.Content: Due to United Airlines' ineptitude (delays from Chicago to Boston), I missed a flight overseas from Boston and had to spend the night in Boston. The Travellers Aid desk at Logan Airport found a room for me for the night at the Seaport Hotel. It was a little more than I had hoped to pay, but due to the basketball tournament and conventions in town, I was happy to have a room. The Seaport is probably not a place I would have chosen on my own, but I liked it. I can't say enough about the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff - everyone from front desk to housekeeping. They were very accommodating to me when I was quite upset about missing the flight and gave me pointers on where to go, where to buy things, etc. They also let me check out late because I didn't get to the hotel until nearly midnight, which I thought was nice. My room was very comfortable. The bed was heavenly. There was a fridge and the air conditioner worked well. The bathroom was nice and I liked the complimentary bath products. The coffeeshop downstairs was great. I liked the location - walking distance to downtown, near a "T" stop, with some restaurants and stores in the area. My only major complaints were that the hotel design and interior is kind of "sterile", and also my room was next to an elevator shaft which was quite noisy. All in all, however, I had a good stay at the Seaport and want to thank them for their service with a smile when I was probably a somewhat crabby individual after missing my flight. Also I had a good time exploring Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, well priced”
Reviews.Author: architect99
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel for a conference and was very impressed. Nice rooms, good food throughout the conference and receptions, and a very nice health club. The club is actually a real fitness club with weights, cardio, an indoor pool, and locker room/steam room. It can get crowded in the morning when the non-guest members are there. The whole place was spotlessly clean, which is more than I can say for my club at home. The only slight drawback to the place is its location, as the hotel is located in a new development area so there are some unattractive parking lots around but over all it felt very safe. It is about a 20 min walk to Boston Common, but it is a pleasant walk in nice weather. Heading away from downtown toward the beach are some nice areas to jog. The staff were all gracious and friendly and the no tipping policy is nice. If the weather is good, and your not in a hurry, take the water taxi to/from Logan for a great view of the city. The drop off is right across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conferences, airport accessibility”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here to attend a conference at the trade center next door. The main attraction of this hotel is that it is connected to the center via a sky bridge, it's also about 10 minutes from the airport by cab or water taxi. There are several nice restaurants within walking distance including the Legal Test Kitchen which we hit for drinks/appetizers one night. The hotel is your basic 4 star business hotel. The beds were comfy, there was a good selection of TV channels, and the staff was nice and helpful. The lack of an in-room mini-bar was surprising. Wireless Internet access was superb, though cost $10 a day through T-Mobile. On the downside, there is a lot of construction in the lobby as they conduct renovations to the main restaurant. The health club isn't just for hotel guests but rather is a public fitness center. It's small and crowded, but well equipped. When I went down at 7:00 AM to work out, every aerobic machine was in use. They also charge $2.00 for a bottle of water. The pool looked nice, and they have fitness classes and personal instructors available. I'd stay here again for an event at the hotel or the trade center, but not for any other reason.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: nemdog
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 1/2 yr old daughter and I stayed at the Seaport the weekend prior to the Boston Marathon. The Hotel is is fair amount away from the main downtown area, and not really walking distance to very much. We knew that going in, as our plan was to go the Children's Museum and the Aquarium which were both relatively close. For our purposes, the hotel was in perfect location, but for someone looking for more of a touristy trip, I would advise against that location. The hotel itself was very nice looking, with a very friendly and helpful staff. The room was nothing more than average, and we had a great deal of trouble obtaining a comfortable room temperature. It was also quite pricey, but that may have been due to it being a busy weekend because of the marathon. I would only stay there again if we were doing the same trip to the museum and aquarium, but would still look into a less expensive alternative in the area. Also, be prepared to pay an arm and a leg for parking. We paid $29 for one night in the hotel garage, $24 for a couple hours at the Prudential Building lot, and a whopping $39 for 3 hours in the garage next to the Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Want to Leave”
Reviews.Author: MayorMcCheese
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend and did not want to leave! The hotel had all the little amenities that you could possibly want. The Seaport had a computer and free internet in the room. The computer was linked to the hotel in that you could request room service or valet parking from the computer. It had free local and long distance telephone calls. There was a doorbell outside your door and an electronic "do not disturb" and "make up room" button. The hotel had an extensive array of Gilchrist & Soames bath products, including bath salts, which you do not normally see in guest rooms. The room itself was very clean and even had a recycling wastebasket, which I thought was a great idea. The view of the seaport from our room was amazing. The staff was very friendly and does not accept tips at all, which is great. You can come and go as you please in valet parking and the staff was very nice, even when we lost our ticket. There were restaurants nearby and the location was great for sightseeing. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “A Little High In Price But Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: Lapensee
Reviews.Content: Although this is an all inclusive hotel for service (tipping!), the staff from the chambermaid, hotel clerks, to management were outstanding - took pride in their work - refreshing to see this level of service in this day and age. To all the employees at the Seaport Hotel - just outstanding - keep up the great work!!!

Reviews.Title: “NiceHotel”
Reviews.Author: lcjones18
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston to attend a conference. Seaport was only a short walk to the Boston Conference Center. The room was small but nice and clean. The staff was helpful but not really friendly. They weren't rude but not very enthuastic. The bellhops were the only ones who were friendly. The restaurant is expensive and I didn't care for the menu selections. But there are some restaurants that are within walking distance. The hotel is not located in an area where there are attractions. But you can catch a bus that will drop you off at Fanuil Hall. I also caught a tour bus that picks up in front of the hotel. The T is also across the street. The plumbing is quite loud but it didn't bother me. The wireless internet is a nice amenity. I enjoyed my stay and would visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “ok, I have stayed at better hotels”
Reviews.Author: marcat82073
Reviews.Content: I was there for a convention at the World Trade Center. Hotel was doing some renovations to the public areas. Front desk staff was not very knowledgeable about the hours of restaurant. When I made my reservation I asked it they had smoking rooms available, the reservationist said they did. Get there I am forced to intial the registration card stating the $150.00 fee for smoking. Had I been told the truth when I made my reservation I would have stayed at another hotel. Room was very small, not very clean. There was toothpaste spit on the mirror in the bathroom. The bedspread had an overwhelming smell of cheap perfume, asked for a clean one never got it. $29.00 per day for parking, you would think hotels guests would get a cheaper rate for parking. Behind the hotel is a lot for $11.00 per day. I do not think I will ever stay at thishotel again nor will I reccomend it to anyone. Bythe way this is a NO TIP facility, so no wonder the staff do not go out of thier way to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Wine Expo”
Reviews.Author: DrMetzler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights for the Wine Expo and this is the spot to stay for that event! We had views of the harbor anf the Pru my only complaint is that I don't care for innerspring matresses so I did not find the beds all that comfortable. But I am spoiled as I have a Natures rest latex core bed at home. Othwerwise the room was clean and comfortable. Room service was excellent and the staff simply awesome! I left my cord for my laptop there and I did not discover it until I got home. I was panicked as I needed to write a review of the Expo.I called the hotel who immediately retrieved it and mailed it back to me! No worries! Now that's service! Staff is wonderful. And there is no tipping. Really, they don't just say it. they mean it! They make you feel comfortable about it. So the cost of the hotel winds up being reasonable and a bargain for Boston. As for location the "T" is right there and you can get anywhere for about $10-12 for a cab. I went to the North end for dinner and to The Hungry I for less than ten dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Conference Stay”
Reviews.Author: packthebagsBoston
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Seaport. Previously stayed there in 2006. Check in/out - Both the desk attendant for checking in and the one for checking out talked as quickly as possible, almost like a rehearsed speech (I live in the area, so I thought I talked fast, but WOW, they are speed demons). Both in and out, there wasn't anyone else waiting, so there was no need to rush. I wasn't asked if I needed anything checking in, nor was I asked how my stay was checking out. Very cold. Conceirge was great! Very friendly and chatty! Told us about some things in the area. Also told us that there is a free shuttle running every 10 minutes from the hotel to downtown Quincy Market! We used it and it was great. Very nice drivers. The hotel was under construction in the lobby, making the bar area tiny and very noisy. We didn't know about this until we checked in and saw it. No mention of this to us by the hotel desk clerk at check in. No compensation, such as a reduced drink at the reduced bar, or anything. Extension cords running through exterior doors, plastic hanging down in the lobby bar, smells, drills, saws and noise. Room was small but nice. Very clean. Only a few (maybe 8) channels on the tv!! As there is really nothing to do in the area at night, this was a surprise! Beds comfortable. As other reviewers mentioned, you could hear every toilet flush in the other rooms. As long as you wanted to be up at 6:30, when you can hear everyone's showers starting, and be awake about 10 PM to hear them all flushing their toilets as they go to bed, you'll be OK. Breakfast buffet was just OK. Very expensive. Ate a lunch and dinner at Morton's Steakhouse across the street. Also tried LTK down the street. Both were good alternatives for the restaurant in the hotel. Easy walk to the convention center. In fact we had a lovely view of the Convention center, the MBTA Silver Line station and its parking lot from our hotel room. Wireless internet worked fine. Parking is $29 a night. Beware that the hotel adds a $3 'service charge' to your nightly rate, and then Boston adds a hotel tax, a convention tax, a local tax, and maybe another one I've forgotten, to your bill, so your nightly rate will end up being more than the original quoted room rate. Overall, it wasn't as good as our stay 2 years ago (service seems colder and restaurant not as good). It is a good alternative to the Westin for Convention stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a nice interior, but in an off-beat location not close to much!”
Reviews.Author: lip89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the Xmas season to attend a Xmas party at the world trade center across the street and was impressed at how nice this place was. It is fairly new and has many floors and is modern place to stay. It is located in a off-beat location of Boston though, that is just starting to be developed. It was fine to stay here if you are attending a convention (right near the convention center) or doing something at the World Trade Center. But if you are here to visit and take in the sites and sounds of Boston, this isn't the place to stay. It is not close to anything and is not on any major public transportation lines. It is in a weird area of the city which someday will be very nice and connected, but isn't right now. The price may be right (this place is still a bit pricey), but take it from me, it is not a place to walk out your door and be in downtown. You will have to catch a cab (lacking area for cabs) and have them take you to the hot spots in the city. I give this place high ratings for its rooms which are filled with everything you need, its lounge/bar area which is trendy and intimate and its service, but I cannot give it high ratings on its location. This part of the waterfront is not where you want to be!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay for the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Billnewjersey
Reviews.Content: Better than average for a "convention" hotel. Convenient to convention center (not connected, but an easy walk) and very convenient parking. Hotel restaurant was typically overpriced, but there are other options within walking distance. Of the 2 hotel options for the convention center, this is the better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Boston for the price”
Reviews.Author: jenifa16
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in every luxury hotel in Boston and this hotel really knocked our socks off. Prompt and friendly service and great food. Extremely clean rooms. The fitness center and lap pool were wonderful. We especially loved the casual atmosphere. Usually luxury hotels are stuffy. Not this one. Our only complaint was the location could be a little closer to Boston's attractions. However, for a fit couple like us, we enjoyed the walk to Fanuil and the other attractions. There are safe and interesting areas near the hotel to go for a run. Be prepared for the expensive parking and steep hotel taxes in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother reserving a a double or a king because you get a room only!!”
Reviews.Author: johnnybegood987
Reviews.Content: When I made the reservation for a nice weekend in Boston the nice lady on the phone asked me if I would like a king bed or two doubles in the room. I wanted two doubles and she ok'd me on that. When I arrived at the hotel to check in they told me that my room had a king bed, and I told them that I needed two doubles and that's what I had reserved. The lady replied that my reservation on secures me a room and not a certain type of room. Then why asked me on the phone which I would like to stay in? They gave me another room and when I got my things up to the room it was a king size bed and nothing else. I then had to call the front desk and ask what was going on. They said it was a mistake and someone would be up to give me new rooms keys. After switching rooms I was finally in the correct room for my stay. The whole thing took over an hour and I missed my dinner reservations for the night thanks to the Seaport. So if your just looking for a "room" to stay in then go the Seaport.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, but not like the website”
Reviews.Author: tinker88
Reviews.Content: the website lead us to believe that there are harbor views and a pool with music piped in underwater, neither of which were true, not exactly, I could see water from the window when straining to see out sideways. Good location, close to everything, staff courteous, clean and comfortable. They were under construction and failed to tell us this when booking, so not everything was in tgood shape.

Reviews.Title: “what a view”
Reviews.Author: so_NHMosie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Seaport the last weekend in Dec. Luckily, it was a warm, sunny weekend so we were able to fully enjoy the location. Upon checking in and having no view we requested an upgrade and were given a corner room that had great views. The hotel was an easy walk to Fan Hall area, has several restaurants near by and a nice coffee shop on the property. We did take out for a late afternoon snack and sat in front of our windows ejoying the view while dining in the room. Staff was very couteous. If you stay here slpuge for a room with a water view, it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fild77
Reviews.Content: Very nice updates to the room with PC's and included Internet Service. Outstanding view of the harbor and airport. Great Bar Staff and excellent Lobster Salad sandwich! One improvement Suggestion- Improve quality of room TV's to FlatScreen/High Def.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for conference centre”
Reviews.Author: bryony53
Reviews.Content: this was excellent for a conference. from the airport by silver shuttle (t transport ) the world trade stop was 10 minutes and was by the plaza entrance to the hotel .this was just 5 mins walk to the conference centre, so could return between meetings . service unobtrusive , clean , helpful and nothing missing. good pool , gym and leisure facilities . helpful when arranging car hire .

Reviews.Title: “Beware "The Boardroom"”
Reviews.Author: wtls
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport Hotel for a conference and, upon checking in, was given room #1616. When I got on the elevator I noticed that the 16th floor button also had a designation as "The Boardroom". Well, room #1616 is right next to "The Boardroom" which is nothing more than a meeting room. While my biggest concern was that #1616 was very close to the elevator and right across the hall from the ice service, it was the meeting room that gave me the biggest headache. There is a small service area used by the hotel staff to service the meeting room and service it they do. From the 10 PM vacuuming of The Boardroom, to the hotel folks in there even later with those wonderful two way cellular phones that signal "beep-beep" each time someone pages them. Of course they are back at work before 6 AM to prep the room for the day's use (When a group rents this room for their meeting they really get their monies worth!). The hotel was fully booked, so a replacement room was not an option. To put it short, the granite counters in the bathroom, high end toiletries, high quality bedding and Bose radio could not overcome the banging, dropped dish, vacuuming and other full-time noise coming from the service room next door. If you choose to stay at this hotel be careful not to be above, below, or on either side of â€œThe Boardroomâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for my WTC Conference”
Reviews.Author: jjinrtp
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was excellent for my meeting in the CityView Ballroom in the WTC across the street. But transportation is very easy to this hotel with the MBTA Silverline WTC stop being right across the street and only a couple stops from the airport. The room was not lavish but was clean and well appointed with free wireless (something many Boston hotels nickel and dime you for). I also had dinner in the restaurant and was very pleased with the Tuna and Langostine dinner I had. The price is better than most I found on Orbitz and the location was perfect for me but I honestly will stay there again because of the ease to the SilverLine through the hotels Plaza level. I hope this helps you.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: momx3ls
Reviews.Content: Me and my 3 children went to Halloweentown at World Trade Center and stayed over night at the hotel. Its a beautiful hotel and the people are very helpful. The kids and I enjoyed the indoor pool alot, it was very nice and relaxing. The room was good size and the beds were extremely comfortable, we hated to come home and sleep in our own. And the view was great too.. It was a very easy trip from South Station and about a $7 taxi ride to Fanuial Hall.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Andy99
Reviews.Content: No complaints. Good size room, clean and functional. The hotel is at the Trade Center, so there's a walk or cab to the city center, but if you are attending a convention it is very convenient. All inclusive policy, so no need to tip, hopefully the staff are adequately compensated. There's one issue if you are a light sleeper, the plumbing is very noisy. I thought it was just my room, but this was noted by more than one person staying.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Plumbing”
Reviews.Author: VIKINGMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice. However, the flushing toilets everywhere were annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: swan325
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is not in the "center" of things it is directly across the street from the T on the Silver Line and we had no trouble navigating around (plus it's the first stop out of Logan). The room was spotless, beds were great and our late night dinner in the bar was reasonable, plentiful and delicious. We stayed just one night so didn't try the main resturant but the menu was impressive. We didn't drag laptop on vacation but hotel has three free computers in the lobby and we had access to the 24 hour business center computers and printers to print out our boarding passes. Concierge was helpful with suggestions and directions for our one day whirlwind sightseeing in Boston. They offered a late check out but we were content with bellman holding our bags all day on our departure day. It's expensive but every decent hotel in Boston is and this was cheaper than the more recognizable names.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel --location ?????”
Reviews.Author: JerryDEBO
Reviews.Content: This is an a outstanding hotel. Everything is Deluxe quality. We were here for a wedding- the catering and set up was wonderful. But this is not a place for tourists - it is not near any Boston sights- given the problem in driving around Boston and the parking fees -you have to take a taxi - note the parking fee at the hotel is $29 or $37 for valet per nite. We took a look at the Marriott and that looks seedy.

Reviews.Title: “They don't guarantee the room type”
Reviews.Author: Tanurami
Reviews.Content: I had asked for a room with a king-size bed and had reserved it. Upon arrival, they told me that only queen size beds are available and they dont guarantee availability even if you reserve in advance. I would have chosen a different hotel had i known this before.

Reviews.Title: “Seaport Hotel Rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff2086
Reviews.Content: As always, the Seaport Hotel did not disappoint. I was in town early in the morning for a meeting and they offered me an 8:30am check-in to my room, talk about good service!!! Not only did I get an early check-in, but I did not have to ask for it. The Room is 4-5 star quality, bed is of top notch comfort and the high end breakfast at the Auro Rest. is a must visit, expensive but the food is all-star - not the usual breakfast buffett! High recommend this hotel, everything about it is great!!

Reviews.Title: “Seaport # 1”
Reviews.Author: DeanBoston
Reviews.Content: Attended a wedding here and i am a local Bostonian so I can speak from first hand knowledge. The Seaport is first class and the customer service is outstanding. The wedding staff and servers were the best of all, always attentive but not overbearing! hope the management appreciates them, especially David. Rooms are very good, loved the view of the waterfront. Customer service started at the door and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Good oasis.”
Reviews.Author: DorchesterBobby
Reviews.Content: We are Bostonians who sadly have to work elsehwhere . We found this to be a well situated hotel in an interesting area of the city. Thanks to the ease of its shuttle other central areas of Boston proper are easily accessible. The hotel was pleasing, very clean, excellent rooms. The breakfasts are a bit pricey but there are other eating establishments withing walking distancea and are worth seeking out . No complaints and we would come here again. Beautiful spot inthe summer and most likely interesting in the Winter season. Go without fear but bring your own hardboiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seaport Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kristeng03
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful! Not only was the service above-and-beyond the other three hotels that I had stayed at that same week, but it was very clean and the ammenities were beautiful! I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the family”
Reviews.Author: famoffive2007
Reviews.Content: Saw the boats on the harbor, had lunch on the waterfront and came back to the hotel for a nice family swim. Room service featured banana splits for the kids. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Escape!”
Reviews.Author: pdaddy70
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a getaway from the kids and absolutely loved our experience. The room was beautifully appointed and spacious. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We enjoyed using the fitness center and the proximity to the waterfront. As the seaport district continues to grow, this hotel will become a must for visitors to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near the convention center”
Reviews.Author: dkseattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention and found the hotel to be very nice, with all the basic amenities that you would want. View and location is nice, very close and convenient to the airport and a 5 minute walk away from the convention center. Not a ton to do around the hotel, but being close to the water is definitely a plus. 24 hr room service was of good quality with huge portion sizes. Staff was polite and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: bethz117
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on the waterfront. Great views of the city. Light , tasty and affordable meals at the downstairs tavern area and cafe. Loved the in-room computer, the plush bathrobes provided, and the gratuity-inclusive service. Very nice pool and exercise area. Near public transportation and all Boston attactions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and view....”
Reviews.Author: GloriaNelsonCSEP
Reviews.Content: As a speaker with a meeting/event academy and exhibition, the planner who books sites and accommodations had sited and selected this property for the speakers hotel stays. While there were industry posts regarding the noise level in the hotel, I was on the 16th floor facing the south and waterfront overlooking Boston Harbor and the Seaport Trade Center and some of the docks. The view from the room was beautiful, well appointed and had many surprise amenities such as single pod coffee makers that could brew Euro-style coffee or a traditional 8 oz. serving. There was even a scale in the bathroom! The room was beautifully appointed with soothing decor, a very comfortable bed, complimentary wireless internet (and ethernet cords for wired laptops) along with television and a lovely Bose Wave Radio. Walking in upon check-in, the radio was playing and when they came in for turn-down service....it was turned on again. I loved the bathroom with the curved shower rod, meaning I didn't have to fight the clinging curtain from the traditional rod configuration. The "Green Concept" was also something that gave a good feeling over stewardship from water consumption, use of towels/linens and each room was also equipped with recycling bins with splits in the waste basket. They're also a LEEDS hotel so they're most energy efficient. While there have been posts about the noise level in this hotel, I didn't experience any interference from rooms adjacent, or noise from the hallway. Hotel staff was also very accommodating, friendly and guest centric with their attentiveness. I didn't dine at the hotel or avail room service...but I did note the lobby bar was very busy and quite animated with patrons. I learned that during the summer, there are concerts just a couple blocks away that not only draw crowds before and after, but many times, the hotel is utilized by talent and road crews on production. The convenient location to the airport was a swift 15 minute ride to and from the Boston Logan Airport. Cabs are also plentiful and can pickup from the street level, or from the 3rd level that spills out on the walkways for both the convention and trade centers. We took a day trip on arrival to the JFK Library, only a 20-25 minute cab ride and then walked two blocks to a wonderful seafood restaurant that was FABULOUS, recommended to our group of meeting planning professionals that was "right on". I have very acute hearing....so it was a pleasant and wonderful night's rest...and you gotta love the lamps in the bedrooms that have dimmers on them.....and the night light in the bathroom was also a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days as part of a convention group. This is a new, modern hotel which was clean, had great views of Boston Harbor, and spacious comfortable rooms. The front desk and concierge were always helpful and available. The lobby coffee bar had reasonably priced tasty offerings for a quick lunch or breakfast. The wireless internet connection in the room ran at blazing speed. The location is perfect for those who want to walk to the convention center, but there is very little going on around the hotel on the weekends. However, the hotel is literally next door to the MBTA station making visits to all of the sights very convenient (it's on the silver line, and the South Street transportation hub is just 2 stops away), and it is just two MBTA stops away from the airport, making it very convenient for air travelers. Because it is amid office buildings, in the evenings the hotel surroundings are very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst!”
Reviews.Author: whalewatcher61
Reviews.Content: 1. Stayed 4 nights for a conference earlier this month. I initially booked the room directly via phone over 2months prior to the conference and was told I would recieve the conference price. I recieved a confirmation from the hotel verifying this, and when I checked in I was told the price of the room was > $100.00 more for each night. Upon questioning this, I was told that there were a limited number of rooms reserved at that price, they didn't know what happened, but that, oh well, sorry, no more rooms at the discounted price available. Having never been to Boston and not know the area at all, I felt stuck, so I stayed. 2. The rooms was small and very, very noisy. The walls are paper thin and you can hear a lot of noise, especially from the bathrooms. 3. The last night of our stay, there was some sort of Fire in the hotel and the alarm system came on, annouced the situation, and instructed us to wait for further instructions. The message kept playing, but we recieved no instructions. I kept looking out our 10th floor window at the fire trucks below and the growing number of people gathering on the sidewalk. Upon trying to get information from the front desk, I was told that no one could talk to me about the situation. VERY UN-NERVING. After 20min of getting no where, we left the room and walked down 10 flights of stairs, met other guests who reported the same sense of uneasiness, not being able to get any information. When we reached the Lobby, my husband was again told that no one could talk to him. There seemed to be a lot of confusion. We sat on the sidewalk for over an hour before we were finally let back in, and were never told anything about the incident. When we checked out the next am, the desk clerk asked how our stay was, I mentioned the fire incident the night before and she just laughed, shrugged it off and said "oh, yeah, that". NO apologies for sitting outside for an hour at 1030 at night, nothing. I couldn't believe it. Will never stay there again, nor would I refer anyone to stay there. The staff and facility highly over-rate themselves.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dstinch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a wedding that was held at the hotel. We decided to come up a day early. The hotel staff was very pleasant and the "no tips" aspect was very nice. It is on the expensive side but we are talking downtown Boston. Compared to similar hotels, the price was about average. To see the sights it only takes 5 minutes to walk to the Institute of contempary arts, 15-20 minutes to Quincy Market, Rowes Wharf, 20-25 to the Aquarium. The T (subway) is across the street and very easy to go anywhere in the city. The room was very neat and though I agree that you can hear the neighbors shower and toilet, I did not find that to be all that disturbing but maybe it was because we had quiet neighbors. I found the bed to be very comfortable. The housekeeping staff was also very pleasant. The fitness center and pool areas are complimentary with the room and are of very nice quality. The gym staff were also very professional and helpful. The hotel had several wedding receptions going on at the same time but they did not intefere with ours. The reception we attended was in the Lighthouse hall. This is the newer room and had wonderful views. The only problem was that to go to the bathroom you needed to go down a steep outside staircase or take a small elevator. The food and service was very good at the reception. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. We went to school in Boston and enjoy coming to visit. We would stay here again for a special occasion but for general travel it is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hate this place”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisDino
Reviews.Content: this place absolutely sucks. The rooms are paper thin, you know who has gas next door, or when they have to get up and go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. What a disapointment for the very high $ they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Darlingbrit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding, booked 2 rooms next to each other as the price was reasonable and we had a little one with us, it worked beautifully! Service was excellent Just an overall great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: Long-Island-Voyager
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We had a room with 2 double beds - it was a little tight but by no means cramped. The room clean and all the furniture, mattresses, etc. were fairly new and comfortable. The bathroom as well was clean and everything worked properly. There was a table and chairs, a writing desk and adequate closet space and drawers. The mini bar was well stocked and there was a coffee machine in the bathroom (the coffee was pretty good too). An iron, ironing board and hair dryer are provided and there is a laundry service if you need it. High speed wireless internet service is complementary in every room. The business center has computers, printers and a business quality copy machine. The fitness center is well equipped. As other reviewers have stated, the staff was very gracious and accommodating. This is a "service" hotel and there is no tipping required, in fact, it's discouraged. (However, when we had a drink at the bar, they added a 15% gratuity to the check.) During the day, our floor was very noisy, there seemed to be a lot of activity coming from the housekeeping station so if you're the type who likes to take a mid-day nap, it could be a distraction. At night however, it was very quiet. One thing that we found disappointing was that there was no complementary breakfast - it may sound petty but I expected more from a $150 - $200 per night hotel. There is a restaurant on the premises and you can have breakfast there if you choose. There is also a small cafe where you can get coffee, pastries, cereal, etc. The hotel is not exactly near the center of town but you can walk there if you like walking. There is also a subway nearby (we found the subways very easy to navigate) and complementary shuttle service into town. (Every 15 minutes Mon - Fri 7am - 7pm via coach - on the weekends they provide a van but less frequently and only until 1:30pm.) There were always taxis parked outside as well. If you drive there and choose to park in the hotel's garage, you should know that at the time of this writing, the fee is $29 extra per night - we found this excessive and do not believe guests should be charged. Overall the experience was pleasant - the only reason that we would not choose to stay here again is due to the hotel's proximity to the center of town. If you are staying in Boston for more than a couple of days, getting into town can become a hassle but if you like being near the water we have no problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff But Thin Walls and Physical Problems”
Reviews.Author: GR_Traveling_Guy
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is outstanding -- both friendly and helpful. That includes the front desk, room service, and the wait staff. The room was immaculately clean, and the bed and bedding were very comfortable. This property has two detractions. First, the walls are thin. I could hear the TV in one adjacent room, the radio in the other adjacent room, and virtually whispered conversations in the hallway. In the morning, I could hear the fellow next door blow his nose and using the phone. Second, the physical condition of the property could benefit from attention. The wood edges of the furniture are wearing. One of the dresser drawers did not work. The curved shower curtain rod was hanging down from the wall, so that the curtain wanted to hang at the middle of the rod and not stay pulled to the ends. The sitting chairs are uncomfortable. I doubt that I would stay here again, but on the other hand I would not caution someone not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. I am not sure what people are all upset about on this site. You are unable to actually hear people going to the bathroom as one person stated. You can hear the pipes when someone flushes the toilet. There is a HUGE difference. This is not typical but I have heard it at other hotels as well. This hotel does have thin walls, but it was not horrible. The gym here is amazing. I would stay here again for the gym... fitness is very important to my daily routine. Its free and its amazing. The desk in the room is perfect for someone on business... the internet services is free and fast! This hotel is great... the room is starting to show some signs of age, but it is still great. I would suggest checking out LTK for dinner... its a block away and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: KayeBoston
Reviews.Content: I have visited Seaport Hotel on many occaisions for business lunches and meetings, and have always been impressed with the service and attentiveness of the staff. When I had to spend an overnight in Boston, I did not hesitate to make my reservation at Seaport. I was pleased, but not surprised, to discover that the impeccable service I had grown so fond of at the bar and the restaurant extended to the entire hotel. From the doorman to the concierge to the staff at the fitness center, everyone was genuine and courteous. And the gracious woman at the giftshop was nothing but pleasant after I unknowingly had her stay open an extra 10 minutes as I purchased a few items that I had forgotten. The fitness center was one of the nicest I have ever experienced and was a far cry from the 3-treadmill, outdated fitness centers I have seen at other hotels. And the locker room was just as impressive. I did not get to experience a spa-treatment, but it is certainly on my to-do list. Another thing that shouldn't go unnoticed is the hotel's committment to being environmentally conscious. This includes encouraging guests to recycle and providing them with the means to do so as well as giving the option to reuse towels and linens- which is a conservation measure that really adds up. The subject of the environment is important to me, and I was thrilled when I saw the hotel's dedication to the environment. Lasty the guests rooms were cozy and vibrant, and the views of the waterfront and the city could not be beat! All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Seaport, and recommend it to anyone who is planning on staying in Boston. And if you live in Boston, I suggest that you at least experience the hotel restaurant and bar or treat yourself to a facial!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But Thin Walls/Floors”
Reviews.Author: dorchesterdd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport Hotel/Boston over President's Day weekend. The hotel, while nicely appointed and comfortable, featured walls that weren't as insulated as I think they should be. I was sitting at the desk working on my laptop and was interrupted shall we say by the very clear sound of someone using the facilities either upstairs or next door. I heard everything, and I mean, EVERYTHING coming from the bathroom. The Seaport should have put more money into constructing the rooms with soundproofing, not only for the outside walls, but additionally for the inside ones as well. While I would recommend this hotel for a business traveler or tourists, they should be cautioned as to the noise that may eminate from the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: KaraSue
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Seaport several times over the last few years. I travel to Boston frequently, and the Seaport is one of the few hotels I've chosen to stay at more than once. While the hotel is a bit farther removed from the heart of the city, it's by no means out of the way, and the level of service more than makes up for a few extra blocks walking. The staff is extremely helpful and dedicated to making guests feel not just welcomed, but special. Especially notable given the all-inclusive, no tipping policy at the hotel. There's also appears to be a very low staff turnover rate, and it's been great to be welcomed by the same friendly faces each trip. It feels more like visiting an old friend than staying in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: N5girl
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed to have to write this review. I love this hotel and its service inclusive policy and so much of what it tries to achieve. Unfortunately on my last trip here a number of things left a bad taste in the mouth. Good points first of all - no tipping - the best hotel gym I have ever been in (and I have seen a lot) - free internet in the room - great food in the bar and friendly bar staff - good enviromental policy Bad points - our 4am alarm clock did not materialise meaning that we were almost late for our flight. - the taxi they called was 'jumped' by another taxi who then tried to con us by not turning on the meter. The bellhop placed our luggage in the 'wrong' taxi and we felt forced to go with the wrong one - he didn't seem to care that this taxi had appeared from nowhere. - there are no breakfast items on the in-room menu before 6am I suppose the big question is would I stay here again? The answer is an unequivocal 'yes' but I don't think of the hotel as fondly as I once did.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: offroadbiker
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the Seaport. A lot of little touches that make it great - the doorbells, with do not disturb feature, the gym was great and the room service was also very good but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the Westin”
Reviews.Author: lacontessa1
Reviews.Content: There are few options of nearby places to stay if you are attending a converence at the new Boston convention center. Although I did not stay at this hotel, I had friends staying at this hotel and spent a lot of time there while attending a conference this past week. If you are attending a conference at the new Boston convention center, would highly recommend staying here over the neighboring Westin hotel. It is just a short walk across an overpass to the convention center and much nicer and cheaper than the Westin. Service, food quality and options and the business services offered are much better than the Westin. Here are some specifics. While the Westin hotel charges their guests 20 cents a page to photocopy, the Seaport charges 10 cents. It cost $10 to print out a 6 page Word document at the Westin--at the Seaport, access to computers and printers was free for hotel guests in the business center. Also, a computer is set up in the lobby for free guest use (Westin charges 9.95 per day for wireless access in the rooms). Unlike the Westin hotel, guests were notified when overnight packages arrrived (at the Westin they charge for the privilege of picking up the packages and don't even let you know that they arrived). Although very large, the Westin hotel does not have sufficient capacity to serve food to its guests. Only one restaurant plus a Starbucks in the lobby at the Westin--at the Seaport there is a bar/lounge, restaurant and Starbucks. One night, I was told there was a 1.5 hour wait for Westin room service. When called back 1.5 hour later, was again told it would be 1.5 hours. When shared this story with a friend at the Seaport--she said that the wait was always a half hour or less for room service. Other Westin guests also complained about the food. One day, guests waited over half an hour to access the Westin lunch buffet even though there were empty tables (not have enough staff). In comparison to the Westin, service was warmer at the Seaport. To say "thank you" to the Seaport for their kind service while attending the conference, I ate as many of the meals that I could there. Food was also better at the Seaport (e.g., turkey sandwich at the Seaport was carved turkey instead of pressed turkey at the Westin). Cleaning could be better at the Westin although only about 6 months old--big stain on the carpet, a previous guest's old food was still in the minibar, and used glasses were put back where the clean ones should have been. To be fair, I did speak to the Westin manager about these problems before I left and she did offer $100 off my very expensive week stay. However, if I was returning to Boston for a conference, would book the Seaport.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Voyager100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights for a conference. The room was very newly done and comfortable. The staff was very helpful (when I returned once as my room was being cleaned, the maid gladly packed up and left, to come back when it was convenient for me). A nice touch is that the hotel is service inclusive and the staff seemed eager to please. The hotel has free wi-fi and is convenient to public transportation. The only drawback was that the air conditioning in the public areas was set very cold, but this may have been a side-effect of handling the extremely hot weather outside at the time. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Service”
Reviews.Author: Rags2006
Reviews.Content: The Seaport is in an excellent location for those attending conventions a/o meetings at the new convention center; it is a good location for many other other purposes, and, just a short walk away, it is the closest hotel to the Bank of America Pavillion, a performance venue. Parking, both self- and valet- are convenient, and rates, while not cheap, (this is Boston,) include in-and-out privileges. The Seaport has a highly-rated upscale restaurant, the Aura, and an early-morning to late afternoon "Bakery Cafe" snack bar, as well as 24 hour room service . Contrary to other reviews on this site, the Seaport is a short walk from eateries of various price, cuisine and formality levels, including the Barking Crab, Daily Catch, Anthony's Pier 4, Seaport Bar and Grill, Yankee Lobster Company, the brand-new, ultra-modern LTK, ("Legal Test Kitchen," of the Legal Fish Company empire,) the No-Name restaurant, a Chinese restaurant and the breakfast/lunch cafeteria of the Boston World Trade Center (weekdays only). A new Panini restaurant is about to open a block away. The just-opened (June, 2006,) Westin Convention Center hotel, with its facilities, is a short walk away, so the Seaport is not an isolated hotel. We occupied an attractive one-bedroom corner suite, #1001, with a partial harbor view, while attending a convention at the neighboring convention center.
