It was not large for a suite, but we were impressed by the attractive, and thoughtful layout and details which made it extremely practical AND comfortable, (which is a pleasure compared to so many "boutique" hotels which sacrifice practicality and comfort for stylishness). On request, the Seaport will empty your minibar so that you may use it for your own (refrigerated) storage. Rooms include many "mod cons" (e.g. a Bose Wave radio/CD player as the clock radio and a laptop-size complimentary electronic safe) and good communications options, including complimentary wired and wireless broadband, public spaces wireless-equipped, and public computers in the lobby. Thoughtful touches include free loaner LAN cables on the desk in the room. The hotel has a business center; if guests need, as I did, to print out documents, the "PrintMe" system allows printing from your room to a high-quality color printer in the Business Center, another complimentary service. (The center is open, by guest room-keys, 24 hours a day, and is staffed during the day.) Outstanding service, though, was the high point of our five-day stay. We were pleasantly surprised, in a completely non-tipping environment, at how eager, without being obsequious, every staff member we encountered seemed to be to serve us. Rooms are not cheap, as few are in Boston, but are comprable to other similarly situated hotels which may get you with add-ons like daily broadband access fees, and no free auto in-and-out. We thought the Seaport served our needs oustandingly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CRDO
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here while looking at various venues for our wedding. We read some unpleasant rewiews so we were skeptical and wanted to see for ourselves instead of experimenting on our guests. Granted, they knew why we were staying here and perhaps tried a little harder than usual, but we a very nice overnight stay here. I checked in with no problem, had a great room with a king bed and awesome view of the harbor and Logan. The bathroom was spacious and clean. I even had Chinese food leftovers from earlier that evening which Room Service reheated for me. My fiance had some wireless internet issues which he eventually figured out, but initially we called the front desk who said they would send someone up, but noone ever came. Overall, it was a great hotel and have no problem with my guests staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: tewks
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Seaport while in Boston on a business trip. The hotel is fine, but certainly not what it seems to think it is. The room was clean, a little above average in size, but had decor that seems outdated and nowhere very comfortable to sit. They advertise free wireless connections throughout the hotel, but this seems more of a myth than a reality. When I simply could not get connected and called the front desk they told me to get a cord out of the minibar (so, yes, you pay for it), as "most guests have the same problem and just find it easier to connect with the cord." One high point is that the Water Taxi from the airport does drop you off immediately across the street, and it is much quicker, more scenic and certainly less expensive ($17 round trip) than a standard taxi. The Seaport is okay, but don't be too excited.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for conventions...and those that like walking”
Reviews.Author: CaliKal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seaport for 6 nights during a conference at the convention center. I was a little disappointed that I wasn't assigned my preferred hotel/location of the Westin Copley. However, upon arrival everyone was very courteous and the room was fine. I thought the room was quite big compared to others I've stayed at in Boston. I travel for work 60% of my time and I'd say the room was average. In the end I am quite pleased with my stay here. * The hotel is 'service inclusive', meaning no one accepts tips. This may be why the price is a littler higher. No tipping the bellman, doorman, taxi whistle guy, housekeeping...etc. It did make things nice. * Wireless internet is throughout the hotel and is offered free...again, maybe you pay for that in your room price. This is extremely convenient though for a work trip. * I had meetings everyday at either the convention center or world trade center and the convenience of the hotel being next door is great. It's maybe a 5 minute walk to either one, and being able to go back to my room without having to wait in line for a taxi or shuttle at the end of the day was very nice. * Fitness center is great and no extra charge. There are personal TVs on each treadmill/elliptical/bike and you just plug in your headphones and select your channel. If you forget headphones you can buy them there. There was never anyone in there when I went either. I didn't see the pool... * Well, although I liked the location, it was for the convenience to the convention center and WTC. Like another post mentioned it really isn't near any of the restaurants/bars that make Boston such a fun city. However, Boston is a fairly small and compact city and very walker friendly. I walked to the North End one night and it took 30 minutes. It's a very nice walk along the water and wharfs, cut through Columbus Park onto Richmond and you'll hit Hanover street which is the heart of the North End (boston's Little Italy). Go to Antico Forno at 93 Salem for brick oven baked Gnocchi...delicious. And after that, hit Mike's Pastry for some of the best cannolis and pistachio macaroons (you can see why I hit the fitness center so much). I also walked to the Back Bay in about 40 minutes, again a great walk and you can cut through Boston Commons and the Public Garden. So the location is not great to get somewhere in a hurry, but there are plenty of cabs that will get you just about anywhere in a max of 15 minutes. Plus the T is very efficient and frequent. If you're coming for business, especially at the convention center/WTC it's a great place. If you're coming for a vacation, I would probably stay somewhere else, just to really experience the city.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Seaport in the past for business and events at the hotel. Never memorable, but not bad. My most recent stay was most disappointing. I was attending an event and the group arranged for my room, but not under my name so the hotel did not realize I was a "repeat customer". The room was decent. Supposedly they did major renovations, but all they did was a doorbell and changed the bedsheets. hardly a renovation. We came back from the event and no turn down had occured. They always did turn down before including bottled water. I called the operator and was informed they do not do turn down for everyone and they stopped bringing water to the rooms a few months ago. When I told him that they always do turn down for me he told me that they do turn down for repeat customers. As it was almost 11pm, he said "well there's really nothing I can do now, so what do you want?" If they are really a 4 Star hotel, turn down is expected and should be the norm. I would go out of my way to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: GoAwaySoon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night, while attending a convention. We live about an hour outside of Boston, but never drive in the city, so we didn't know how hard it would be to find the hotel. We used the directions on the hotel web site and it was easy to find the street, but the hotel itself isn't that well marked...lots of banners saying "Seaport something-or-other" but no real indication of where the hotel is - we ended up parking in their lot across the street and dragging our suitcases over. If you can find it, I'd recommend using the valet as it is much easier and the same price. Check-in is at 3 and we arrived about 10:30 and our room was ready. Front desk was extremely courteous and answered all questions. Lobby is very nice. A staff member was in the lobby checking to make sure everyone had what they needed - paper, cab, etc. Room was very nice - corner room. Very clean. Very comfortable bed. Very nice furnishings. Bathroom was very nice and clean. Bigger than others we've had at Boston hotels. Had drinks in the bar. Great location and views. Super service. Had dinner in the restaurant there. Top notch service and food. Very impressive! Prices matched quality. Had the brunch buffet the next morning. The omlet was one of the best I've ever had. The rest of the buffet food probably was excellent when it was hot, but when we got there is was luke-warm at best. Slow service (seating, getting the chef, etc.) Price a bit high for what we got. Paper delivered to door in AM. Check out was easy (although not as friendly as the check-in). No tipping is allowed in the hotel (you pay a set "service fee" with the bill). Beautiful views (we walked all over the hotel, checking out the views from the Ballrooms, etc.). Great business services. Great gym. But oddly, the room safe was one of those tiny ones, not big enough for a laptop! Great time! Wished we were able to stay a few more nights. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TravelAgent Review”
Reviews.Author: LovelyDove
Reviews.Content: I went to the Seaport to work at the World Trade Center which is across the street from the Seaport. Location was fantastic Cabs easily available in front of hotel Doormen very friendly and personable, MOST of hotel staff same AURA Bar/Resteraunt.... quite overpriced (but its a hotel resteraunt what do you expect?) Aura BAR food ... decent to okay The rooms furnishings and decor were average of a Radisson or low budget Marriott Overall, we got the hotel free b/c was for business and if I had to work the area again, this hotel would be fine for 1-3 nights Had pool but NO JACUZZI or steam room/sauna They did CHARGE us for the minibar which was NEVER touched (even had the string still attached) but they waived off our bill

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and see the Red Sox on Father's Day!!!”
Reviews.Author: NBPT
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice and above average. The hotel staff was extremely pleasant and went out of there way at every chance. My wife bought a package they offered for Father's day and I brought my 6 year old son with me. The pool was awesome with great views (windows all around it) and we had it almost all to ourselves! We were able to get to the ball game very easily now that the Big Dig is almost all done so I'd say that this hotel is extremely easy to get to and it offers underground parking. The streets are wide and very well planned for easy access to any part of Boston. I'd definately do it again and my son will remember this experience for the rest of his life! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey but comfortable...location is ok”
Reviews.Author: pm85
Reviews.Content: I just spent a Saturday night at the Seaport with my wife. At $200> for a room, we had some high expectations. Since we've stayed at the Hotel Marlowe (an awesome experience) in Cambridge, most of the hotels in Boston just feel bland and average. Service: We found this to be a mixed bag. At check-in, our initial experience was just OK. We mentioned that it was our anniversary and requested a nice room. The clerk issued a mild shrug and then provided our keys. We were both dissapointed. The room was small, bland, and simply had a view of the nearby building. It was nothing special. However, after discussing the situation with the concierge, we were placed in a very comfortable mini suite with 2 rooms (bed room and 2nd room with couch and TV). We did not have a view of the water, but the room was comfortable and nice. The concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. Location: We took a harbor cruise, so the location was excellent. The hotel is located next to the world trade center and across from the pier. There is also a MBTA stop adjacent to the hotel. The area feels very 'corporate' and not like traditional boston. Think conventions, office buildings, and a pier. It does have very easy access to I93, so getting into/out of the area is extremely easy. The hotel bar is nice and the interior is clean and fresh. The decoration is a bit bland and neutral. Without our requirement to walk to the harbor cruise, I'd rather stay at the Marlowe or try the Onyx.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Seaport Hotel in Boston is a very good choice for business travel, though on the pricey side, but then you'd expect this in a major city like Boston. The hotel seems fairly new and is very convenient to Logan Airport. The hotel is directly across the street from the harbor and you can catch a water taxi, cross the harbor and then get a free shuttle bus right at the dock to your airport terminal---a 5 minute ride, fairly painless. The Spirit of Boston dinner cruise boat is also directly across the street as well as the WTC convention center and several seafood restaurants. The hotel was clean, service good, appointments nice but the room itself I felt was on the small side. The furnishings were good but I expected more for the money except for the bathroom which was tops. A nice touch was the Bose Wave alarm clock/radio which provided really great wake-up music, not one of those little cheapies you usually get. I was on the 14th floor and the views were great but I wasn't in the room long enough to appreciate it. There was a bar/lounge on the lobby level serving food and a pricey restaurant. I ate in the bar and had a $10 hamburger. The bun was humongous, the burger smallish and overdone. Overall I liked the place and would return but if coming on vacation or tourist travel I would select a place more centrally located to the sites. As it was we were a couple mile walk to the Quincy Market, etc. although you could take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Had wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend at the Seaport Hotel while seeing a concert at the "Pavillion" in Boston. We were with a group of eight who wanted to stay here. After having read some negative reviews I decided that I really wanted to stay at the Boston Harbor Hotel as I already know that I love it there. However since the deluxe king room there was more than double the price at the Seaport I decided to stay there with the group; more politically correct anyway. Am I really glad we did! We had a wonderful time. The staff was just terrific and I love the service being included. You never tip here and everyone bends over backward to be courteous. I don't think I've ever had so many people say good morning to me in a hotel. The deluxe king room was the same size as at the Boston Harbor which was plenty of room. I don't understand the "small room size' complaint. I was not guaranteed a harbor view but for the money that was OK. Lucky me I got a harbor view from the 15 floor. It was wonderful. The bed and pillows were also very comfortable. Down feather pillows which I always use.The new silver line for the MBTA (subway) for Boston is open next door so getting around town is now a breeze. We walked to the New England Aquarium on Sunday along the "Harbor Walk". It was very pleasant and we needed the exercise after our huge buffet breakfast Sunday morning. I also ordered from room service several times and it was quick and very good. Saturday evening I wanted a desert that was not listed on the room service menu. No problem, they were happy to oblige. It is true that the hotel is geared toward business visitors, there is a complimantary business center and two computers in the lobby area for guest use. I was not interested in this but some guests not working could still enjoy e-mail. Overall I think this hotel is great; particularly for the price and the friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Grommit7
Reviews.Content: I had fairly low expectations of this hotel based on some of the previous reviews. I was pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff and the good service I received throughout my stay. My check-in was a breeze and I was given a corner room with a nice view of the harbor. While the room itself was fairly bland, it was comfortable, clean and overall pleasing to my very particular taste. I agree that the location is not ideal for a tourist, but for a business traveler, the location is quite good. Overall, I had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night - nice hotel, great location to the wharf. We did the dinner cruise on Spirit of Boston - just had to walk over and get on the boat. Would definitely stay here again. Comfortable bed too.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer dissapointment - With no expectations”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaW
Reviews.Content: My fiance surprised me on our anniversary weekend (memorial day weekend) with a little getaway into Boston (our neighboring city and where in fact, we had both gone to college) since we were too busy with work to manage a more distant trip. I'd like to preface this by saying that given that since this was a complete surprise to me, I had zero expectations. I will be very frank - I have stayed in many hotels ranging from a Four Seasons to a Super 8; as well as many hotels in Boston. The #1 criteria for me are these: a.) Cleanliness and b.) Customer Service and c.) Value. If you're paying for grade A service, you are entitled to receive it, if you are paying for B service, don't expect A service. At best, I'd say our room was small, though it was clean. I was surprised at the rates we were charged for standard size room. The bed covering seemed cheap, and bed itself was uncomfortable to merely sit on. Aside from that, it was about the size and aesthetic of a dorm room with carpeting. Location - For people visiting, I would strongly suggest you stay closer to the city as this hotel is really meant for business purposes. The area completely shuts down at night and there is nothing to see once you take a stroll through the deserted courtyard. An empty wharf, a shut down warehouse and what appeared to be a seafood restaurant somewhere down the way. All in all, we spent about 1/2 an hour in the room, surveying the contents and trying to make do with what was available to us. After seeing the completely deserted restaurant, and realized there really were not any available areas for even a quick snack we decided to try elsewhere. What made me give this review a 'Terrible' as opposed to an Okay or even a Neutral, was the attitude the Manager downstairs dispensed to us after we had very amicably explained our situation. We were not expecting a 100% full refund. That would have been nice, and in my mind, probably the best customer service they could have provided -- but CERTAINLY not the argument of "you are from the area, you should know better." Instead of walking away from the situation with both parties satisfied, the manager on duty chose to charge us $50, openly claiming we had dirtied the room after we offered for them to come up and please look at the room we were given [for condition and quality], claim that our complaint or reason for leaving was bogus all in somewhat of a distasteful manner. I think, the charge may have been fair, I expected better manners, customer service and poise from a hotel that praises themselves in the regard in which they do on their website and I'm completely dissapointed that we have extended ourselves to what we thought was an A/B Hotel and was met with D or Failing service and paid for it. I only hope that sharing my experience will help the hotel reform their management or deter some visitors from wasting their time. If you are a visitor to Boston, I have always, always had great luck with the Marriot Copley. You can easily find your way to the waterfront via cab or T and the rooms are easily 2x-3x the size with 3x the quality of what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Florida.Girl.2006
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The staff is exceptional and the hotel is beautiful! You do not have to tip... in fact they will not accept tips. The front desk has the best recommendations for food. The bathroom was beautiful and the beds are comfortable. We would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip with our pup to Boston. The staff was terrific and we felt exceptionally welcome. The indoor pool was great, but it is a small lap pool and they should have a kiddie area. The indoor gym was good too. The weather was terrible one day and my husband and I enjoyed having a casual dinner in the bar area watching the boats and the airplanes take off from Logan. Yes, the location isn't prime b/c you have to schlep to the subway. It is close to the children's museum.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT customer service BAD location if you're a tourist”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ROOMS: Average. Nothing great, not luxury if that's what you are expecting. Feels very business class, in other words, beige and cream interior, ship theme art, blonde wood furniture that has an IKEA feel to it. Again, nothing great. I only paid a special rate of $99 so to me, it was fine. If I had paid normal rates I would have been disappointed. Bathrooms are great, I liked the city, the marble and granite, the water pressure in the shower was good. The tubs are not deep though, so don't expect a long comfortable soak. Mattress and Pillows are great. TV movies are $10.95, not worth it. ROOM TIP:Ask for upper floor harborside because most city side views give you a view of a large building. GYM: Nice. Clean. Small hallway shape. Rude receptionist, acted like I was bothering her by asking where cardio machines were located (my first time). Mostly men on business trips trying to maintain 55+ yr old bodies. Not an eye candy gym. Clean though, nice clean locker room. RECEPTION/CONCIERGE: Friendly, Informative, Professional. Best part of experience. LOCATION: BAD unless you are attending conference at the World Trade Center, which is attached. City is so close, but yet so far, no public transportation so you either walk 30 minutes to attractions or you call a cab because they don't stay in the area for long. Only good walking distance resturant is Anthony's Pier = seafood is great. ROOM SERVICE: Room service is $26 for a 10" cheese pizza (after fees and tax) so call Domino's - they deliver right to your room. Resturant in the hotel lacks ambiance. Food is overpriced but okay to the palette. Gift shop, lobby, bar, lobby, bake shop are all very nice but very "business" class feeling - nothing really special or exclusive. CLEANLINESS: Five Stars. No hairs in tub or on floor or sink which is rare in frequently visited hotels. The room sparkled, which to me, matters immensely. Would I stay again? Yes if I were attending a trade show, NO if I were there to hang out in Boston because the location totally -----.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Boston, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCA
Reviews.Content: The Seaport represents one of the best deals in Boston. If you can deal with being a mile or so from Downtown you can get a 5 Star Hotel at a bargain price. The accomodations are excellent, especially the "corner" rooms. Restaurant and bar serve great food. The staff are helpful. The staff cannot except tips, so gratuity is added automatically to everything. The hotel offers free internet access and wireless access everywhere. I highly recommend this hotel if you can stand being away from the "downtown" action.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location not ideal for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off I must state that I do not travel often, and thus do not stay in hotels very often. I chose the Seaport because after reading various reviews for other Boston hotels, some of which weren't great, I chose Seaport for the good reviews I had read about it, and because the price wasn't too over the top. I'll start with what I liked about the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and they answered every question I had to my satisfaction. Check in and out were quick, baggage was delivered to the room promptly, and picked up within 5 minutes of my call to the front desk upon departure. They even gave my 1 year old daughter a little teddy bear while we were checking in. They supplied us with brochures and driving directions for things my family wanted to do outside of the city. As far as staff goes, I would rate the Seaport top notch. The computers in the lobby with high speed net access were nice when I wanted to check my email. The free USA Today paper weekday mornings was a nice surprise that I did not know about. About the room. It was very clean, but other than that was nothing special. There were enough draws and closet space for 2 adults and 1 child for our 5 day stay. Upon arrival, the crib, refrigerator, and microwave we requested were already there in the room. The view from the room was nothing amazing. Very deceiving is the main picture that most travel sites use for the Seaport. It looks as if the building is free standing on the water with nothing around it. Well either that picture is old or has been edited, because there are buildings as tall or taller on either side of it, which cuts down on the view dramatically. The bed in the room was also rather uncomfortable. The bathroom was nice with the marble tile and counters, but the water pressure for taking a shower was awful. The toilet was also very noisy when flushing, which wasn't fun with a baby sleeping in the room if you know what I mean! We did not use the gym or the pool at all, so I cannot really review them. I had wanted to use the pool, but again the pictures you see online are a bit deceiving, as the pool is much smaller that it appears, so with all the kids in there I decided against it. The restaurant sure smelled great every time we walked past it. I heard good things about it, so we decided to have breakfast there one morning. The food was nothing special, all the basics, pancakes, eggs, bacon, cereal, etc. For $42 for that, for 2 people, needless to say it was the first and last time we ate there. Parking for the hotel is in a public lot below the building. It is $25 a day for self park, or $35 for valet. I opted for self park, which was fine, but depending on the time you go to park, you may have a decent walk to an elevator since it fills up at times. There are outdoor lots right down the block that signs said were $7 or $8, so they might be worth looking into to save some money. There is a lot of construction going on in Boston right now, and a LOT of it is in the area around the Seaport. While they claim the hotel is in walking distance of things like the aquarium and Quincy Market, unless you feel like walking past noisy and dusty areas, you wont be walking too many places around the hotel. All is not lost though, since free shuttles run all day from just outside the hotel into a few spots more centrally located in the city, up until midnight. They don't run on weekends though which kinda stinks. Overall I guess I would recommend the hotel. It was a pleasant stay other than the few minor gripes I listed. The surroundings are basically out of the hotel's control, but it would be nice if they informed of such things.

HotelInfo.Name: Seaport Boston Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Seaport Lane, Boston, MA 02210
